<pre><code>public class ListMenu {
public int icon, highscore;
public String title;

public ListMenu(){
    super();
}

public ListMenu(int icon, String title, int highscore){
    super();
    this.icon = icon;
    this.title = title;
    this.highscore = highscore;
}
</code></pre>

<p>And this is my ListMenuAdapter class :</p>

<pre><code>public class ListMenuAdapter extends ArrayAdapter&lt;ListMenu&gt; {
Context context;
int layoutResourceId;
ListMenu listmenu[] = null;

static class MenuHolder{
    ImageView imgMenuIcon;
    TextView txtTitle, txtHighScore;
}

public ListMenuAdapter (Context context, int layoutResourceId, ListMenu[] listmenu){
    super(context, layoutResourceId, listmenu);
    this.context = context;
    this.layoutResourceId = layoutResourceId;
    this.listmenu = listmenu;
}

@Override
public View getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
    View row = convertView;
    MenuHolder holder = null;

    if(row == null)
    {
        LayoutInflater inflater = ((Activity)context).getLayoutInflater();
        row = inflater.inflate(layoutResourceId, parent, false);

        holder = new MenuHolder();
        holder.imgMenuIcon = (ImageView)row.findViewById(R.id.imgMenuIcon);
        holder.txtTitle = (TextView)row.findViewById(R.id.txtTitle);
        holder.txtHighScore = (TextView)row.findViewById(R.id.txtHighScore);

        row.setTag(holder);
    }
    else holder = (MenuHolder)row.getTag();

    ListMenu menu = listmenu[position];
    holder.imgMenuIcon.setImageResource(menu.icon);
    holder.txtTitle.setText(menu.title);
    holder.txtHighScore.setText(menu.highscore);

    return row;
}
</code></pre>

<p>I followed and modified my codes from this tutorial : <a href=""http://www.ezzylearning.com/tutorial.aspx?tid=1763429"" rel=""nofollow"">click here</a></p>

<p>Sorry for the long post, i really dont know what to do now
Thanks :D</p>

12667103,"<p>If the threading module is available, the logging module will use <code>threading.current_thread().name</code> to set the <code>threadName</code> LogRecord attribute.</p>

<p>But the <a href=""http://docs.python.org/library/threading.html#threading.current_thread"" rel=""nofollow"">docs</a> for <code>threading.current_thread</code> say that a dummy thread object will be used if the current thread was not created by the threading module (hence the ""Dummy-x"" name).</p>

<p>I suppose it would be possible to monkey-patch <code>threading.current_thread</code> to reset the name to something more appropriate. But surely a much better approach would be to make use of the <code>extra</code> dictionary when logging a message:</p>

<pre><code>logging.Formatter('%(levelname)-8s %(asctime)s %(qthreadname)-15s %(message)s')
...
extras = {'qthreadname': get_qthreadname()}
logging.warning(message, extra=extras)
</code></pre>

",1349060994,3,python pyqt qthread,How to set the name of a QThread in pyqt?,984421
12683466,"<p><code>tcsetpgrp</code> is to specify what is the foreground job. When your shell spawns a  job in foreground (without <code>&amp;</code>), it should create a new process group and make that the foreground job (of the controlling terminal, not whatever's on STDIN). Then, upon pressing CTRL-Z, that job will get the TSTP. It's the terminal that suspends the job, not your shell. Your shell shouldn't trap TSTP or send TSTP to anyone.</p>

<p>It should just <code>wait()</code> for the job it has spawned and detect when it has been stopped (and claim back the foreground group and mark the job as suspended internally). Your <code>fg</code> command would make the job's pgid the foreground process group again and send a <code>SIGCONT</code> to it and wait for it again, while <code>bg</code> would just send the <code>SIGCONT</code></p>
",1349091219,12683467,False,"<p>I'm coding a basic shell in C, and I'm working on suspending a child process right now.</p>

<p>I think my signal handler is correct, and my child process is suspending, but after that, the terminal should return to the parent process and that's not happening.</p>

<p>The child is suspended, but my shell isn't registering any input or output anymore. tcsetpgrp() doesn't seem to be helping.</p>

<p>Here's my signal handler in my shell code for SIGTSTP:</p>

<pre><code>void suspend(int sig) {
    pid_t pid;
    sigset_t mask;
    //mpid is the pgid of this shell.
    tcsetpgrp(STDIN_FILENO, mpid);
    tcsetpgrp(STDOUT_FILENO, mpid);
    sigemptyset(&amp;mask);
    sigaddset(&amp;mask, SIGTSTP);
    sigprocmask(SIG_UNBLOCK, &amp;mask, NULL);
    signal(SIGTSTP, SIG_DFL);
    //active.pid is the pid of the child currently in the fg.
    if (active.pid != 0) {
        kill(active.pid, SIGTSTP);
    }
    else{
        //if this code is being run in the child, child calls SIGTSTP on itself.
        pid = getpid();
        if (pid != 0 &amp;&amp; pid != mpid){
            kill(pid, SIGTSTP);
        }
    }
    signal(SIGTSTP, suspend);
}
</code></pre>

<p>Can anyone tell me what I'm doing wrong?</p>

<p>Am I suspending my shell along with the child, and do I need to return stdin and stdout to the shell somehow? How would I do this?</p>

<p>Thanks!</p>
",1349060996,0,shell process c signals,"After suspending child process with SIGTSTP, shell not responding",1627296
12667105,"<p>The main reason for executing the launching of your application in this way is that you have no guarantee in what thread you application will ever be started from.</p>

<p>(As noted by several kind commentators, the main thread is guaranteed <em>not to be</em> the EDT)</p>

<p>The importance of this comes down to the fact that you should only ever modify UI related code from within the EDT.  Doing otherwise will result in unexpected behavior (if you're lucky) and/or dirty repaints.</p>

<p>Some resources I suggest you become familiar with;</p>

<ul>
<li><a href=""http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/concurrency/dispatch.html"" rel=""nofollow"">The Event Dispatch Thread</a></li>
<li><a href=""http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/painting-140037.html"" rel=""nofollow"">Painting in AWT and Swing</a></li>
</ul>

<p>You could also have a read of <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7439522/why-does-my-boilerplate-java-desktop-app-jframe-use-eventqueue-invokelater-in-th"">Why does my boilerplate Java desktop app JFrame use EventQueue.invokeLater in the main method?</a></p>

<p><strong>UPDATE</strong></p>

<p>This is the <a href=""http://bitguru.wordpress.com/2007/03/21/will-the-real-swing-single-threading-rule-please-stand-up/"" rel=""nofollow"">blog</a> I've been trying to find :P</p>

<p>This basically explains why it's important to sync your <code>main</code> with the EDT before getting started, it also describes some of the details about why.</p>

<p>It also describes why many developers make this fundamental mistake when starting there applications (basically, we were told we could, but we never were really allowed to...bad us)</p>

12667111,"<p>I don't think that there is limit on practical value of lambda. You chose what works best for your problem and stick to it. For example if you have too many features and too little data then model will tend to overfit, you'd have to fight it with greater lambda (better thing to do would be get more data or remove some features). On the other hand if you have lots of data with relatively small number of features overfitting will not be such a big issue and lambda can be smaller.</p>

<p>One way to chose Lambda is to train your model with values of lambda [A .. B] (where A>0, B>A) and then plot cost function on cross validation set. It will be close to a convex curve, lambda corresponding to the global minima will be the optimal one.</p>

<p>For a more complete explanation please watch this lecture: <a href=""https://class.coursera.org/ml/lecture/preview/63"" rel=""nofollow"">https://class.coursera.org/ml/lecture/preview/63</a></p>

<p>It could be that jQuery allows you to define your own named durations, or had planned on the possibility, so this would handle the case where someone wants to use the name <code>""default""</code>.</p>

<p>So it's just a convention used. The underscore itself doesn't change the nature or behavior of the property.</p>

<p><em>NOTES</em> </p>

<p><em>- The calculation cannot include fields from other tables or queries.</em></p>

<p>Consider whether a query to supply the calculated field would be an acceptable alternative.  Or, with a form or report, you could add a control and use its control source property to perform the calculation.</p>

",1349064485,12667439,False,"<p>As stated I'm working with an iterator of my ArrayDeque, fringe, to find the tile with the lowest path cost Node.  Here's the Code:</p>

<pre><code>public static void UCS(String filename)
{
    //a double-ended queue, when used with ""addFirst"" and ""remove"", it's a LIFO queue
    ArrayDeque&lt;Node&gt; fringe = new ArrayDeque&lt;Node&gt;();
    //initial tile set
    ArrayList&lt;Tile&gt; tileSet = getTilesFromFile(filename);
    //start state has no placed tiles, and all tiles are in the unplaced list
    State startState = new State(new ArrayList&lt;Tile&gt;(),tileSet);
    //the node that goes with the start state, it has 0 path and step cost, and a null parent
    Node root = new Node(startState,0.0,0.0,null);
    //the fringe starts with just the root node
    fringe.addFirst(root);

    //These are for keeping track of the best solution since
    //we don't just need /a/ solution, we need the best one
    //after generating the whole tree
    double bestCost = Double.MAX_VALUE;
    State bestSolution = null;

    Iterator itr = fringe.iterator();

    //we go until there are no nodes left to be expanded
    while(!fringe.isEmpty())
    {
        double lowestCost = Double.MAX_VALUE;
        Node lowestCostNode = root;

        for (int i = 0; i &lt; fringe.size(); i++)
        {
            if (((Node) itr.next()).getPathCost() &lt; lowestCost)
            {
                lowestCost = ((Node) itr.next()).getPathCost();
                lowestCostNode = ((Node) itr.next());   
            }
        }
        //grab the node at the front of the FIFO queue
        Node currNode = lowestCostNode;
        fringe.remove(currNode);
        //if it is a goal state and the path cost is better than the best
        //goal state we've seen so far, it's the new best
        if(currNode.getState().isGoal() &amp;&amp; currNode.getPathCost() &lt; bestCost)
        {
            bestCost = currNode.getPathCost();
            bestSolution = currNode.getState();
        }

        //generate all child nodes and put them in the fringe 
        //at the back of the FIFO queue
        ArrayList&lt;Node&gt; childNodes = currNode.expand();
        for(Node c : childNodes)
        {
            fringe.addFirst(c);
        }
    }

    //print the solution along with the cost
    //you should also print the number of nodes generated and the amount of time it took
    //to perform the search
    System.out.println(bestSolution);
    System.out.println(""Cost of best solution: ""+bestCost);
}
</code></pre>

<p>Some of the logic is probably still off I'm sure, but I'll figure that out when I get around this problem.  Also ignore the weird comments and things like that, a lot of this is copy-pasted from a BFS method.  The issue I get is with the line:</p>

<pre><code>lowestCost = ((Node) itr.next()).getPathCost();
</code></pre>
",1349061459,0,java iterator arraydeque,Trying to work with an ArrayDeque iterator to make a Uniform Cost Search Method,180100
12667134,"<p>This is a basic problem. It's not a <code>trunc</code> problem but is a classic ""compare a value with the <code>average</code> value over entire table(or a subset)"".</p>

<p>A classic approach would be to get the avg in a separate query that returns a scalar:</p>

<pre><code>select 
   order_id, 
   order_date, 
   trunc(ship_date-order_date) as shipping_time 
from product_order 
where 
  trunc(ship_date-order_date) &gt; (select avg(trunc(ship_date-order_date)) 
                                 from product_order);
</code></pre>

<p>Another approach would be(using an analytical function):</p>

<pre><code>select * 
from(
    select 
       order_id, 
       order_date, 
       trunc(ship_date-order_date) as shipping_time 
       avg(trunc(ship_date-order_date)) over() as avgshipping
    from product_order 
    )
where shipping_date &gt; avgshipping;
</code></pre>

    &lt;property name=""address"" column=""address"" type=""string""  /&gt;

</code></pre>

<pre><code>$this-&gt;view-&gt;editForm-&gt;getElement('value')
    -&gt;getDecorator('Errors')-&gt;setOption('escape', false);
</code></pre>

",1349061515,2,php zend-framework zend-form-element zend-view html-tag,What causes html tags to not render in Zend_Element error decorators?,283366
12667140,"<p>There is a problem in your <code>FoodGroup</code> constructor, you haven't initialized some of the instance variables, so their taking the <code>null</code> default valu, giving you problems:</p>

<pre><code>public FoodGroup() {
    //...
    //null pointer exception here!
    expirationDate.set();
    //null pointer exception here!
    purchaseDate.set();
    //null pointer exception here!
    location.set();
    //...
}
</code></pre>

<p>This problem can be solved by creating those variables before using them:</p>

<pre><code>public FoodGroup() {
    //...
    expirationDate = new Date();
    //not null pointer exception!
    expirationDate.set();
    //similar to the other cases
    //...
}
</code></pre>

<p>Some advices for this and future projects:</p>

<ul>
<li>Don't create classes that has a similar name that classes in the Java API. For example, your <code>Date</code> class can easily be misunderstood with <code>java.util.Date</code>.</li>
<li>Don't use the <code>Vector</code> class, instead use <code>List&lt;YourClass&gt; list = new ArrayList&lt;YourClass&gt;()</code>. More info here: <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2986296/what-are-the-differences-between-arraylist-and-vector"">What are the differences between ArrayList and Vector?</a> and <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/a/1386288/1065197"">Why is Java Vector class considered obsolete or deprecated?</a>(this one is from <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/users/22656/jon-skeet"">Jon Skeet</a>).</li>
<li>Try to use public constructors for your classes. In your case, your program will compile and run just because all your classes are in the same package, but if they were in different packages, there will be a problem because almost all the constructors has the <code>default</code> visibility and can only be seen by classes of the same package. Take note about it: <a href=""http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/accesscontrol.html"" rel=""nofollow"">Controlling Access to Members of a Class</a></li>
<li><code>FoodGroup</code> is not a parent class, it is a ""has-a"" relationship between 1) <code>FoodGroup</code> and <code>Date</code>, 2) <code>FoodGroup</code> and <code>Location</code>. It could be seen as a controller who <em>controls</em> the behavior and live of both classes instances.</li>
<li>When you post code here or other sites, <strong>please</strong> post a <a href=""http://sscce.org/"" rel=""nofollow"">SSCCE</a> instead of your whole code. In that way, it will be easier for anyone to help you.</li>
</ul>

<pre><code>package GroceryReceiptProgram;

import java.io.*;
import java.util.Vector;

public class Date {

    private int hour, minute, day, month, year;

    Date() {
        try {
            BufferedReader keyboard = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
            System.out.println(""What's the hour? (Use 1-24 military notation"");
            hour = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            System.out.println(""what's the minute? "");
            minute = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            System.out.println(""What's the day of the month?"");
            day = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            System.out.println(""Which month of the year is it, use an integer"");
            month = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            System.out.println(""What year is it?"");
            year = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            keyboard.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println(""Yo houston we have a problem"");
        }

    }

    public void setHour(int hour) {
        this.hour = hour;
    }

    public void setHour() {
        try {
            BufferedReader keyboard = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
            System.out.println(""What hour, use military notation?"");
            this.hour = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            keyboard.close();
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            System.out.println(e.toString() + "":doesnt seem to be a number"");
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println(e.toString());
        }
    }

    public int getHour() {
        return hour;
    }

    public void setMinute(int minute) {
        this.minute = minute;
    }

            System.out.println(""What minute?"");

            System.out.println(e.toString() + "": doesnt seem to be a number"");
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println(e.toString() + "": minute shall not cooperate"");
        } catch (NullPointerException e) {
            System.out.println(e.toString() + "": in the setMinute function of the Date class"");
        }
    }

    public int getMinute() {
        return minute;
    }

    public void setDay(int day) {
        this.day = day;
    }

    public void setDay() {

            this.day = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());
            keyboard.close();
        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
            System.out.println(e.toString() + "":doesnt seem to be a number"");
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println(e.toString());
        }
    }

        return day;
    }

    public void setMonth(int month) {
        this.month = month;
    }

    public void setMonth() {

        return month;
    }

        this.year = year;
    }

    public void setYear() {

        holder.add(minute);
        holder.add(month);
        holder.add(day);
        holder.add(year);
        return holder;

<p>their parent(What is the proper name?) class</p>

<pre><code>package GroceryReceiptProgram;

    import java.io.*;

    public class FoodGroup {

        private int price, count;
        private Date purchaseDate, expirationDate;
        private Location location;
        private String name;

        public FoodGroup() {
            try {
                setPrice();
                setCount();
                expirationDate.set();
                purchaseDate.set();
                location.set();
            } catch (NullPointerException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "": in the constructor of the FoodGroup class"");
            }
        }

        public void setPrice(int price) {
            this.price = price;
        }

        public void setPrice() {
            try (BufferedReader keyboard = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in))) {
                System.out.println(""What Price?"");
                price = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());

            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "":doesnt seem to be a number"");
            } catch (IOException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "": in the FoodGroup class, setPrice function"");
            } catch (NullPointerException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "": in FoodGroup class. SetPrice()"");
            }
        }

        public int getPrice() {
            return price;
        }

        public void setCount(int count) {
            this.count = count;
        }

        public void setCount() {
            try (BufferedReader keyboard = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in))) {
                System.out.println(""What count?"");
                count = Integer.parseInt(keyboard.readLine());

            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "":doesnt seem to be a number"");
            } catch (IOException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "": in the FoodGroup class, setCount()"");
            } catch (NullPointerException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString() + "": in FoodGroup class, setCount"");
            }
        }

        public int getCount() {
            return count;
        }

        public void setName(String name) {
            this.name = name;
        }

        public void setName() {
            try {
                BufferedReader keyboard = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
                System.out.println(""What minute?"");
                this.name = keyboard.readLine();

            } catch (IOException e) {
                System.out.println(e.toString());
            }
        }

        public String getName() {
            return name;
        }

        public void setLocation(Location location) {
            this.location = location;
        }

        public Location getLocation() {
            return location;
        }

        public void setPurchaseDate(Date purchaseDate) {
            this.purchaseDate = purchaseDate;
        }

        public void setPurchaseDate() {
            this.purchaseDate.set();
        }

        public Date getPurchaseDate() {
            return purchaseDate;
        }

        public void setExpirationDate(Date expirationDate) {
            this.expirationDate = expirationDate;
        }

        public void setExpirationDate() {
            this.expirationDate.set();
        }

        public Date getExpirationDate() {
            return expirationDate;
        }
    }

",1349061575,0,google-apps-script,Geolocation not working with HtmlService,1491380
12667149,"<p>You're rebinding the click event every single time the popup opens, so each time you click the close button it'll fire it multiple times which will cause unexpected behaviour.</p>

<p>Eg:</p>

<pre><code>var Popup = function(){
    $('#ok-button').live('click',function(){
        $('#popup').remove();
    });                
};
</code></pre>

<p>This code means every time you create a new Popup instance, every single $('#ok-button') that exists will have another click event bound to it.</p>

<p>As for the reason why it immediately closes when you use keydown vs keypress, that's due to the fact that the moment the popup is opened you've set the focus to the button. </p>

<p>The two key events work differently (firing at slightly different times during the key process). It appears that with keydown, you're changing the focus in the middle of the actual action (pressing the button on the keyboard) which then continues and triggers the focused click.</p>

<p>Removing the focus stops the weird double trigger behaviour because you're no longer binding another click event.</p>

<p>I'd suggest changing your click event:</p>

<pre><code>$('#ok-button').live('click', function(){
    $('#popup').remove();
}); 
var Popup = function(){
    // Whatever               
};
</code></pre>

<p>I'd also suggest looking at <a href=""http://api.jquery.com/on/"" rel=""nofollow"">jQuery's on event</a> instead of using live.</p>
",1349061981,12667180,False,"<p>I am trying to create to popup div when pressing enter key, while the div contains a button (that I script to focus when it fired up) that will close the div when you press enter again. I receive the enter key from binding <code>keypress</code> and <code>keydown</code>, end up having different results.</p>

<p><strong>Binding 'keypress'</strong></p>

<p>Things work properly, with first enter key fires up a popup box and another enter key to dismiss the popup box.</p>

<p>Refer this <a href=""http://jsfiddle.net/mochatony/SBxEH/1/"" rel=""nofollow"">JSFiddle</a>.</p>

<p><strong>Binding 'keydown'</strong></p>

<p>This doesn't work correctly, as it fires up and dismiss the popup box immediately (which you won't see) with only one enter key.</p>

<p>Refer this <a href=""http://jsfiddle.net/mochatony/SBxEH/"" rel=""nofollow"">JSFiddle</a>.</p>

<p>My question is why would keydown generate odd behavior, it is like firing enter key twice for me, but the truth it wasn't. If I remove the button focus(), it will works correctly. That's puzzled me. </p>

<p>Tested with firefox and chrome.</p>
",1349061614,2,javascript,Keypress and Keydown generate different behavior,851251
12667151,"<p>html-in-xml would be an invalid XML document, and need to be fixed at the source generating the xml. e.g. it's impossible for an XML parser to tell what should be part of the XML and what's simply an html tag. e.g. xml should look like</p>

<pre><code>&lt;somexmltag&gt;&amp;lt;p&amp;gt;This is a paragraph with embedded &amp;lt;i&amp;gt;italics&amp;lt;/i&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/p&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/somexmltag&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>or using CDATA:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;somexmltag&gt;&lt;![CDATA[&lt;p&gt;This is a paragraph with embedded &lt;i&gt;italics&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;]]&gt;&lt;/somexmltag&gt;
</code></pre>
",1349061831,12667165,False,"<p>I have an XML document, the format of which looks something like below;</p>

<pre><code>&lt;root&gt;
&lt;DETAIL Replaces=""XYZ"" /&gt;
&lt;DETAIL Description=""Problem:&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;CRS750 dumps when panel F is opened&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&gt;&gt;y"" /&gt;
&lt;DETAIL StepsToReproduce=""ABC"" /&gt;
&lt;/root&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>Using the below function I'm able to convert the above loaded XML Doc to desired format;</p>

<pre><code>Function ProcessDetail(ByVal xmlText As String) As String
   xtr = New XmlTextReader(""GetXMLFileLocation"")
        xtr.WhitespaceHandling = WhitespaceHandling.None
        xmlDoc.Load(xtr)
        xtr.Close()

    Dim xmlDoc As New XmlDocument()
    xmlDoc.LoadXml(xmlText)
    Dim sDetail As New StringBuilder()
    sDetail.Append(""&lt;DETAIL&gt;"")
    For Each detailNode As XmlNode In xmlDoc.SelectNodes(""//DETAIL"")
        If Not detailNode.Attributes Is Nothing Then
            For Each attribute As XmlAttribute In detailNode.Attributes
 sDetail.Append(""&lt;"" &amp; attribute.Name.ToUpper &amp; ""&gt;"" &amp; attribute.Value &amp; ""&lt;/"" &amp;    
 attribute.Name.ToUpper &amp; ""&gt;"")
            Next
        End If
    Next
    sDetail.Append(""&lt;/DETAIL&gt;"")
    Return sDetail.ToString()
End Function
</code></pre>

<p>Question :- Since my description node under DETAIL has some 'HTML' tags , it gives the below error . Please help me avoid that and give the below output.</p>

<pre><code>ERROR MESSAGE : '&lt;', hexadecimal value 0x3C, is an invalid attribute character. Line 
1,  position 1326.


DESIRED OUTPUT :
 &lt;root&gt;

 &lt;REPLACES&gt;XYZ&lt;/REPLACES&gt;

 &lt;root&gt;
</code></pre>
",1349061650,0,.net xml vb.net xml-parsing xmlreader,How to Avoid html tags in an XML document,118068
12667153,"<p>It all depends on how you're going to define the processing model. Here are some things you need to consider first.</p>

<p>An <code>any</code> particle can't be constrained with a type. It comes with an attribute named <code>processContents</code> that could be <strong>skip</strong>, <strong>lax</strong>, and the default, <strong>strict</strong>. Once you understand exactly what it means, then going with <strong><em>skip</em></strong> simply means that you will not be able to enforce your mandatory attribute - the processor will do just that, ""skip"". If you set it <strong><em>lax</em></strong>, then it will process it <strong>only if</strong> the XSD describing the content is actually available, otherwise it'll skip; The third option <strong><em>strict</em></strong>, requires the XSD describing this extra content to be available - period.</p>

<p>So the <code>any</code> particle can be made to work only if the XSD describing the ""any"" is available during validation. The option I have in mind is kind of limiting, but it has the advantage of being the closest to the ""spirit"" of an any in that it wouldn't have to derive from a particular base type, or reference some atttributes; for this, a key constraint similar to would approximate your requirement:</p>

<pre><code>    &lt;xsd:key name=""ofid""&gt;
        &lt;xsd:selector xpath=""*""/&gt;
        &lt;xsd:field xpath=""@id""/&gt;
    &lt;/xsd:key&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>In effect, the key makes the attribute required. The downside may be that each value must be unique, too. Maybe with an attribute named <code>id</code> , it is expected;  if instead you wish to apply the pattern to something such as <code>age</code>, then it wouldn't work.</p>

<p>If you decide that having XSDs available at runtime is acceptable, then other alternatives may include use of abstract elements or elements with abstract types. The good thing is that it'll bring a more disciplined approach (you'll set the constraints clearly right from the beginning), and without placing uniqueness of values constraints. The downside could be that it creates coupling to another XSD which describes the ""contract"" - your mandatory attributes.</p>

<p>UPDATE: As per your comment, below is an alternative based on substitution groups. I tried to keep as much as possible your old XSD components names.</p>

<p><strong>Contract.xsd</strong>: This has the components of your contract. It basically describes the head of your substitution group; it indicates the need for an id attribute.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" ?&gt;
&lt;!--XML Schema generated by QTAssistant/XML Schema Refactoring (XSR) Module (http://www.paschidev.com)--&gt;
&lt;xsd:schema elementFormDefault=""qualified"" xmlns:xsd=""http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema""&gt;
    &lt;xsd:complexType name=""AnyChildType"" abstract=""true""&gt;
        &lt;xsd:attribute name=""id"" use=""required""/&gt;
    &lt;/xsd:complexType&gt;

    &lt;xsd:element name=""AnyElement"" abstract=""true"" type=""AnyChildType""/&gt;
&lt;/xsd:schema&gt;
</code></pre>

<p><strong>GenericInstance.xsd</strong>: It describes the root of your ""generic"" document. It ""integrates"" your contract in the context of your defined root element.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" ?&gt;
&lt;!--XML Schema generated by QTAssistant/XML Schema Refactoring (XSR) Module (http://www.paschidev.com)--&gt;
&lt;xsd:schema elementFormDefault=""qualified"" xmlns:xsd=""http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema""&gt;
    &lt;xsd:include schemaLocation=""Contract.xsd""/&gt;

    &lt;xsd:element name=""AnyElements"" type=""AnyRootType""/&gt;
    &lt;xsd:complexType name=""AnyRootType""&gt;
        &lt;xsd:sequence&gt;
            &lt;xsd:element ref=""AnyElement"" maxOccurs=""unbounded""/&gt;
        &lt;/xsd:sequence&gt;
    &lt;/xsd:complexType&gt;
&lt;/xsd:schema&gt;
</code></pre>

<p><strong>SpecificInstance1.xsd</strong>: A particular contract.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" ?&gt;
&lt;!--XML Schema generated by QTAssistant/XML Schema Refactoring (XSR) Module (http://www.paschidev.com)--&gt;
&lt;xsd:schema elementFormDefault=""qualified"" xmlns:xsd=""http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema""&gt;
    &lt;xsd:include schemaLocation=""Contract.xsd""/&gt;

    &lt;xsd:element name=""SomeElement1"" substitutionGroup=""AnyElement""&gt;
        &lt;xsd:complexType&gt;
            &lt;xsd:complexContent&gt;
                &lt;xsd:extension base=""AnyChildType""&gt;
                    &lt;xsd:annotation&gt;
                        &lt;xsd:documentation&gt;Any content goes.&lt;/xsd:documentation&gt;
                    &lt;/xsd:annotation&gt;
                &lt;/xsd:extension&gt;
            &lt;/xsd:complexContent&gt;
        &lt;/xsd:complexType&gt;
    &lt;/xsd:element&gt;
&lt;/xsd:schema&gt;
</code></pre>

<p><strong>SpecificInstance2.xsd</strong>: Another contract (shows a different authoring style).</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" ?&gt;
&lt;!--XML Schema generated by QTAssistant/XML Schema Refactoring (XSR) Module (http://www.paschidev.com)--&gt;
&lt;xsd:schema elementFormDefault=""qualified"" xmlns:xsd=""http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema""&gt;
    &lt;xsd:include schemaLocation=""Contract.xsd""/&gt;

    &lt;xsd:element name=""SomeElement2"" substitutionGroup=""AnyElement"" type=""SomeElement2Type""/&gt;
    &lt;xsd:complexType name=""SomeElement2Type""&gt;
        &lt;xsd:complexContent&gt;
            &lt;xsd:extension base=""AnyChildType""&gt;
                &lt;xsd:annotation&gt;
                    &lt;xsd:documentation&gt;Any content goes.&lt;/xsd:documentation&gt;
                &lt;/xsd:annotation&gt;
            &lt;/xsd:extension&gt;
        &lt;/xsd:complexContent&gt;
    &lt;/xsd:complexType&gt;
&lt;/xsd:schema&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>Visually this is how they're tied together. You can see that the coupling between XSDs is maintained at minimum. </p>

<p><img src=""http://i.stack.imgur.com/wzSfM.png"" alt=""enter image description here""></p>

<p>A sample XML, valid in the scope defined by your generic instance, and the specific ones.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" standalone=""yes""?&gt;
&lt;!-- Sample XML generated by QTAssistant (http://www.paschidev.com) --&gt;
&lt;AnyElements xmlns:xsi=""http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance""&gt;
    &lt;SomeElement1 id=""1""/&gt;
    &lt;SomeElement2 id=""1""/&gt;
&lt;/AnyElements&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>If you're limited to validate your XML using one XSD only, below would be an XSD just for that:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8"" ?&gt;
&lt;!--XML Schema generated by QTAssistant/XML Schema Refactoring (XSR) Module (http://www.paschidev.com)--&gt;
&lt;xsd:schema elementFormDefault=""qualified"" xmlns:xsd=""http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema""&gt;
    &lt;xsd:include schemaLocation=""GenericInstance.xsd""/&gt;
    &lt;xsd:include schemaLocation=""SpecificInstance1.xsd""/&gt;
    &lt;xsd:include schemaLocation=""SpecificInstance2.xsd""/&gt;
&lt;/xsd:schema&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>I've tested the above with XSD 1.0 running on .NET; having the ability to run on XSD 1.1 or particular features in other XSD processors would invalidate some of what I've said.</p>
",1349108969,12677297,True,"<p>I have an XML which can have any element such as:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;AnyElements&gt;
  &lt;Any1 id=""any1"" /&gt;
  &lt;Any2 id=""any2"" /&gt;
  ...
&lt;/AnyElements&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>But <code>id</code> attribute is mandatory.</p>

<p>How can i define such a xsd?</p>

<pre><code>&lt;xs:element name=""AnyElements"" type=""AnyRootType"" /&gt;
&lt;xs:complexType name=""AnyRootType""&gt;
  &lt;xs:sequence&gt;
    &lt;xs:any type=""AnyChildType"" minOccurs=""1"" maxOccurs=""unbounded""/&gt;
  &lt;/xs:sequence&gt;
&lt;/xs:complexType&gt; 

&lt;xs:complexType name=""AnyChildType""&gt;
  &lt;xs:attribute ref=""id"" use=""required""/&gt;
&lt;/xs:complexType&gt;

&lt;xs:attribute name=""id"" type=""xs:string""/&gt;
</code></pre>

12667188,"<p>Sounds like you need, <code>PDO::FETCH_CLASSTYPE</code>. <a href=""http://php.net/manual/en/pdostatement.fetch.php"" rel=""nofollow"">From the manual</a>:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>PDO::FETCH_CLASS: returns a new instance of the requested class,
  mapping the columns of the result set to named properties in the
  class. If fetch_style includes PDO::FETCH_CLASSTYPE (e.g.
  PDO::FETCH_CLASS | PDO::FETCH_CLASSTYPE) then the name of the class is
  determined from a value of the first column.</p>
</blockquote>

12667192,"<p>substring differs between C# &amp; javascript</p>

<p>Eg., strInput = ""0123456789""</p>

<h1>In C#  ==> Substring(int startIndex, int length)</h1>

<pre><code>     strInput.SubString(2,3) == will output ==&gt; ""234""
</code></pre>

<h1>In Javascript ==> substring(int startIndex, int endIndex)</h1>

<pre><code>     strInput.substring(2,3) == will output ==&gt; ""2""
</code></pre>

<p>instread try to use </p>

<pre><code>     strInput.substr(2,3) == will output ==&gt; ""234""
</code></pre>

<p>Note : </p>

<p>in javscript</p>

<pre><code>     substring(Start character position, End Character position) 

     substr(Start character position, length of Character) 
</code></pre>

 {
        string _str = str;

        int _iAdditionalLenght = 0;

        for (int i = lenght; i &lt; str.Length; i++)
        {
            if (_str.Substring(i, 1) == "" "")
                break;

            _iAdditionalLenght++;
        }

        return str.Substring(0, str.Length &lt; (lenght + _iAdditionalLenght) ? str.Length : (lenght + _iAdditionalLenght));

 }
</code></pre>

<pre><code>function TrimString(str, lengthStr) { //this is my testing 4
     var _str = str;
     var _iAdditionalLenght = 0;
     for (var i = lengthStr; i &lt; str.length; i++) {
       if (_str.substring(i, 1) == "" "")
           break;
       _iAdditionalLenght++;
     }

     return str.substring(0, str.length &lt; (lengthStr + _iAdditionalLenght) ? str.length : (lengthStr + _iAdditionalLenght));
 }
</code></pre>

",1349062264,0,java process red5 rtmp,Why Red5 close after few seconds of inactivity?,1448704
12667202,"<p>I think you can consider using <a href=""http://docs.python.org/library/collections.html#collections.namedtuple"" rel=""nofollow""><code>collections.namedtuple</code></a> for this purpose:</p>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; from collections import namedtuple
&gt;&gt;&gt; MakeOrigin = namedtuple('MakeOrigin', ['make', 'origin'])
&gt;&gt;&gt; MakeModel = namedtuple('MakeModel', ['make', 'model'])
&gt;&gt;&gt; A = [MakeModel('Chevy', 'Suburban'), MakeModel('Toyota', 'Camry'), MakeModel('Honda', 'Civic')]
&gt;&gt;&gt; B = [MakeOrigin('Chevy', 'America'), MakeOrigin('Toyota', 'Japan'), MakeOrigin('Honda', 'Japan')]
&gt;&gt;&gt; AB = [[a.make, a.model, b.origin] for a in A for b in B if a.make == b.make]
&gt;&gt;&gt; AB
[['Chevy', 'Suburban', 'America'], ['Toyota', 'Camry', 'Japan'], ['Honda', 'Civic', 'Japan']]
</code></pre>

<p>It is more readable and allows more interesting operations.</p>

<hr>

<p>Without using <code>namedtuple</code>:</p>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; A=[['Chevy','Suburban'],['Toyota','Camry'],['Honda','Civic']]
&gt;&gt;&gt; B=[['Chevy','America'],['Toyota','Japan'],['Honda','Japan']]
&gt;&gt;&gt; 
&gt;&gt;&gt; AB = [[a[0], a[1], b[1]] for a in A for b in B if a[0] == b[0]]
&gt;&gt;&gt; AB
[['Chevy', 'Suburban', 'America'], ['Toyota', 'Camry', 'Japan'], ['Honda', 'Civic', 'Japan']]
</code></pre>

",1349062292,2,python shapefile,plot shapefile in python,1253952
12667210,"<p>I would definitely not calculate their rank every time you display them.</p>

<p>A simple, and not so performant solution would be to cache post rankings, and once one post's ranking changes, you clear or refresh the cache.</p>

<p>That is not ideal, but it is possible.</p>

<p>Another way would be to do as you alluded to: calculate and store ranks in the database (and ideally cache them), and then refresh those rankings using a cron job every x minutes.</p>

<p>Again, these are basic approaches to what you want to do. You can then build on them over time.</p>

<p>The algorithm you choose will most likely be very particular to your needs.</p>

<p>You need to also gauge what kind of traffic your site would be getting, as it would dictate what kind of lengths you should go through to get the right algorithm.</p>

",1349062349,3,php mysql algorithm,How do I incorporate the Reddit page/post ranking algorithm?,1262713
12667212,"<p>Do you want to delete it from the database or just from the list?</p>

<p>In the former case, do</p>

<pre><code>@users.each do |u|
  u.delete if u.id == 12
end
</code></pre>

<p>In the latter, do</p>

<pre><code>@users.reject! do |u|
  u.id == 12
end
</code></pre>

<p>or, if the condition is some method on user returning ""true""/""false""-ish values,</p>

<pre><code>@users.reject! &amp;:is_12

class User &lt; ActiveRecord::Base
  def is_12
    self.id == 12
  end
end
</code></pre>

12667219,"<p>Here's a LINQ sample that assumes DateMemberAttribute and IgnoreForAllAttribute are mutually exclusive</p>

<pre><code>IEnumerable&lt;PropertyInfo&gt; MyProperties(object o)
{
   o.GetType().GetProperties()
    .Where(p =&gt; !(p.DeclaringType is Base))
    .Where(p =&gt; p.GetCustomAttributes(false).Any(a =&gt; a is DataMemberAttribute)
}
</code></pre>

<p>And a sample assuming the attributes are NOT mutually exclusive</p>

<pre><code>IEnumerable&lt;PropertyInfo&gt; MyProperties(object o)
{
   o.GetType().GetProperties()
    .Where(p =&gt; !(p.DeclaringType is Base))
    .Where(p =&gt; 
       { 
          var attributes = p.GetCustomAttributes(false);
          return attributes.Any(a =&gt; a is DataMemberAttribute)
             &amp;&amp; !attributes.Any(a =&gt; a is IgnoreForAllAttribute);
       }
}
</code></pre>
",1349067565,12667724,True,"<p>I have the following base, middle and derived classes below::</p>

{
    [DataMemberAttribute()]
    public int ValueBase { get; set; }

    [IgnoreForAllAttribute(""Param1"", ""Param2"")]
    public int IgnoreBase { get; set; }
}

public class Middle : Base
{
    [DataMemberAttribute()]
    public int ValueMiddle { get; set; }

    [IgnoreForAllAttribute(""Param1"", ""Param2"")]
    public int IgnoreMiddle { get; set; }
}

public class MostDerived : Middle
{
    [DataMemberAttribute()]
    public int ValueMostDerived { get; set; }

    [IgnoreForAllAttribute(""Param1"", ""Param2"")]
    public int IgnoreMostDerived { get; set; }
}
</code></pre>

",1349062469,1,c# .net system.reflection,Reflection exclude all attributes from base class and specific attribute from all other derived classes,431359
12667222,"<p>You can manually add a title attribute to each list item like this. Give it a shot:</p>

<pre><code>    private void PopulateFacilityDropdown(List&lt;FacilityAvailableByLocation&gt; facilities, int? selectedID)
    {
        DropDownListFacility.DataSource = facilities;
        DropDownListFacility.DataTextField = ""FacilityName"";
        DropDownListFacility.DataValueField = ""FacilityID"";
        DropDownListFacility.DataBind();            
        DropDownListFacility.Items.Insert(0, new System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem(String.Empty, String.Empty);                   

        foreach (FacilityAvailableByLocation f in facilities)
        {
            DropDownListFacility.Items.FindByValue(f.FacilityID).Attributes.Add(""title"", f.TitleDescription);
        }

        if (selectedID.HasValue &amp;&amp; selectedID.Value &gt; 0)
            DropDownListFacility.SelectedIndex = facilities.FindIndex(b =&gt; b.FacilityID == selectedID.Value);
            else DropDownListFacility.SelectedIndex = 0;
        }
    }
</code></pre>

<p>f.TitleDescription would be the property you want the title to be.</p>

    &lt;option value=""2"" title=""Option 2 Desc""&gt;Option 2&lt;/option&gt;

12667227,"<p>you are missing the <code>where</code>, other than that it looks like you have some type errors.</p>

<ol>
<li><code>[a]</code> is too general</li>
<li><code>/</code> only works on fractional types.  </li>
</ol>

<p>so</p>

<pre><code>plane :: Int -&gt; [(Int,Int)]
plane c = cart [-1*c .. 1*c] [-2*c .. 1*c] c where
    cart xs ys c = [(y `div` c,x `div` c) | x &lt;- xs, y &lt;- ys]
</code></pre>

<p>might be what you want.  Smallest change from what you have that more or less works.</p>

",1349062548,1,java redirect,How to read from a file that was redirected,738746
12667234,"<p>Version 1 is pretty straightforward and runs linear, so the runtime of that is O(n) on average.</p>

<p>Version 2 is a bit more interesting.   It runs with n(n-1) <em>on average</em>, which is O(n<sup>2</sup>).  There's an early <code>return</code> in this loop, so it's definitely possible that it could break as early as the first two elements.</p>

<p>Version 3 is trickier.  You have to be careful on this. The second loop will only run if <code>arr[i]</code> is <code>true</code>.  The runtime of it has to be put into distinct categories then.</p>

<ul>
<li>If all elements of the array are false, then your runtime will be O(n).</li>
<li>If half of the elements of the array are true, then you will be running the second loop on a condition of (n(n-1))/2, which is O(n<sup>2</sup>).</li>
<li>If all of the elements of the array are true, then you will be running in O(n<sup>2</sup>).  You will also immediately exit after the first two elements, but you're still using two loops to perform the action.</li>
</ul>

<p>It's safe to say then that the <em>average</em> and <em>worst</em> runtime for Version 3 will be O(n<sup>2</sup>).  Its best would be O(n), which is definitely possible.</p>
",1349063569,12667332,False,"<p>The method <code>hasTwoTrueValues</code> return <code>true</code> if at least two values in an array of <code>boolean</code> are <code>true</code>. Provide the Big-O running time for all three implementations proposed.</p>

<p>// <strong>Version 1</strong></p>

<pre><code>public boolean hasTwoTrueValues(boolean[] arr) {
    int count = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i &lt; arr.length; i++)
        if(arr[i])
            count++;
        return count &gt;= 2;
}
</code></pre>

<p>// <strong>Version 2</strong></p>

<pre><code>public boolean hasTwoTrueValues(boolean[] arr) {
    for(int i = 0; i &lt; arr.length; i++)
        for(int j = i + 1; j &lt; arr.length; j++ )
            if(arr[i] &amp;&amp; arr[j])
                return true;
}
</code></pre>

<p>// <strong>Version 3</strong></p>

<pre><code>public boolean hasTwoTrueValues(boolean[] arr) {
    for(int i = 0; i &lt; arr.length; i++)
        if(arr[i])
            for(int j = i + 1; j &lt; arr.length; j++)
                if(arr[j])
                    return true;
                        return false;
}
</code></pre>

<p>These are my answers:</p>

<ul>
<li><strong>Version 1</strong> is <code>O(n)</code></li>
<li><strong>Version 2</strong> is <code>O(n^2)</code></li>
<li><strong>Version 3</strong> is <code>O(n^2)</code></li>
</ul>

<p>I am really new to this Big-O Notation so I need guidance if my answers are correct/incorrect. If I'm wrong, could you please explain and help me to learn?</p>

12667242,"<p>I started with a slightly different solution than you linked to, because I found the syntax in that example a little murky (although it is shorter). Then I create columns for the labels and their y positions, and plot the labels using <code>geom_text()</code>.</p>

<pre><code>require(ggplot2)
require(plyr)

#set up the data frame, as in the previous example
cls.grp &lt;- gl(n=4,k=20,labels=c(""group a"",""group b"",""group c"", ""group d""))
ser &lt;- sample(x=c(""neg"",""pos""),size=80,replace=TRUE, prob=c(30,70))
syrclia &lt;- data.frame(cls.grp,ser)

#create a data frame with the 'metadata' you will plot
ct &lt;- ddply(syrclia, ""cls.grp"", count) #count the occurrences of each cls.group type
ct &lt;- ddply(ct, ""cls.grp"", transform, frac=freq/sum(freq)*100) #calculate frequencies as percentages
ct$frac_to_print &lt;- """"

cutoff &lt;- 30 #define the cutoff, below which you will not plot percentages
ct$frac_to_print[which(ct$frac &gt; cutoff)] &lt;- paste(ct$frac[which(ct$frac&gt;cutoff)], ""%"") 
ct &lt;- ddply(ct, ""cls.grp"", transform, pos = cumsum(freq)) #calculate the position for each label

ggplot(ct, aes(x=cls.grp, y=freq)) + 
  geom_bar(aes(fill=ser)) + 
  geom_text(aes(x=cls.grp, y=pos, label=frac_to_print))
</code></pre>

12667243,"<p>Javascript doesn't have classing or inherintence, it has prototyping and scope. As a general rule of thumb, prototyping is used if</p>

<p>1: The object is used more than once, and 2: If the code to prototype is shorter than just hardcoding/creating such objects</p>
",1349063286,12667310,False,"<p>It seems that when using Javascript's Prototypal Inheritance, we would still typically do this, say, if it is programming a game of Mario Kart:</p>

<pre><code>Object
    |---GameObject
        |---KartDriver
        |   |---Yoshi
        |   |---Mario
        |   |---ShyGuy
        |
        ----WeaponObject
            |---RedShell
            |---BlueShell
            |---BananaPeel
</code></pre>

<p>so the <code>GameObject</code> might have a 3D coordinate of where it is in the GameWorld, and a 3D model of points and surfaces to draw on the screen, and so forth.</p>

<p>So we have this generic object first, and then we inherit more generic objects based on it, in this case, the <code>KartDriver</code> and the <code>WeaponObject</code>.</p>

<p>And even <code>Yoshi</code> might be a generic object, that if there are 8 players and 2 of them chose the same character (in an online race), then there will be 2 Yoshi objects, and Yoshi also became a generic object.</p>

<p>Or even the GameWorld object, might seem it is a concrete and unique object, but if the server hosts 30 races at the same time (with each race usually 5 to 8 people), there in fact there will be 30 GameWorld objects.</p>

<p>But on a 3DS console, the GameWorld would be just 1 object, so in this case it is not a generic object, or maybe we can say it is a generic object, but there will be a singleton object based on it.</p>

<p>Is it true that the typical Javascript Prototypal Inheritance pattern will usually be like this?  It might be extremely rare that it is purely based on ""concrete object"" inheritance?  If there are such usage, what might be the situation that a Javascript purely uses ""concrete objects"" and have no ""generic objects""?</p>

<p><strong>Update:</strong> I ask this question because Prototypal Inheritance typically is said to be ""classless"" and object-based.  But it also seems that we'd create  generic objects first, for the concrete objects to be based on, so this ""generic object"", in a way, also feel like a ""class"".  That is, even if we don't write code to make Javascript's inheritance to become a classical inheritance structure (class-based), and purely just use prototypal inheritance (object-based), we would still more often than not, use ""generic objects"" which do look like classes.</p>

<p><strong>Update 2</strong>: if we see a class as a ""blueprint"" of how an object is constructed, in classical OOP, then this generic object method also involves blueprints for objects, but just that it is more dynamic and not static like Objective-C.  For example, we can dynamically add a property to <code>KartDriver</code> object and now all Yoshis and Marios will inherit from it.  So looking at this blueprint design, it in fact is ""class"" and not ""classless"".  Just that this is dynamic class, while the classical OOP is static class.</p>
",1349062718,0,javascript oop prototype prototype-programming prototypal-inheritance,"When using Javascript, is it true that we typically will still make ""Generic Objects"" and use it as ""templates"" for other concrete objects?",699129

",1349835053,12811007,False,"<p>I use the following HTML template with an  to hand to a UIWebView.   I understand that this is the supported way to play youtube videos.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;html&gt;
&lt;body&gt;
    &lt;!-- 1. The &lt;iframe&gt; (and video player) will replace this &lt;div&gt; tag. --&gt;
    &lt;div id=""player""&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

    &lt;script&gt;
        // 2. This code loads the IFrame Player API code asynchronously.
        var tag = document.createElement('script');
        tag.src = ""http://www.youtube.com/player_api"";
        var firstScriptTag = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
        firstScriptTag.parentNode.insertBefore(tag, firstScriptTag);

        // 3. This function creates an &lt;iframe&gt; (and YouTube player)
        //    after the API code downloads.
        var player;
        function onYouTubePlayerAPIReady() {
            player = new YT.Player('player', {
                                   playerVars: {'autoplay' : 1},
                                   height: 'VIDEO_HEIGHT',
                                   width: 'VIDEO_WIDTH',
                                   videoId: 'VIDEO_ID',
                                   events: {
                                   'onReady': onPlayerReady,
                                   'onStateChange': onPlayerStateChange
                                   }
                                   });
        }

        // 4. The API will call this function when the video player is ready.
        function onPlayerReady(event) {
            event.target.playVideo();
        }

        // 5. The API calls this function when the player's state changes.
        //    The function indicates that when playing a video (state=1),
        //    the player should play for six seconds and then stop.
        var done = false;
        function onPlayerStateChange(event) {
            if (event.data == YT.PlayerState.PLAYING &amp;&amp; !done) {
                setTimeout(stopVideo, 6000);
                done = true;
            }
            if (event.data == YT.PlayerState.ENDED) {
                event.target.clearVideo();
                done = true;
            }
        }
        function stopVideo() {
            player.stopVideo();
        }
        &lt;/script&gt;
&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>Obviously, I substitute in the dynamic values for the HEIGHT, WIDTH and VIDEOID params.   This has always worked fine under iOS 5 on iPhone and iPad. 12667254,"<p>Had a total facepalm moment when re-looking at this problem today:</p>

<p>The ""message"" property on my Zend_Session_Namespace is actually a magic property (accessed using __get and __set), and is not identifiable through reflection (which is how PHPUnit tests for the existence of the property under the call to assertObjectHasAttribute).</p>

<p>Removing the assertion from the test allows it to continue, and my test now fails at the expected point and not prematurely.</p>
",1349163006,12686121,True,"<p>I'm writing unit tests for a login system - but having difficulties with interacting with the Zend_Session_Namespace object. I'm using the Zend_Test extensions to the PHPUnit framework (ZF 1.10, PHPUnit 3.4.5)</p>

<pre><code>public function testAuthFailure()
{
  $request = $this-&gt;getRequest();
  $request-&gt;setMethod(""POST"");
  $request-&gt;setPost(""username"", ""testUser"");
  $request-&gt;setPost(""password"", ""testPassword"");

  $this-&gt;dispatch(""/auth/login"");

  $this-&gt;assertModule(""auth"");
  $this-&gt;assertController(""login"");
  $this-&gt;assertAction(""validate"");

  $loginSession = new Zend_Session_Namespace(""login"");
  $this-&gt;assertFalse(is_null($loginSession));
  $this-&gt;assertObjectHasAttribute(""messages"", $loginSession);
  $this-&gt;assertFalse(empty($loginSession-&gt;messages));
  $this-&gt;arrayHasKey(""error"", $loginSession-&gt;messages[""error""]);
  $this-&gt;assertEquals($loginSession-&gt;messages[""error""], ""Could not log you in with that username and/or password"");
}
</code></pre>

<p>Current controller/action code</p>

<pre><code>public function validateAction()
{
  $loginSession = new Zend_Session_Namespace(""login"");

  if (!$this-&gt;buildForm()-&gt;isValid($this-&gt;getRequest()-&gt;getPost())) {
    $loginSession-&gt;messages[""error""][] = ""Please enter your username and password"";
  }

  $loginSession-&gt;messages[""error""][] = ""Could not contact the authentication server"";

  $this-&gt;getResponse()
    -&gt;setHttpResponseCode(303)
    -&gt;setHeader(""Location"", ""/auth/login"");
}
</code></pre>

",1349062789,0,php unit-testing zend-framework session phpunit,Unit testing with Zend_Session_Namespace,184124
12667258,"<p>@ravi,</p>

<p>Hey, PhoneGap is working on WebView and this is created on HTML5. You know html have not directly supported sqlite. So, In phonegap inbuilt function. </p>

<p>In Phonegap Create first time database on Application Directory and use always this database by the Syntex. For More info Please Read <a href=""http://docs.phonegap.com/en/1.2.0/phonegap_storage_storage.md.html"" rel=""nofollow"">this</a>. </p>

<p>You can Create a new Project and in index.html only Copy Pest this Syntex.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;
&lt;html&gt;
  &lt;head&gt;
    &lt;title&gt;Contact Example&lt;/title&gt;

    &lt;script type=""text/javascript"" charset=""utf-8"" src=""phonegap-1.2.0.js""&gt;&lt;/script&gt;
    &lt;script type=""text/javascript"" charset=""utf-8""&gt;

    // Wait for PhoneGap to load
    //
    document.addEventListener(""deviceready"", onDeviceReady, false);

    // Populate the database 
    //
    function populateDB(tx) {
        tx.executeSql('DROP TABLE IF EXISTS DEMO');
        tx.executeSql('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS DEMO (id unique, data)');
        tx.executeSql('INSERT INTO DEMO (id, data) VALUES (1, ""First row"")');
        tx.executeSql('INSERT INTO DEMO (id, data) VALUES (2, ""Second row"")');
    }

    // Query the database
    //
    function queryDB(tx) {
        tx.executeSql('SELECT * FROM DEMO', [], querySuccess, errorCB);
    }

    // Query the success callback
    //
    function querySuccess(tx, results) {
        var len = results.rows.length;
        console.log(""DEMO table: "" + len + "" rows found."");
        for (var i=0; i&lt;len; i++){
            console.log(""Row = "" + i + "" ID = "" + results.rows.item(i).id + "" Data =  "" + results.rows.item(i).data);
        }
    }

    // Transaction error callback
    //
    function errorCB(err) {
        console.log(""Error processing SQL: ""+err.code);
    }

    // Transaction success callback
    //
    function successCB() {
        var db = window.openDatabase(""Database"", ""1.0"", ""PhoneGap Demo"", 200000);
        db.transaction(queryDB, errorCB);
    }

    // PhoneGap is ready
    //
    function onDeviceReady() {
        var db = window.openDatabase(""Database"", ""1.0"", ""PhoneGap Demo"", 200000);
        db.transaction(populateDB, errorCB, successCB);
    }

    &lt;/script&gt;
  &lt;/head&gt;
  &lt;body&gt;
    &lt;h1&gt;Example&lt;/h1&gt;
    &lt;p&gt;Database&lt;/p&gt;
  &lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;
</code></pre>

i want to know how to convert sql lite to websql and is there any application to create web sql

12667260,"<p>You may need to throw together your own custom class for that. I looked around and couldn't find any libraries specifically for that purpose, but creating your own shouldn't be to hard.</p>

<p>Here is a list of the frequencies for different musical notes:
<a href=""http://www.seventhstring.com/resources/notefrequencies.html"" rel=""nofollow"">http://www.seventhstring.com/resources/notefrequencies.html</a></p>

<p>You could create a class that uses these numbers and compares the sound to each frequency to see which it is.</p>

<p>Turning the wav file input to frequencies will require a FFT. Here is a link to a question that explains how to do just that.
<a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4214214/wav-file-as-frequency-image"">Wav File As Frequency Image</a></p>

<p>EDIT:
Here is the whole code for RecipeList.java:</p>

<pre><code>public class RecipeList extends ListActivity{
Typeface font;
Typeface bold;

@Override
protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.recipelist);

    font = Typeface.createFromAsset(RecipeList.this.getAssets(), ""Book Antiqua.ttf"");

    TextView recipe = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.textViewrecipe);

    recipe.setTypeface(font, Typeface.BOLD);
        setListAdapter(new MyAdapter(RecipeList.this, android.R.layout.simple_list_item_1,R.id.textViewCategory,getResources().getStringArray(R.array.categories)));
        this.getListView().setCacheColorHint(0);



}
private class MyAdapter extends ArrayAdapter&lt;String&gt; {

    public MyAdapter(Context context, int resource, int textViewResourceId,
            String[] strings) {
        super(context, resource, textViewResourceId, strings);
    }

@Override
public View getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent) {
    LayoutInflater inflater = (LayoutInflater) getSystemService(Context.LAYOUT_INFLATER_SERVICE);
    View row = inflater.inflate(R.layout.recipelistrow, parent, false);
    String [] items = getResources().getStringArray(R.array.categories);


    ImageView iv = (ImageView) row.findViewById(R.id.imageViewRecipe);
    TextView tvCategory = (TextView) row.findViewById(R.id.textViewCategory);
    TextView tvCategoryDesc = (TextView) row.findViewById(R.id.textViewcategorydesc);

    tvCategory.setTypeface(font, Typeface.BOLD);
    tvCategory.setText(items[position]);

    if(items[position].equals(""Burritos"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_burritos);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Burritos, with tasty combination of beef and beans, make it an enticing dish for your family and friends"");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Tacos"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_tacos);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Taco counts a favorite for its versatility and variety. It's perfect for meat lovers and veggie lovers too!"");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Enchiladas"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_enchiladas);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Enchilada makes the perfect match for your favorite salsa. Make it a bit spicy. It's awesome!"");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Fajitas"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_fajitas);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Fajita is well-loved for its exquisite and delightful filling. It's a choice of either beef or boneless chicken."");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Quesadillas"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_quesadillas);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Quesadillas are filled with oozing goodness and mouthwatering flavors that you will find it hard to resist."");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Salads"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_salads);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Eat healthy and feel healthy with your protein-rich salads. Cut-off your carbs with this Mexican dish."");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Chilis"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_chili);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Make an extraordinary appetizer out of your chili con carne and enjoy its tempting flavors."");
    }if(items[position].equals(""Other Delicacies"")){
        iv.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_list_otherdelicacies);
        tvCategoryDesc.setText(""Learn more about the Mexican recipes that are sinfully good!"");
    }
    return row;

    }
}
    @Override
    protected void onListItemClick(ListView l, View v, int position, long id) {
        super.onListItemClick(l, v, position, id);
        Intent i = new Intent(this, SubRecipeList.class);
        i.putExtra(""id"", id);


        View view = TabGroupActivity.group.getLocalActivityManager()
                .startActivity(""show_city"", i
                .addFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP))
                .getDecorView();


                TabGroupActivity.group.replaceView(view);



    }

    public void grocerylist (View v){
        Intent intent = new Intent(RecipeList.this, GroceryList.class);
        startActivity(intent);
    }
    public void recipe (View v){

        Intent i = new Intent(RecipeList.this, RecipeList.class);
        startActivity(i);
    }
    public void more (View v){

        Intent i = new Intent(RecipeList.this, MoreApps.class);
        startActivity(i);
    }


    @Override
    public void onBackPressed() {
        LayoutInflater inflater = (LayoutInflater) getSystemService(LAYOUT_INFLATER_SERVICE);
        View view = inflater.inflate(R.layout.grocerylistdelete, null);
        AlertDialog.Builder builder = new AlertDialog.Builder(getParent());
        builder.setView(view);

        Button yes = (Button) view.findViewById(R.id.buttonYes);
        yes.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() {

            public void onClick(View v) {
                Intent i = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_MAIN);
                i.addCategory(Intent.CATEGORY_HOME);
                i.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP);
                startActivity(i);
                finish();    

            }
        });

        Button no = (Button) view.findViewById(R.id.buttonNo);
        no.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() {

            public void onClick(View v) {
                Intent i = new Intent(getApplicationContext(), RecipeList.class);
                finish();
                startActivity(i);


            }
        });

        AlertDialog alert = builder.create();
        alert.show();


            }

    }

",1349062844,1,android back android-alertdialog,Gettin an error with custom alertdialog onbackpress,1436931
12667265,"<p>I dont know much about AudioFlinger, but to read the PCM data you can make use of AudioRecord and to write the PCM data you can use AUdioTrack to play the sound.</p>
",1349064443,12667432,False,"<p>I am checking the possibility of this way, if I got any silly thinking, please correct me.
I would like to enhance the audio quality. According to some knowledge from web, I found that When an <code>audio/music/sound</code> is played , the <code>AudioTrack</code> will <code>write()</code> PCM data to the sharedbuffer, and then <code>AudioFlinger</code> will <code>read()</code> the PCM data form this sharedbuffer.
The idea is to use a service to intercept the PCM data after it is wrote by <code>AudioTrack.write()</code>, modify the PCM data, and then restore it back to the sharedbuffer for <code>AudioFlinger</code> to <code>read()</code>;
Could anyone help/correct me, please?</p>
",1349062855,1,android pcm audiotrack audioflinger,Between AudioTrack.write and AudioFlinger.read,1589880
12667266,"<p>Yes it does - the question is how do you intend to write the files?</p>

<p>You can either upload direct to Cloud Storage using either <a href=""https://developers.google.com/storage/docs/gsutil"" rel=""nofollow"">gsutil</a> or <a href=""https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/python/blobstore/functions"" rel=""nofollow"">create_upload_url</a>, or you can write from your app using this <a href=""https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/python/googlestorage/"" rel=""nofollow"">files API</a>. </p>

<p>If you're using the file API then you need to read or write in chunks no larger than 32MB. </p>

<p>What problems can I expect?</p>

<p>I'm using the Python 2,7 Google App Engine SDK by the way.</p>

<p>Updates.</p>

<p>I intend to read up to a million rows of data from Google's Data Store ( or maybe the new NDB ), and save the data into a text file for further processing either on Google Cloud Compute or some third party services like PiCloud.</p>

<p>The data is basically a network relationship and it goes like this:</p>

<pre><code>A -&gt; B
B -&gt; C
A -&gt; D
</code></pre>

<p>The above means that A is linked to B, B is linked to C and A is linked to D and so on...</p>

<p>As i have over a million edges, i think i might have to use the task queue or cron job to do this?</p>

<p>So after i processed the relationships, i'll have another text file which contains some scores between each pair of nodes, which i will than write back into the database.</p>

<p>Best Regards.</p>

12672349,"<p>I did actually read the explanation of the ranking system and if I'm correct they do not care about the <em>current</em> time, but the <em>time of submission of the post</em>. This means the score will change on two points; 1) when the post is submitted, 2) when someone up- or downvotes the post</p>

<p>So you have to (re-)calculate the score when you post something, and when someone up- or downvotes. To recalculate the score isn't that heavy for the server (not at all actually), so just recalculate on vote-changes!</p>

",1349062927,0,backbone.js backbone-views,Instantiate view on backbone Router?,1112042
12667275,"<p>Push is used when accessing variables during rendering. In your case you are setting the value in the textfield to empty, and since that is all you are doing inside the push it is clear that the push tag is not doing anything useful.  </p>

<p>What I think you might be intending is to ""push"" student in the view, what would be the equivalent of appending ""student."" to all the variables. This is not what the push tag does, although I must admit such a tag would be useful and possibly save a lot of typing. We can see that the target of the action implements model driven (and the model is a Student), this effectively pushes the student to the top of the stack already, so simply remove the push tag and you should be good.</p>

<p>The following is advice:</p>

<p>Your action has a get/set Student... it should not if it implements ModelDriven. </p>

<p>Your class StudentAction, should probably be called AddStudentAction.</p>

<p>The addStudent method should be removed and the functionality moved into execute() ie:</p>

<pre><code>public String execute() throws Exception {
    student.setCreatedDate(new Date());
    studentService.add(student);
    return SUCCESS;
}
</code></pre>

<p>You should implement a validate method <code>public void validate()</code> (unless you're doing that in xml or annotations).  </p>

<p>Finally, this is personal preference but when you implement ModelDriven it helps to supply the type ie: <code>implements ModelDriven&lt;Student&gt;</code> (Then the IDE hopefully knows to create the correct getter/setter). </p>
",1349064488,12667440,True,"<p>Developing a demo application.</p>

<p><strong>Error:</strong> Can not resolve properties under push tag. name and age</p>

<p><strong>FORM:</strong></p>

<pre><code>&lt;s:form action=""addStudentAction"" method=""POST""&gt;
    &lt;s:push value=""student""&gt;
        &lt;s:textfield name=""name"" label=""Name : "" value="""" /&gt;
        &lt;s:textfield name=""age"" label=""Age : "" value=""""/&gt;
    &lt;/s:push&gt;
    &lt;s:submit/&gt;
&lt;/s:form&gt;
</code></pre>

<p><strong>Action &amp; model:</strong></p>

<pre><code>public class StudentAction extends ActionSupport implements ModelDriven {

    Student student = new Student();


    @Autowired
    StudentService studentService;

    public Object getModel() {
        return student;
    }

    public String execute(){
        return SUCCESS;
    }


    public String addStudent() throws Exception {
        student.setCreatedDate(new Date());
        studentService.add(student);
        return SUCCESS;
    }


    public Student getStudent() {
        return student;
    }

    public void setStudent(Student student) {
        this.student = student;
    }


}

package com.myapp.model;

import java.util.Date;

public class Student {

    private Long id;
    private String name;
    private Integer age;
    private Date createdDate;

    public Long getId() {
        return id;
    }

    public void setId(Long id) {
        this.id = id;
    }

    public String getName() {
        return name;
    }

    public void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }

    public Integer getAge() {
        return age;
    }

    public void setAge(Integer age) {
        this.age = age;
    }

    public Date getCreatedDate() {
        return createdDate;
    }

    public void setCreatedDate(Date createdDate) {
        this.createdDate = createdDate;
    }


}
</code></pre>

<p><strong>EDITED</strong></p>

    Student student = new Student();
    List&lt;Student&gt; studentList = new ArrayList&lt;Student&gt;();

    @Autowired
    StudentService studentService;

    public Student getModel() {
        return student;
    }

    public String execute(){
        return SUCCESS;
    }


    public String addStudent() throws Exception {
        student.setCreatedDate(new Date());
        studentService.add(student);
        return SUCCESS;
    }

}
</code></pre>

            &lt;action name=""addStudentAction"" class=""com.myapp.action.StudentAction"" method=""addStudent""&gt;
                &lt;result name=""success"" type=""redirectAction""&gt;listStudentAction&lt;/result&gt;
            &lt;/action&gt;

                &lt;result name=""success""&gt;/pages/student.jsp&lt;/result&gt;
            &lt;/action&gt;

",1349062954,4,java-ee struts2,"struts2 <s:push value=""student""> tag for textfield",514065
12667278,"<p><strong>This transformation</strong>:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;xsl:stylesheet version=""1.0"" xmlns:xsl=""http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"" &gt;
 &lt;xsl:output method=""text""/&gt;
 &lt;xsl:strip-space elements=""*""/&gt;

 &lt;xsl:template match=
 ""/nmaprun
    /host
      /ports
            /port
              [@portid='443'
              and @protocol='tcp']
                  /script[@id='ssl-cert' and @output]

 ""&gt;

   &lt;xsl:variable name=""vText"" select=""@output""/&gt;
   &lt;xsl:value-of select=
   ""concat('rsa ',
       substring-before
           (substring-after
              (substring-after($vText, 'rsa'),
               'bits: '),
            '&amp;#10;')
      )""
    /&gt;
 &lt;/xsl:template&gt;
&lt;/xsl:stylesheet&gt;
</code></pre>

</code></pre>

<h3>UPDATE</h3>

<p>This is the altered XSL File, I was able to finish it.  Please recommend any improvements, as I'm still learning XSL.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""UTF-8""?&gt;
&lt;xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl=""http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"" version=""1.0""&gt;
    &lt;xsl:output method=""text"" encoding=""utf-8""/&gt;
    &lt;xsl:strip-space elements=""*""/&gt;
    &lt;xsl:variable name=""delimiter"" select=""','""/&gt;

    &lt;xsl:template match=""/nmaprun/host""&gt;

        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""address[@addrtype='ipv4']/@addr""/&gt;
        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""$delimiter""/&gt;

        &lt;xsl:apply-templates select=""hostnames""/&gt;
        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""$delimiter""/&gt;

        &lt;xsl:apply-templates select=""os""/&gt;
        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""$delimiter""/&gt;

        &lt;xsl:apply-templates select=""ports""/&gt;
        &lt;xsl:text&gt;&amp;#10;&lt;/xsl:text&gt;
    &lt;/xsl:template&gt;


    &lt;xsl:template match=""hostnames""&gt;

        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""hostname[@type='PTR']/@name""/&gt;
    &lt;/xsl:template&gt;


    &lt;xsl:template match=""os""&gt;

        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""osclass[1]/@osfamily""/&gt;
    &lt;/xsl:template&gt;


    &lt;xsl:template match=""ports""&gt;

        &lt;xsl:apply-templates select=""port[@portid='443' and @protocol='tcp']/script[@id='ssl-cert' and @output]""/&gt;
    &lt;/xsl:template&gt;


    &lt;xsl:template match=""port[@portid='443' and @protocol='tcp']/script[@id='ssl-cert' and @output]""&gt;

        &lt;xsl:variable name=""vText"" select=""@output""/&gt;
        &lt;xsl:value-of select=""concat(443,'_',substring-before(substring-after($vText, '&amp;#10;Public Key type: '),'&amp;#10;'),'_',substring-before(substring-after($vText, '&amp;#10;Public Key bits: '),'&amp;#10;'))""/&gt;
    &lt;/xsl:template&gt;

&lt;/xsl:stylesheet&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>This is post-transformation output, </p>

<pre><code>192.168.100.3,sub2.example.com,Linux,
192.168.100.5,sub3.example.com,Linux,
192.168.100.6,sub4.example.com,Linux,443_rsa_2048
</code></pre>

<p>The 443 is the @portid, which contains the script id=""ssl-cert"" @output.<br>
The portid could be something other than 443, namely whatever was specified in the original scope.</p>

<p>The rsa is Public Key type:, which is contained in that crazy @output. Public Key type could be something other than rsa, such as dsa.</p>

<p>the 2048 is Public Key bits:, also contained in the @output. Additionally their could be more or less Public Key bits, than 2048. </p>

<p>Anything before 5.3 means you will probably have to rethink your current implementation/architecture for that particular class.</p>

12667282,"<p>You can create different configuration using the testing/Dev example : </p>

<p><em><strong>Step 1</em></strong>
Create as many web/app.php file as you have subdomain.</p>

<pre><code>web/app_subdomainx.php
</code></pre>

<p><em><strong>Step 2</em></strong>
In each app_subdomain_X.php file change configuration : </p>

<pre><code>$kernel = new AppKernel('subdomainx', false);
</code></pre>

<p><em><strong>Step 3</em></strong>
create configuration file matching your environment</p>

<pre><code>config_subdomainx.yml
security_subdomainx.yml
</code></pre>

<p><em><strong>Step 4</em></strong> </p>

<p>acces you specific domain through</p>

<p>/web/app_subdomainx.php</p>

<p><strong>PS :</strong> </p>

<p>Keep config.yml for common configuration (like db connection) and include config.yml into config_subdomainx.yml</p>

<pre><code>imports:
    - { resource: config.yml }
</code></pre>
",1349088928,12671922,False,"<p>This appears to be the scariest topic relating to Symfony2, as after a week of searching and testing, I am still unable to find an answer to this.</p>

<p>In short, I am building an application that will have several subdomains, and I would like a different configuraton for all of them, while sharing multiple bundles from /src, and more importantly, import central config and routes (As well as each app's own)</p>

<p>I went down the road of creating individual /app directories, AppKernal.php files and bootstrap files. The main issue with this is detailed in another question, which has recieved no answers (not that I blame anyone TBH :D).
<a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12632702/symfony2-multiple-config-and-routing-files-for-subdomain-routing"">Symfony2 multiple config and routing files for subdomain routing</a></p>

<p>I have found discussion on the matter, Fabian even takes part in this:
<a href=""https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/symfony-devs/yneojUuFiqw"" rel=""nofollow"">https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/symfony-devs/yneojUuFiqw</a> </p>

<p>And this discussion on a PR to github to provide support in version 2.2 (still 6mo away I hear)
<a href=""https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/3378"" rel=""nofollow"">https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/3378</a></p>

<p>Is there anyone out there who has done this before? Is the process easy enough to explain? Is there any information available to assist with this?</p>

<p>I'm pretty much at the stage where it appears this simply is not possible. Which I find really strange for a system as touted as Symfony, especially when it appears Symfony1.4 did this rather easily.</p>

<p><strong>Update</strong></p>

<p>Thanks for your responses. The challenge is, there is a hierarchy of configs. These configs in turn import their own routing.yml files.</p>

<p>For instance: the domain <a href=""http://testing.api.mydomain.com"" rel=""nofollow"">http://testing.api.mydomain.com</a> would include the following configs:</p>

<p>config_api.yml -> config_testing.yml -> config_dev.yml -> config.yml</p>

<p>All import their own routing.yml file. But only the one in config_api.yml is loaded. It seems framework: router: config option overrides previous usages in other config files, rather than extends. </p>

<p>In all fairness, the location of the app code is inconsequential. Having a hierarchical configuration with hierarchical routes seems to be the gotacha. </p>

<p>Cheers</p>
