12667593,"<p>You could let the cursor class wrap your nodes with a proxy, that would expose the same interface as the nodes to the visitor. Then no visitor can modify a node directly. The transaction logic can be put in the proxies or the proxies delegate back to the cursor for that.</p>
",1349116003,12678874,True,"<p>I want to revise my usage of the visitor pattern for tree-structures and different node types. Every node in the tree-structure has to implement a callback method and the visitor implementation must implement something like the following for each node type (or at least the types he's interested in):</p>

<pre><code>/**
 * Do something when visiting a {@link CommentNode}.
 * 
 * @param pNode
 *          the {@link CommentNode}
 */
EVisitResult visit(final @Nonnull CommentNode pNode);

/**
 * Do something when visiting an {@link ElementNode}.
 * 
 * @param pNode
 *          the {@link ElementNode}
 */
EVisitResult visit(final @Nonnull ElementNode pNode);
</code></pre>

<p>I'm using transactional cursor semantics to navigate through the tree-structure and provide an acceptVisitor-method, that is in the cursor I've implemented the following:</p>

<pre><code>@Override
public EVisitResult acceptVisitor(final @Nonnull IVisitor pVisitor) {
  assertNotClosed();
  return mCurrentNode.acceptVisitor(pVisitor);
}
</code></pre>

<p>However the visitor is a flaw in the API, because exposing the nodes itself, for instance <code>ElementNode</code> is very dangerous, because modifications which are allowed for every node-type should only be able from within a specific write-transaction (implemented as a cursor which provides methods to traverse a tree-structure). Otherwise the changes are not visible and not made persistent during a <code>commit()</code>.</p>

<p>Any suggestions on how to circumvent this situation? I somehow doubt I'm able to provide the visitor-interface as method signatures for sure have to be different...</p>

<p>Ok, I will provide Immutable ""wrapper"" or proxy classes:</p>

<pre><code>/** Mutable {@link CommentNode}. */
private final CommentNode mNode;

/**
 * Constructor.
 * 
 * @param pNode
 *          mutable {@link CommentNode}
 */
private ImmutableComment(final @Nonnull CommentNode pNode) {
  mNode = checkNotNull(pNode);
}

/**
 * Get an immutable comment
 * 
 * @param pNode
 *          the {@link CommentNode} which should be immutable
 * @return an immutable instance
 */
public static ImmutableComment of(final @Nonnull CommentNode pNode) {
  return new ImmutableComment(pNode);
}
</code></pre>

12667606,"<p>You can verify the internal makeup of the file by opening one of the html string encoded files in a text editor (like notepad). You should see that the underlying file is still html text. You should be able to read the first line of the file and check for the string ""html""</p>

<pre><code>var reader = System.IO.File.OpenText(pathCopy);
string firstLine = reader.ReadLine();
if (firstLine.IndexOf(""html"", StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase) &gt; 0)
    //some stuff
else
    //other stuff
</code></pre>

<p>You shouldn't get an error on the binary file, you'll just get some really strange characters in the string&mdash;fortunately, characters that won't include the string ""html"".</p>

",1349066525,1,c#,Read excel using OLEDB,1336
12667608,"<p>You are over thinking the problem. I had to remove many of your code because it is redundant and can be achieved with more efficient way. check this google code repository : <a href=""https://code.google.com/p/8queens/"" rel=""nofollow"">https://code.google.com/p/8queens/</a> for more methods other than backtracking. By the way, you violate the MVC rule here. you should have implemented the solver then the user interface, this way you can decide to change the view as you which.</p>

<p>EightQueensSolver.java</p>

<pre><code>public class EightQueensSolver {

    final boolean[][] board ;
    final int[] queensPositions;

    public EightQueensSolver(int boardSize) {
        if(boardSize&lt;4){
            throw new RuntimeException(""Can not solve boards of size &lt; 4"");
        }
        board = new boolean[boardSize][boardSize];
        queensPositions = new int[boardSize];
    }

    boolean solve(){
        return solve(0);
    }

    boolean solve(int row){
        for(int col=0;col&lt;board.length;col++){

            if(isSafe(row, col)){
                //place the queen for now in this spot
                board[row][col]=true;
                queensPositions[row] = col;
                //if we have finished the board, done.
                if(row==board.length-1) return true;
                //otherwise keep placing queens on next rows
                if(solve(row+1)){
                    //if placing the next queen will make the board solved, OK
                    return true;
                }else{
                    //otherwise backtrack and try other move
                    board[row][col]=false; 
                }
            }

        }
        return false;
    }

    boolean isSafe(int row,int col){
        //no need to test if on the same row, because we 
        //place a single queen on each row.
        //we only need to check if two queens are on 
        //same column or same diagonal
        for(int r=0;r&lt;row;r++){
            for(int c=0;c&lt;board.length;c++){
                if(board[r][c] &amp;&amp; (c==col || Math.abs(c-col)==Math.abs(r-row))) 
                    return false;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }


    void printBoard(){
        System.out.println(Arrays.deepToString(board)
                .replace('[', '\n').replace(""]"", """")
                .replace(""true"", ""Q"").replace(""false"", "" "")
        );
    }

    int getQueenColumnPosition(int row){
        return queensPositions[row];
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>EightQueensUI.java</p>

<pre><code>public class EightQueensUI extends JFrame {

    // gui components
    Icon queenIcon;
    JLabel imageLabel;
    EightQueensSolver solver;

    // constructor method
    public EightQueensUI(int boardSize) {
        super(""8 Queens: Freddie Style"");
        setPreferredSize(new Dimension(800, 800));
        getContentPane().setLayout(new GridLayout(boardSize, boardSize));
        queenIcon = new ImageIcon(getClass().getResource(""circle.png""));
        solver = new EightQueensSolver(boardSize);

        solver.solve();

        for(int row=0;row&lt;boardSize;row++){
            for(int col=0;col&lt;boardSize;col++){
                JPanel panel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
                panel.setBackground( (col-row)%2 == 0 ? Color.BLACK : Color.WHITE);
                if(solver.getQueenColumnPosition(row)==col){
                    panel.add(new JLabel(queenIcon));
                }
                getContentPane().add(panel);
            }
        }

    } // end constructor

} // end class EightQueensUI
</code></pre>

<p>EightQueensGame.java</p>

<pre><code>public class EightQueensGame {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException {
        EightQueensUI eightQueens = new EightQueensUI(8);

        eightQueens.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        eightQueens.pack();

        eightQueens.setVisible(true);//just for testing
        eightQueens.solver.printBoard();
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>the output is</p>

<pre><code>Q,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  , 
 ,  ,  ,  , Q,  ,  ,  , 
 ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  , Q, 
 ,  ,  ,  ,  , Q,  ,  , 
 ,  , Q,  ,  ,  ,  ,  , 
 ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  , Q,  , 
 , Q,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  , 
 ,  ,  , Q,  ,  ,  ,  
</code></pre>

<p><strong>edit</strong></p>

<p>i have made some modifications to the <code>EightQueensSolver</code> to make it a little more efficient by using a list instead of a matrix, thus improving the computation time a little bit for larger board sizes.</p>

<pre><code>public class EightQueensSolver {

    final int[] queensPositions;

    public EightQueensSolver(int boardSize) {
        if(boardSize&lt;4){
            throw new RuntimeException(""Can not solve boards of size &lt; 4"");
        }
        queensPositions = new int[boardSize];
        Arrays.fill(queensPositions, -1);
    }

    boolean solve(){
        return solve(0);
    }

    boolean solve(int row){
        for(int col=0;col&lt;queensPositions.length;col++){

            if(isSafe(row, col)){
                //place the queen for now in this spot
                queensPositions[row] = col;
                //if we have finished the board, done.
                if(row==queensPositions.length-1) return true;
                //otherwise keep placing queens on next rows
                if(solve(row+1)){
                    //if placing the next queen will make the board solved, OK
                    return true;
                }else{
                    //otherwise backtrack and try other move
                    queensPositions[row]=-1; 
                }
            }

        }
        return false;
    }

    boolean isSafe(int row,int col){
        //no need to test if on the same row, because we 
        //place a single queen on each row.
        //we only need to check if two queens are on 
        //same column or same diagonal
        for(int r=0;r&lt;row;r++){
            int c = queensPositions[r];
            if(c==col || Math.abs(c-col)==Math.abs(r-row)) 
                return false;
        }
        return true;
    }


    void printBoard(){
        for(int row=0;row&lt;queensPositions.length;row++){
            for(int col=0;col&lt;queensPositions.length;col++){
                if(queensPositions[row]==col) System.out.print(""Q,"");
                else System.out.print("" ,"");
            }
            System.out.println();
        }
    }

    int getQueenColumnPosition(int row){
        return queensPositions[row];
    }
}
</code></pre>
",1349071490,12668223,True,"<p>I am writing a program to recursively solve the eight queens puzzle, but I am having a hard time wrapping my head around how exactly i am supposed to make my program ""backtrack"" to solve the problem. My Solve() method and my isOpen() method are probably both erroneous, but I can't figure out what i'm doing wrong. I have my code below (and the driver). Sorry it's so long, but i'd appreciate it if I could get a couple of hints. </p>

<p>Note* the image icon is just a picture of Freddie Mercury</p>

<pre><code>import java.io.*;
import java.util.Formatter;
import javax.swing.*;

import java.awt.*;

public class EightQueens extends JFrame {

// declare class constants as needed
final int BOARD_DIMENSION = 8;
final boolean[][] BOARD = new boolean[8][8];
// declare instance variables
PrintWriter output;
int backtrack;
int comparison;
File file;
// gui components
JPanel chessPanel;
JPanel square[];
Icon queenIcon;
JLabel imageLabel;

// constructor method
public EightQueens() throws FileNotFoundException {

    // gui stuff
    setTitle(""8 Queens: Freddie Style"");
    setPreferredSize(new Dimension(800, 800));
    chessPanel = new JPanel(new GridLayout(8, 8));
    chessPanel.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 100));
    chessPanel.setBackground(Color.BLACK);
    square = new JPanel[64];
    queenIcon = new ImageIcon(getClass().getResource(
            ""/resource/mercury.jpg""));
    JLabel imageLabel = new JLabel("""", queenIcon, JLabel.CENTER);

    // CREATE AND INITIALIZE THE OUTPUT FILE
    file = new File(""TraceQueens.txt"");
    output = new PrintWriter(file);

    // CREATE AND INITIALIZE BOARD
    for (int i = 0; i &lt; 8; i++)
        for (int j = 0; j &lt; 8; j++)
            BOARD[i][j] = false;

    // add the squares to the chess panel
    for (int i = 0; i &lt; square.length; i++)// adds chess squares to the
                                            // board
    {
        square[i] = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
        square[i].setBackground(Color.BLACK);
        chessPanel.add(square[i]);
    }
    // this will make the squares the correct colors
    for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = BOARD_DIMENSION + 1; i &lt; (2 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = (2 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i &lt; (3 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt;= (2 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = (3 * BOARD_DIMENSION) + 1; i &lt; (4 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt; (3 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = (4 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i &lt; (5 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt;= (4 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = (5 * BOARD_DIMENSION) + 1; i &lt; (6 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt; (5 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = (6 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i &lt; (7 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt;= (6 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);
    for (int i = (7 * BOARD_DIMENSION) + 1; i &lt; (8 * BOARD_DIMENSION)
            &amp;&amp; i &gt; (7 * BOARD_DIMENSION); i = i + 2)
        square[i].setBackground(Color.WHITE);

    // puts the chess panel on the EightQueens frame
    add(chessPanel);

} // end constructor

// user interface method used to wrap the parameter representing the first
// column
public boolean solve() {
    return solve(0);
}

// recursive method solve

public boolean solve(int column) {

    // The Queen has been placed on the board in column
    int row = 0; 
    BOARD[row][column] = true;
    output.println(""The queen has been placed at [0]["" + column + ""]"");

    // if column is beyond the last column, then the problem is solved
    // base case
    for(int r = 0; r &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; r++); 
    if (column == BOARD_DIMENSION) {
        output.println(""The problem has been solved"");
        output.println(""The program backtracked "" + backtrack
                + "" times and made "" + comparison + "" comparisons"");

        // CLOSE FILE
        output.close();
        // RETURN TRUE
        return true;
    } else // attempt a solution from column
    {
        output.println(""Attempting solution from column "" + column);
        for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i++) {

            if (isOpen(i, column)) {
                BOARD[i][column] = true;
                comparison++;

                // solve the ""rest of the board""
                if (solve(column + 1)) {
                    output.println(""The queen has beel placed at ["" + i
                            + ""] + ["" + column + ""]"");
                    square[((i * 2) + column)].add(imageLabel,
                            BorderLayout.CENTER);// this converts the 2-d
                                                    // array location into a
                                                    // single value to
                                                    // make it compatible with the gui representation of the
                                                    // board
                    return true;
                }

                else {

                    BOARD[i][column] = false;
                    output.println(""the queen has been removed from [""+i+""][""+column+""]""); 
                }
            } else
                output.println(""The queen cannot be placed at ["" + i
                        + ""]["" + column + ""]"");
        }
        backtrack++;
        //output.close(); //This is for testing only
        return false;

        // return false to Backtrack to previous column since no squares in
        // current row will solve problem
    }
}

// Method to verify that the square is open.
public boolean isOpen(int row, int column) {
    {
        for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i++)// tests for the same row
        {
            if (BOARD[row][i] == true)
                return false;
        }

        for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i++)// test for the same column
        {
            if (BOARD[i][column] == true)
                return false;
        }

        for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i++)
            // test for diagonal down to the left
            while (row - 1 &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; column - 1 &gt;= 0) {
                if (BOARD[row - 1][column - 1] == true)
                    return false;
            }

        for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i++)
            // test for diagonal up to the left
            while (row + 1 &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION &amp;&amp; column - 1 &gt;= 0)
                if (BOARD[row + 1][column - 1] == true)
                    return false;
    }
    return true;
}

// output the board
public void printBoard()// this is probably wrong, but
                        // I want to find my mistakes in
                        // the rest of the code before fixing it
{
    for (int i = 0; i &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; i++)
        for (int j = 0; j &lt; BOARD_DIMENSION; j++) {
            if (BOARD[i][j] == false) {
                System.out.print(""*"");
                if (i == BOARD_DIMENSION - 1)
                    System.out.print(""\n"");
            }

            else
                System.out.print(""Q"");
        }

}

} // end class EightQueens
</code></pre>

<p>Driver:</p>

<pre><code>import javax.swing.*;
import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

public class EightQueensGame {
public static void main(String args[]) throws FileNotFoundException {
    EightQueens eightQueens = new EightQueens();

    eightQueens.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    eightQueens.pack();

    eightQueens.setVisible(true);//just for testing
    if (eightQueens.solve())
    {
        eightQueens.setVisible(true);
        eightQueens.printBoard();


    }

    else
        System.out.println(""Sorry, there is no solution"");
}
}
</code></pre>
",1349066542,1,java recursion backtracking,Eight queens puzzle logic errors,1406062
12667611,"<p>You've created two different references to your <code>UserInterface</code>...</p>

<pre><code>java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
    public void run() {
       // Here's one...
       new UserInterface().setVisible(true);
    }
});

//...

void display(String message)
{
    // And here's another
    UserInterface ui=new UserInterface();
</code></pre>

<p>Now these two references have nothing to do with each other and any modification to one won't effect the other.</p>

<p>If you didn't something like:</p>

<pre><code>public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception {
    java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
        public void run() {
            UserInterface ui = new UserInterface();
            ui.jTextArea2.append(message);
            ui.setVisible(true)
        }
    });
}
</code></pre>

<p>You should find that it works.</p>

<p><strong>UPDATE</strong></p>

<p>Loading classes from the <code>public static void main(String[] agrs)</code> is done all the time, be a bit hard to get anything done other wise ;)</p>

<pre><code>public class UserInterface extends javax.swing.JFrame { 
    public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception {
        java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() { 
            public void run() {
                UserInterface ui = new UserInterface();
                // Happy interactions :D
            } 
        }); 
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>Just open up another window and enter:</p>

<pre><code>cat &lt;my_pipe
</code></pre>

<p>and you'll see the data appear, followed by the original <code>echo</code> completing.</p>

12667625,"<p>I'd actually just adjust the display conditions on the tabs. Use an application item or use the page item from page 1 you refer to from pages 2-6. Page 1 will have to be submitted when you click such a link, so the tabs will be rendered.<br>
As for clearing, you could set a before-header computation to always set the item to NULL.  </p>

<p>Ok, so the above would probably be the fastest and least hassle, but from your comment below i better understood your question.</p>

<p>Example mark-up for Theme 21</p>

<pre><code>&lt;ul id=""tabs""&gt;
  &lt;li class=""first-non-current""&gt;
    &lt;a href=""javascript:apex.submit('T_TAB_1');"" class=""tab_link""&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Tab 1&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li class=""non-current""&gt;
    &lt;a href=""javascript:apex.submit('T_TAB_2');"" class=""tab_link""&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Tab 2&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li class=""current""&gt;
    &lt;a href=""javascript:apex.submit('T_TAB_3');"" class=""tab_link""&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Tab 3&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li class=""non-current""&gt;
    &lt;a href=""javascript:apex.submit('T_TAB_4');"" class=""tab_link""&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Tab 4&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li class=""last""&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>So when you're on page 1 which is Tab 1, you could alter how tab 2 and tab 3 look and behave, based on the class of the LI elements. Use javascript to disable the default behaviour of the a-tags on the non-current tabs, and use css to change the look and feel (which i'm not going to broach here: too much, and very specific to one theme. Spy the css through firebug, or look at the theme css in the images folder!)</p>

12667632,"<p>Yes, you are correct, it will only execute the first block</p>

<p>From <a href=""http://www.techonthenet.com/excel/formulas/if_then.php"" rel=""nofollow"">IF-THEN-ELSE Statement (VBA)</a></p>

<pre><code>If condition_1 Then
    result_1

 ElseIf condition_2 Then
   result_2
 ...
 ElseIf condition_n Then
    result_n

 Else
   result_else

 End If
</code></pre>

<blockquote>
  <p>condition_1 to condition_n are evaluated in the order listed. <strong>Once a
  condition is found to be true, the IF-THEN-ELSE statement will execute
  the corresponding code and not evaluate the conditions any further.</strong></p>
  
  <p>result_1 to result_n is the code that is executed once a condition is
  found to be true.</p>
</blockquote>
",1349066856,12667642,True,"<p>When using a</p>

<pre><code>If Then
'Do Something
Else If
'Do Something
End If 
</code></pre>

        Dim DateRange_InPro_ReportStr As String

        DateRange_InPro_ReportStr = ""Total Referrals: "" &amp; DateRange_InPro_TotalCount &amp; vbNewLine _

        Report = Report &amp; DateRange_InPro_ReportStr

End If

'next statement prints report variable to textBox
</code></pre>

<p>This statement only executes the first condition even though both conditions are true. I changed 'Else If' to 'End If' and 'If' ( two diff. conditional statments instead of one statement with two conditions) and it worked. </p>

<p>To do so, in your NHibernate configuration you will need to do something like:</p>

<pre><code>Fluently.Configure()
    // your config goes here
    .ExposeConfiguration(
        x =&gt; x.EventListeners.SaveOrUpdateEventListeners = 
           new ISaveOrUpdateEventListener[ ]{new NoOpEventListener() } ;
    // etc for other types
</code></pre>

12667636,"<p>""Zombies"" in Objective-C parlance are the opposite of leaks. A leak is a bit of allocated memory that you no longer have any references to, so you can't free it. A zombie is an object that <em>has</em> been deallocated, but references to it still exist and messages are still being sent to it (which can lead to all sorts of unpredictable behavior).</p>

12667643,"<p>If a product will be in both the <code>ProductLists</code> named ""favorite"", and in some other <code>ProductLists</code>, then there will need to be two entries in <code>ProductListsProducts</code>.  This doesn't violate normalization.  You have two <code>ProductsLists</code> and two many-to-many relationships stored in <code>ProductsListsProducts</code>.  I don't see a problem with that modeling.</p>

<p>If every user will have a (potentially empty) list of ""favorite"" products that you would like to treat as a separate concept from your other <code>ProductsLists</code>, then just make your tables:</p>

<p><code>Users</code>, <code>ProductsLists</code>, <code>ProductsListsProducts</code>, <code>Products</code>, and additionally a <code>UsersFavoriteProducts</code>.  </p>

<p><code>UsersFavoriteProducts</code> would contain a <code>user_id</code> and a <code>product_id</code>, and be handled separately from the typical <code>ProductsLists</code>.  <code>ProductsListsProducts</code> will not contain relationships for ""favorite"" products; the ""favorites"" relationship would only be stored in <code>UsersFavoriteProducts</code>.</p>

",1349066861,3,sql database relationship,Complicated table relationships,621233
12667644,"<p>I found the culprit.. It was <code>UITextView</code>. Sorry if I don't mention I use UITextView for multiline label under address label.</p>

<p>Quoting ""Taketo Sano"" on other question : <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/a/5673026/453407"">http://stackoverflow.com/a/5673026/453407</a></p>

<blockquote>
  <p>I've investigated how the auto-scroll is done by tracking the
  call-trace, and found that an internal [UIFieldEditor
  scrollSelectionToVisible] is called when a letter is typed into the
  UITextField. This method seems to act on the UIScrollView of the
  nearest ancestor of the UITextField.</p>
</blockquote>

<p><code>UIScrollView</code> is auto scrolled to <code>UITextView</code> when <code>UITextView</code> text is changed. So I found the solution by subclassing <code>UIScrollview</code> and override</p>

<pre><code>- (void)scrollRectToVisible:(CGRect)rect animated:(BOOL)animated {
</code></pre>

<p>and return nothing to disable the auto scroll... If you plan to use it in future, just use a bool variable to enable / disable it by using</p>

<pre><code>- (void)scrollRectToVisible:(CGRect)rect animated:(BOOL)animated {
    if (!self.disableAutoScroll) {
        [super scrollRectToVisible:rect animated:animated];
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>so you can disable the autoscroll before you change the UITextView by code and enable it after. </p>

RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} ^/([0-9]+)/img/normal$

RewriteRule ^([0-9]+)/img/normal$ profileImgs/$1_50.jpg  [L]

# gif
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} ^/([0-9]+)/img/normal$
RewriteCond %{DOCUMENT_ROOT}/profileImgs/%1_50\.gif$ -f
RewriteRule ^([0-9]+)/img/normal$ profileImgs/$1_50.gif  [L]

# default
RewriteRule ^([0-9]+)/img/normal$ profileImgs/noImg_50.gif  [L]
</code></pre>

12667656,"<p>There is something wrong with your question (see my comment).</p>

<p>However, the fundamental problem here is that a URL with a space character in the query part is not a legal URL ... not withstanding that a typical web browser will accept it.  The exception is therefore correct.</p>

<p>Your example URLs seem to show that the space is escaped with a '+'.  This is HTML form escaping not proper URL escaping.  You seem to be saying that you get the same result is you use <code>%20</code> ... which would be correct escaping.</p>

<p>So my theory is that you are actually passing this URL to your code via a route that is removing the escapes ... not-withstanding what your traceprints seem to be telling you.  (If I could see an SSCE we'd be able to test this theory ...)</p>

<hr>

<p>FWIW, fixing the problem by calling UrlEncoder.encode as some of the other answers have suggested is a bad idea.  The problem is that it is likely to ""encode"" other characters that shouldn't be encoded.</p>

main (void) {
   void join(int arr1[], int arr2[]);
   int vectorA[11] = {8, 17, 29, 32, 33, 33, 77, 81, 90, 94, -1};
   int vectorB[11] = {8, 17, 29, 44, 33, 33, 77, 81, 90, 94, -1};

   join(vectorA, vectorB);
return 0;
}

void join(int arr1[], int arr2[])
{
   int count=0, counter=0;
   int i=0, j=0;
   while(arr1[i]&gt;-1)
      count++;
   while(arr2[j]&gt;-1)
      count++;
   int tot[count];
   for(i=0, j=0; ((arr1[i]&gt;-1) || (arr2[j]&gt;-1)); )
   {
       if(arr2[j]&lt;0) {
       tot[counter++]=arr1[i++];
   }
   else if(arr1[i]&lt;0) {
       tot[counter++]=arr2[j++];
   }
   else {
       tot[counter++]=arr2[j++];
       tot[counter++]=arr1[i++];
   }
}

printf(""the doubled array is : \n"");
for(int i=0; i&lt;count; i++)
{
   printf(""%d, "", tot[i]);
}

}
</code></pre>

",1349067126,0,html web html-form,What is the best way to create a simple webform that carries out one function?,1709282
12667677,"<p>I had the same problem.  </p>

<p><strong>Solution:</strong> Create a <em>web.config</em> file in the root directory of your web site with the following code:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;configuration&gt;
    &lt;system.webServer&gt;
    &lt;rewrite&gt;
        &lt;rules&gt;
            &lt;rule name=""GeneralRewrite"" stopProcessing=""true""&gt;
                &lt;match url=""^(.*).html$"" ignoreCase=""true"" /&gt;
                &lt;conditions&gt;
                    &lt;add input=""{REQUEST_FILENAME}"" matchType=""IsDirectory"" ignoreCase=""false"" negate=""true"" /&gt;
                    &lt;add input=""{REQUEST_FILENAME}"" matchType=""IsFile"" ignoreCase=""false"" negate=""true"" /&gt;
                &lt;/conditions&gt;
                &lt;action type=""Rewrite"" url=""{tolower:{R:1}}.php"" /&gt;
            &lt;/rule&gt;
        &lt;/rules&gt;
    &lt;/rewrite&gt;
    &lt;/system.webServer&gt;
&lt;/configuration&gt;
</code></pre>

12667692,"<p>In <code>GridView</code>,when you want to change a item , all you need is change the <code>Adapter</code> which you link to the <code>GridView</code>.  </p>

<p>For example, swap two item:(GridAdapter extends ArrayAdapter)</p>

<pre><code>GridAdapter adapter = (GridAdapter)gridv.getAdapter();
String firstItem = adapter.getItem(firstPosition);
String secondItem = adapter.getItem(secondPosition);
adapter.remove(firstItem);
adapter.insert(firstItem, secondPosition);
adapter.remove(secondItem);
adapter.insert(secondItem, firstPosition);
</code></pre>

<p>You also can change other things in your custom <code>Adapter</code> by override the <code>getView()</code>.</p>

                    iwidth = breakedimages.get(0).getWidth();

                public int getCount() {

                    // TODO Auto-generated method stub

                    // TODO Auto-generated method stub

",1349067291,0,android image gridview,How to change images in grid view as the position changes in android?,1571301
12667693,"<p>If you're going to use the Lua API, you need to become comfortable with the Lua stack. And one of the most important things you can learn to do is understanding how to read <a href=""http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#lua_pcall"" rel=""nofollow"">the Lua API docs.</a> For every function, there is a notation on the right about exactly how it affects the stack (if it modifies the stack at all).</p>

<p><code>luaL_loadfile</code> loads a file and pushes that file as a Lua function onto the stack. <code>lua_pcall</code> executes a function on the stack. But it has a number of caveats about how it does stuff.</p>

<p>The way calling functions through Lua works in terms of the stack is simple. You push the function you want to call. Then you push all of the arguments, in order, from first to last. Then you issue your call of that function. <code>lua_pcall</code> works in this way. This means that the location of the function to execute is <em>always</em> <code>nargs + 1</code>, relative to the top of the stack, where <code>nargs</code> is the number of arguments you're passing to the function.</p>

<p>Note that <code>lua_pcall</code> will <em>pop the function from the stack</em> (along with all of the arguments). If you just loaded the file, this will be the <em>only reference</em> to that function in Lua. Thus, you will not be able to execute the file again. You should duplicate the function before pushing its arguments onto the stack, using <a href=""http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#lua_pushvalue"" rel=""nofollow""><code>lua_pushvalue</code> to copy it</a>. You should probably stick it in the <code>LUA_REGISTRYINDEX</code> table or something, so that it's value is preserved.</p>
",1349070172,12668032,True,"<p>I'm implementing Lua scripting engine in my c++ game engine and I was wondering what is the best way to store and execute Lua scripts. ",1349067301,1,lua,Storing scripts,734069
12667699,"<p>While @John's answer will work if you have a known number of subjects, if you have an unknown number of subjects then you can use prepared statements to generate this dynamically.  Here is a good article:</p>

<p><a href=""http://buysql.com/mysql/14-how-to-automate-pivot-tables.html"" rel=""nofollow"">Dynamic pivot tables (transform rows to columns)</a></p>

<p>Your code would look like this:</p>

<pre><code>SET @sql = NULL;
SELECT
  GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT
    CONCAT(
      'MAX(case when Subject = ''',
      Subject,
      ''' then Grade end) AS ',
      Subject
    )
  ) INTO @sql
FROM grade;

SET @sql = CONCAT('SELECT s.Student_name, ', @sql, ' 
                   FROM student s
                   LEFT JOIN grade AS g 
                    ON s.student_id = g.student_id
                   GROUP BY s.Student_name');

PREPARE stmt FROM @sql;
EXECUTE stmt;
DEALLOCATE PREPARE stmt;
</code></pre>

<p>See <a href=""http://sqlfiddle.com/#!2/879e0/4"" rel=""nofollow"">SQL Fiddle With Demo</a></p>

",1349067335,3,mysql sql query select pivot,SQL Query fields as columns,426671
12667702,"<p>I would exclude that. Concurrent read access to a memory area is by definition thread-safe. When one thread writes to a location of memory which is read by another, you lose thread-safety in the sense that result is unpredictable but you still should not get an access violation (in most sane platforms, including x86).</p>

<p>Most likely, the size of the <em>valid</em> memory area pointed by either <code>m_pMyPointer</code> or <code>m_pSrcPointer</code> is smaller than <code>m_nDataSize</code>.</p>

<p>However, if you have doubts that the same piece of memory is read and written to by different threads at the same time, it means you are at the very least missing a locking scheme there.</p>
",1349069426,12667923,False,"<p>I got an access violation from my application.</p>

</code></pre>

12667709,"<p>Answering my own question for the benefit of others. The way I was adding widgets to the table was incorrect:</p>

<pre><code>this.mTable.row();
this.mTable.add(button).fillX();
</code></pre>

<p>I needed to call the <code>fillX()</code> method of the <code>row()</code>:</p>

<pre><code>this.mTable.row().fillX();
this.mTable.add(button);
</code></pre>

<p>Hope this helps someone.</p>

12667716,"<p>Looking at the <a href=""http://www.google.no/search?q=arrayfun&amp;ie=UTF-8&amp;oe=UTF-8&amp;hl=en-gb&amp;client=safari"" rel=""nofollow"">arrayfun</a> documentation</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>func</p>
  
  <p>Handle to a function that accepts n input arguments and returns m output arguments.</p>
</blockquote>

<p>A handle in matlab is denoted using @, so you need to pass @get as first parameter. Otherwise matlab tries to evaluate function get instead of obtaining its handle, which results in ""not enough parameters"" error.</p>

<p>In the example that works you defined get to be a handle to an anonymous function, that's why it worked.</p>
",1349070308,12668056,True,"<p>In the following boiled down example illustrating the error, the function <code>f_what(..)</code> should return the values of input argument <code>y</code> at indices in the array <code>ts</code>:</p>

<pre><code>function Y = f_what(y, ts)

    function get_out = get(t)
        get_out = y(t);
    end

    Y = arrayfun(get, ts);

end
</code></pre>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt; f_what(1:10, 1:5)
Error using f_what/get (line 4)
Not enough input arguments.

Error in f_what (line 7)
    Y = arrayfun(get, ts);
</code></pre>

<pre><code>function Y = f_what(y, ts)

    get = @(t) y(t);

    Y = arrayfun(get, ts);

end
</code></pre>

<p>Calling it:</p>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt; f_what(1:10, 1:5)

ans =

     1     2     3     4     5
</code></pre>

<p>""Not enough input arguments"" ... <code>arrayfun(..)</code> should call its first argument with, in this case, one argument. And <code>get(..)</code> has one input argument. I don't get why it's not enough.</p>

<p><strong>Edit:</strong> even more boiled down:</p>

<pre><code>function Y = f_what

    function get_out = get_(t)
        get_out = t;
    end

    Y = arrayfun(get_, 1:5);

end
</code></pre>

<p>Still the same error.</p>

<p><strong>Edit 2:</strong> It works if I supply <code>@get</code> to the first argument of <code>arrayfun(..)</code>, instead of <code>get</code>. But I still don't get why it doesn't work without the <code>@</code>.</p>
",1349067524,1,matlab,"matlab - arrayfun(..) call, ""Not enough input arguments.""",1644189
12667721,"<p>There are shortfalls to simply giving out the largest coins first.</p>

<p>Let's say your vending machine is out of every coin except twenty each of 50c, 20c and 1c coins and you have to deliver 60c in change.</p>

<p>A ""prioritise-largest"" (or greedy) scheme will give you eleven coins, one 50c coin and ten 1c coins.</p>

<p>The better solution is three 20c coins.</p>

<p>Greedy schemes only give you <em>local</em> optimum solutions. For global optima, you generally need to examine all possibilities (though there may be minimax-type algorithms to reduce the search space) to be certain which, for delivering change, is usually quite within the limits of computability.</p>
",1349067937,12667766,True,"<p>How would you reach a given sum in the most optimal manner possible given a set of coins ?</p>

<p>Let's say that in this case we have random numbers of 1, 5, 10, 20 and 50 cent coins with the biggest coins getting the priority.</p>

<p>My first intuition would be to use all the biggest coins possible to fit and then use up the next smallest coin in value if the sum is exceeded.</p>

<p>Would this do or are there any shortfalls to this approach ? Are there any more efficient approaches ?</p>
",1349067540,5,algorithm combinations,Most optimal coin fit for a given sum of money,14860
12667726,"<p>See <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/325933/determine-whether-two-date-ranges-overlap/"">Determine whether two date ranges overlap</a>.</p>

<p>You need to evaluate the following, or a minor variant on it using <code>&lt;=</code> instead of <code>&lt;</code>, perhaps:</p>

<pre><code>Start1 &lt; End2 AND Start2 &lt; End1
</code></pre>

<p>Since you're working with a single table, you need to have a self-join:</p>

<pre><code>SELECT p1.*, p2.*
  FROM products p1
  JOIN products p2
    ON p1.product_reg_no != p2.product_reg_no
   AND p1.start &lt; p2.end
   AND p2.start &lt; p1.end;
</code></pre>

<p>The not equal condition ensures that you don't get a record paired with itself (though the <code>&lt;</code> conditions also ensure that, but if you used <code>&lt;=</code>, the not equal condition would be a good idea.</p>

<p>This will generate two rows for each pair of products (one row with ProductA as <code>p1</code> and ProductB as <code>p2</code>, the other with ProductB as <code>p1</code> and ProductA as <code>p2</code>).  To prevent that happening, change the <code>!=</code> into either <code>&lt;</code> or <code>&gt;</code>.</p>

<hr>

<p>And, looking more closely at the sample data, it might be that you're really interesting in rows where the registration numbers match and the dates overlap.  In which case, you can ignore my wittering about <code>!=</code> and <code>&lt;</code> or <code>&gt;</code> and replace the condition with <code>=</code> after all.</p>

<pre><code>SELECT p1.*, p2.*
  FROM products p1
  JOIN products p2
    ON p1.product_reg_no = p2.product_reg_no
   AND p1.start &lt; p2.end
   AND p2.start &lt; p1.end;
</code></pre>

<hr>

<p>SQL Fiddle (unsaved) shows that this works:</p>

<pre><code>SELECT p1.product_reg_no p1_reg, p1.start_date p1_start, p1.end_date p1_end,
       p2.product_reg_no p2_reg, p2.start_date p2_start, p2.end_date p2_end
  FROM products p1
  JOIN products p2
    ON p1.product_reg_no = p2.product_reg_no
   AND p1.start_date &lt; p2.end_date
   AND p2.start_date &lt; p1.end_date
 WHERE (p1.start_date != p2.start_date OR p1.end_date != p2.end_date);
</code></pre>

<p>The WHERE clause eliminates the rows that are joined to themselves.  With the duplicate column names in the SELECT-list eliminated, you get to see all the data.  I added a row:</p>

<pre><code>INSERT INTO products (product_reg_no, start_date, end_date)
VALUES ('AL-NAPT', TO_DATE('08/27/2011', 'MM/DD/YYYY'), TO_DATE('08/30/2011', 'MM/DD/YYYY'));
</code></pre>

<p>This was not selected — demonstrating that it does reject non-overlapping entries.</p>

<p>If you want to eliminate the double rows, then you have to add another fancy criterion:</p>

<pre><code>SELECT p1.product_reg_no p1_reg, p1.start_date p1_start, p1.end_date p1_end,
       p2.product_reg_no p2_reg, p2.start_date p2_start, p2.end_date p2_end
  FROM products p1
  JOIN products p2
    ON p1.product_reg_no = p2.product_reg_no
   AND p1.start_date &lt; p2.end_date
   AND p2.start_date &lt; p1.end_date
 WHERE (p1.start_date != p2.start_date OR p1.end_date != p2.end_date)
   AND (p1.start_date &lt; p2.start_date OR
       (p1.start_date = p2.start_date AND p1.end_date &lt; p2.end_date));
</code></pre>

12667732,"<p>Try removing <code>attr_accessor :content,:num_votes,:last_submitted</code>. The <code>attr_accessor</code> method is used to creates methods to simply set and read an instance variable in the object. For example, for <code>attr_accessor :content</code>, you end up with the methods:</p>

<pre><code>def content= (something)
    @content = something
end

def content
    @content
end
</code></pre>

<p>The first doesn't involve a <code>save</code> call to update the db, just an update to the instance variable in memory.</p>

12667741,"<p>The apk by default is located under bin and this is correct, but when you distribute source code it's better to not add any apk because a ""fresh"" compiled apk is always a better solution.</p>

<p>if you have a file called <code>build.xml</code> in the root of your project just do</p>

<pre><code>ant debug
</code></pre>

<p>otherwise you need to update your project with the minimum informations required for the building phase with</p>

<pre><code>android update project -t android-10 -p .
</code></pre>

<p>in this case <code>android-10</code> is a target for your apk/app/api and you can customize this option for your targeted device.</p>

<p>After this you get your <code>build.xml</code> and everything is in place for generating an apk.</p>
",1349068543,12667826,True,"<p>please tell me how to build apk files of a project without the use of ECLIPSE ide. i found some infos about using a batch file but i don't know how to remake it. </p>

<pre><code>echo on

SET PREV_PATH=%CD%
cd /d %0\..

REM Clear bin folder
rmdir ""bin"" /S /Q
rmdir ""gen"" /S /Q
mkdir ""bin"" || goto EXIT
mkdir ""gen"" || goto EXIT

REM Set your application name
SET APP_NAME=SecureSms

REM Define minimal Android revision
SET ANDROID_REV=android-8

REM Define aapt add command
SET ANDROID_AAPT_ADD=""%ANDROID-SDK%\platforms\%ANDROID_REV%\tools\aapt.exe"" add

REM Define aapt pack and generate resources command
SET ANDROID_AAPT_PACK=""%ANDROID-SDK%\platforms\%ANDROID_REV%\tools\aapt.exe"" package -v -f -I ""%ANDROID-SDK%\platforms\%ANDROID_REV%\android.jar""

REM Define class file generator command
SET ANDROID_DX=""%ANDROID-SDK%\platform-tools\dx.bat"" --dex

REM Define Java compiler command
SET JAVAC=""%JAVABIN%\javac.exe"" -classpath ""%ANDROID-SDK%\platforms\%ANDROID_REV%\android.jar""
SET JAVAC_BUILD=%JAVAC% -sourcepath ""src;gen"" -d ""bin""

REM Generate R class and pack resources and assets into resources.ap_ file
call %ANDROID_AAPT_PACK% -M ""AndroidManifest.xml"" -A ""assets"" -S ""res"" -m -J ""gen"" -F ""bin\resources.ap_"" || goto EXIT

REM Compile sources. All *.class files will be put into the bin folder
call %JAVAC_BUILD% src\org\secure\sms\*.java || goto EXIT

REM Generate dex files with compiled Java classes
call %ANDROID_DX% --output=""%CD%\bin\classes.dex"" %CD%\bin || goto EXIT

REM Recources file need to be copied. This is needed for signing.
copy ""%CD%\bin\resources.ap_"" ""%CD%\bin\%APP_NAME%.ap_"" || goto EXIT

REM Add generated classes.dex file into application package
call %ANDROID_AAPT_ADD% ""%CD%\bin\%APP_NAME%.ap_"" ""%CD%\bin\classes.dex"" || goto EXIT

REM Create signed Android application from *.ap_ file. Output and Input files must be different.
call ""%JAVABIN%\jarsigner"" -keystore ""%CD%\keystore\my-release-key.keystore"" -storepass ""password"" -keypass ""password"" -signedjar ""%CD%\bin\%APP_NAME%.apk"" ""%CD%\bin\%APP_NAME%.ap_"" ""alias_name"" || goto EXIT

REM Delete temp file
del ""bin\%APP_NAME%.ap_""

:EXIT
cd ""%PREV_PATH%""
ENDLOCAL
exit /b %ERRORLEVEL%
</code></pre>

<p>i got this codes from a site. (http://www.apriorit.com/our-company/dev-blog/233-how-to-build-apk-file-from-command-line)</p>

<p>i downloaded the source code sample and opened the batch file in there but it didn't generate it's apk file. usually the apk file is located at its bin\ right? but when i opened the folder, the file is not in there. please help me how to use this one. i'd appreciate you help.</p>

",1349067723,0,asp.net visual-studio-2010 web-config transform claims-based-identity,web.config transform for microsoft.identitymodel configsection,756189
12667748,"<p>I am going to assume you are referring to an underscore that occurs in the file name.</p>

<pre><code>@echo off
setlocal

::The following defines a TAB character that is not preserved on StackOverflow
set ""TAB=   ""

for %%F in (*.txt) do call :processFile ""%%F""
exit /b

:processFile
set ""name=%~1""
set name=%name:_=&amp;rem %
for /f ""usebackq delims="" %%a in (%1) do echo %%a%TAB%%name%&gt;&gt;combined.txt
</code></pre>

<p>The magic command is <code>set name=%name:_=&amp;rem %</code>. It works by injecting a REMark command into the statement. Assume the current name is <code>part1_part2.txt</code>. After the search and replace expansion, the full statement becomes <code>set name=part1&amp;rem part2.txt</code></p>

<p><strong>EDIT - Improved answer</strong></p>

<p>Looking at your edited question, I realize there is a better way. I should have thought of parsing the name using FOR /F :-)  You were 90% there!</p>

<pre><code>@echo off
setlocal

::The following defines a TAB character that is not preserved on StackOverflow
set ""TAB=   ""

for %%F in (*.txt) do (
  for /f ""delims=_"" %%I in (""%%F"") do (
    for /f ""usebackq delims="" %%a in (""%%F"") do echo %%a%TAB%%%I&gt;&gt;combined.txt
  )
)
</code></pre>

12667749,"<p>You may create a cookie once it slides down and on every $(document).ready() call see if that cookie is there or not and open the panel accordingly.</p>

<p>You can either google ""how to set a cookie with javascript"" or use $.cookie as suggested by Konstantin D.</p>

<p>See my comments in your code to understand clearly:</p>

<pre><code>$(document).ready(function() {


// see if cookie exists. if it does do the following
// $('div#panel').show();
// if it does not, you don't have to do anything

// Expand Panel
$(""#open"").click(function(){
    $(""div#panel"").slideDown(2000, ""easeOutBounce"");
    // now that it is opened, you should set your cookie here!

}); 

// Expand Panel
$(""#open"").click(function(){
    $(""body"").slideDown(""slow"");
}); 

// Collapse Panel
$(""#close"").click(function(){
    $(""div#panel"").slideUp(2000, ""easeInBack""); 
    // once it is closed by user, remember to delete the cookie.
});     

// Switch buttons from ""Log In | Register"" to ""Close Panel"" on click
$(""#toggle a"").click(function () {
    $(""#toggle a"").toggle();
});
</code></pre>

-(void)loadProfileImage {

    NSData* profileImageData = [NSData dataWithContentsOfURL:[NSURL URLWithString:self.userAccount.profileImageURL]];

}

-(void)launchSettingsView:(NSData*)profileImageData {
    self.userAccount.userImage = [UIImage imageWithData:profileImageData];
    self.progressHud.hidden = YES;
    SettingsViewController* settingsViewController=[[SettingsViewController alloc] init];
    settingsViewController.userAccount = self.userAccount;
    settingsViewController.delegate = self;

    [settingsViewController release];
}

",1349067916,3,python django,Django limit query,434893
12667770,"<p>As both of the previous answers pointed out, the destination Directory cannot exist. In your code you are creating the Directory if it doesn't exist and then trying to move your directory, the Move Method will create the directory for you. If the Directory already exists you will need to Delete it or Move it.</p>

<p>Something like this:</p>

<pre><code>class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        string sourcedirectory = @""C:\source"";
        string destinationdirectory = @""C:\destination"";
        string backupdirectory = @""C:\Backup"";
        try
        {
            if (Directory.Exists(sourcedirectory))
            {
                if (Directory.Exists(destinationdirectory))
                {
                    //Directory.Delete(destinationdirectory);
                    Directory.Move(destinationdirectory, backupdirectory + DateTime.Now.ToString(""_MMMdd_yyyy_HHmmss""));
                    Directory.Move(sourcedirectory, destinationdirectory);
                }
                else
                {
                    Directory.Move(sourcedirectory, destinationdirectory);
                }
            }

        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(ex.Message);
        }
        Console.ReadLine();
    }
}
</code></pre>
",1349071717,12668256,True,"<p>I am trying to move the directory from one location to another location on the same drive. I am getting ""<strong>Cannot create a file when that file already exists</strong>"" error. Below is my code.</p>

<p>could any one suggest on this?</p>

<pre><code>        string sourcedirectory = @""F:\source"";
        string destinationdirectory = @""F:\destination"";

        try
        {
            if (Directory.Exists(sourcedirectory))
            {
                if (Directory.Exists(destinationdirectory))
                {
                  Directory.Move(sourcedirectory, destinationdirectory);
                }
                else
                {
                  Directory.CreateDirectory(destinationdirectory);
                  Directory.Move(sourcedirectory, destinationdirectory);
                }
            }

        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            log(ex.message);
        }
</code></pre>
",1349068005,0,c#,Cannot create a file when that file already exists when using Directory.Move,479512
12667771,"<p>It's not clear why you write this <code>PreViewGenerateHtml</code> javascript function. When you use <code>Ajax.BeginForm</code> and include the jquery unobtrusive script it will automatically AJAXify the generated form and when you click on the submit button it will send it to the server asynchronously.</p>

<p>If on the other hand you want to manually AJAXify the form you should use a normal <code>Html.BeginForm</code> instead of an Ajax.BeginForm and then pass <code>form.serialize()</code> instead of <code>form.serializeArray()</code> to the <code>$.post</code> method.</p>

<p>The target controller action will receive exactly the same POST data as if it was a normal HTML form. So your input field names must be correctly named if you expect the default model binder to bind your model. Here's an article illustrating the expected <a href=""http://haacked.com/archive/2008/10/23/model-binding-to-a-list.aspx"" rel=""nofollow"">format for binding to collections</a>.</p>

<p>If you have some doubts use a javascript debugging tool (such as FireBug or Chrome developer toolbar) to inspect the exact data payload that's being sent along with the request.</p>

12667775,"<p>Here is the code you need:</p>

<pre><code>    If WB.ContainsFocus Then
        MsgBox(""We have focus, disappearing..."")
        WB.Document.Body.RemoveFocus()
    End If
</code></pre>

<p>Now, the question is, when to run that code. If you put it in the WebBrowser1_GotFocus event, you'll need to turn it on and off. Turn the code off if the user is interacting with the WB Control, and turn it back on when they are not and when you expect to be experiencing the problem you've mentioned.</p>

<p>Of course, you could add another line to ensure a particular control/tab/panel etc gets focus after you remove focus from the body. Also, here are 3 other SO questions that have answers which may help you, but these will take you in directions different to the direction I've provided, probably due to the fact that the questions are not identical to yours, but are similar enough to be useful (not listed in order of preference).</p>

<p><a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1562619/prevent-webbrowser-control-from-stealing-focus"">Prevent WebBrowser control from stealing focus?</a></p>

<p><a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8495857/webbrowser-steals-focus"">Webbrowser steals focus</a></p>

<p><a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5312755/focusing-webbrowser-control-in-a-c-sharp-application"">Focusing WebBrowser control in a C# application</a></p>

<p>UPDATE:
I just wanted to add, instead of the .Body.RemoveFocus() you could do this:</p>

<pre><code>WB.Document.Body.Parent.RemoveFocus()
</code></pre>

<p>Which I prefer, since the .Document object didn't have an explicit .RemoveFocus method on the intellisense I was gettign in VS2012 RC. This is probably referring to the HTML tag (and not the .Document object) and since the <code>html</code> tag is the only parent to the <code>body</code> tag, it makes sense, and there is no ""HTML"" object directly available in the intellisense under object, since you can get it via other means, so it's just more convenient doing it this way.</p>

<p>Cheers, and let me know if you need more info on anything.</p>

12667782,"<p>You have the parameter <code>subset</code> of <code>lm</code>, here is an example.</p>

<pre><code>x &lt;- rnorm(100)
y &lt;- rnorm(100, sd=0.1) 
y[1:50] &lt;- y[1:50] + 3*x[1:50] + 10  # line y = 3x+10
y[51:100] &lt;- y[51:100] + 8*x[51:100] - 5 # line y = 8x-5
levels &lt;- rep(1:2, each=50, len=100)

data = data.frame(x=x, y=y, levels=levels)

lm(y ~ x, data=data, subset=levels==1) # regression for the first part

Coefficients:   (Intercept)            x  
                    10.015          2.996

lm(y ~ x, data=data, subset=levels==2) # second part

Coefficients:   (Intercept)            x  
                    -4.986          8.000
</code></pre>

<p>You are passing <code>I(levels==1)</code> implicitly to <code>subset</code> inside <code>lm</code>. </p>

<code>-F/--form &lt;name=content&gt; Specify HTTP multipart POST data (H)</code></p>

<p>Try this:</p>

<pre><code>curl -F ""userid=1"" -F ""filecomment=This is an image file"" -F ""image=@/home/user1/Desktop/test.jpg"" localhost/uploader.php
</code></pre>

<p>Note from the man page:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>If  you  start  the data with the letter @, the rest should be a
  file name to read the data from...  <strong>The contents of the file must already be
  url-encoded.</strong></p>
</blockquote>

12667820,"<p>Use <code>copy()</code> instead of <code>move_uploaded_file()</code>. <code>move_uploaded_file()</code> deletes the source file when it's done, so you can't use it multiple times on the same file. <code>copy()</code> leaves the original file alone, so you can do it as many times as you want.</p>

<p>When the script exits, PHP automatically removes the temp file that was uploaded if it doesn't get moved by the script.</p>
",1351318331,13097748,True,"<p>This is a script that Upload a file in all directory. But when i run it, its only upload One time and then fail to upload . whats wrong in this code ?</p>

{

$target = $p_pathname; 
if(move_uploaded_file($_FILES['uploaded']['tmp_name'], $target.$_FILES['uploaded']['name'])) 
{
    echo $target. ""Done&lt;br&gt;"";
} 
else 
{
    echo $target.""Sorry&lt;br&gt;"";
}
while (($file = $d-&gt;read()) !== false)
{
    if (($file != ""."") and ($file != ""..""))
    {
        $filetype = filetype (""{$d-&gt;path}/{$file}"");

        if ($filetype == ""dir"")
        {
            read_directory (""{$d-&gt;path}/{$file}"");
        }
        else
        {

        }
    }
}

}

12667822,"<p>It is because $.ajax is asynchronous in your call. </p>

12667835,"<p>This should do the trick:</p>

<pre><code>template&lt;typename T, unsigned long long flag = 1uLL&gt;
struct bits_in {
    enum {value = 1 + bits_in&lt;T, (unsigned long long)(T)(flag &lt;&lt; 1)&gt;::value};
};

template&lt;typename T&gt;
struct bits_in&lt;T, 0uLL&gt; {
    enum {value = 0};
};
</code></pre>

<p>unlike <a href=""http://liveworkspace.org/code/4f54513d1bc7a4a3f412ee0650902b37"" rel=""nofollow"">Nicolas's version</a> it is simpler, produces no warnings, and <a href=""http://liveworkspace.org/code/9111c60a8eb9c6c263e66ba267ff3db1"" rel=""nofollow"">actually works correctly</a>.</p>
",1349114881,12678598,True,"<p>I've been getting acquainted with metaprogramming by solving various toy problems. Here's one that has me stumped: How to write a metaprogram that provides the size of an integral type argument in terms of bits. In particular, I'd like to do it without <a href=""http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/clibrary/climits/"" rel=""nofollow"">CHAR_BIT</a> or any other magic numbers.</p>

<p>I started with the following non-metaprogram:</p>

<pre><code>template &lt;typename T&gt;
int sizeInBits(void) {
    T flag = 1;
    int count = 0;
    while (flag != 0) {
        flag &lt;&lt;= 1;
        ++count;
    }
    return count;
}
</code></pre>

<p>Converted to a metaprogram, I thought it would look like this:</p>

<pre><code>template&lt;typename T, int COUNT = 0, T FLAG = 1&gt;
struct SizeInBits {
    enum {Result = SizeInBits&lt;T, COUNT + 1, FLAG &lt;&lt; 1 &gt;::Result};
};

template&lt;typename T, int COUNT&gt;
struct SizeInBits&lt;T, COUNT, 0&gt; {
    enum {Result = COUNT};
};
</code></pre>

<p>However, this program fails to compile because <a href=""http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=31584"" rel=""nofollow"">apparently</a> it is illegal to specialize on a non-type template parameter that has a template parameter type, and so I get the following error message using gcc 4.6:</p>

<pre><code>error: type ‘T’ of template argument ‘0’ depends on a template parameter
</code></pre>

<p>Any ideas?</p>

<p><strong>Edit</strong>:<br>
I am essentially looking for the metaprogram equivalent of the magic numbers in <code>&lt;climits&gt;</code> and <code>&lt;limits&gt;</code>. So, for example, I would like <code>SizeInBits&lt;char&gt;::Result</code> to give <code>8</code> on my system, and <code>SizeInBits&lt;unsigned&gt;::Result</code> to give <code>32</code>.</p>

<p><strong>Note regarding validity of left bitwise shift operator on signed types</strong>:<br>
In the comments, there was some concern whether <code>FLAG &lt;&lt; 1</code> is defined or not for signed types when overflow occurs. According to the C++03 standard quoted in <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3784996/why-does-left-shift-operation-invoke-undefined-behaviour-when-the-left-side-oper"">this post</a>, it is defined and does what the above algos expect.</p>
",1349068636,1,c++ metaprogramming,Metaprogram for size of integral type in terms of bits,1554020

<p>Implement the desired methods based on that.</p>

",1349068665,1,algorithm excel memory data-structures,Come up with data structure for working with a giant data in a matrix form (think of it as an excel sheet),66686
12667838,"<p>If your network request are going to differ significantly it might be easier to create multiple AFHTTPClient subclasses to deal with the different cases. Adding your headers in in <code>- (id)initWithBaseURL:(NSURL *)url</code>.</p>

<p>Otherwise whenever you are creating your NSURLRequest with your AFHTTPClient subclass you are able to set headers with a few different methods:</p>

<p><code>
[client setDefaultHeader:@""key"" value:@""value""];<br>
[client setAuthorizationHeaderWithUsername:@""username"" password:@""password""];<br>
[client setAuthorizationHeaderWithToken:@""token""];
</code></p>

<p>You can set these before creating your NSURLRequest with something like:</p>

<p><code>NSURLRequest *request = [client requestWithMethod:@""someMethod"" path:@""somePath"" parameters:someParameters];</code></p>

<p>Then your headers should only be in that request. You can also clear your authorization header using <code>- (void)clearAuthorizationHeader</code>. Taking a bit from the AFNetworking <a href=""https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking/blob/master/AFNetworking/AFHTTPClient.m#L401-403"" rel=""nofollow"">source code</a> you can remove any necessary objects from the NSMutableDictionary if they are not otherwise removed.</p>
",1352767039,13353976,True,"<p>I see how to set default headers using AFHTTPClient, but I would like to set certain headers only when I perform requests to certain resources. Is there a way to this than building my own NSURLRequest (with the correct headers), creating an operation and enqueuing that operation to my subclass of AFHTTPClient?</p>
",1349068683,3,iphone ios afnetworking,Setting non-default HTTP headers with AFHTTPClient,902968
12667840,"<p>Here check it out ...</p>

<pre><code>public class Main_WB extends Activity {
EditText edt1, edt2;
// TextView txt_1;

Button btn;

ArrayList&lt;String&gt; result;

@Override
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.main);

    edt1 = (EditText) findViewById(R.id.editText1);
    edt2 = (EditText) findViewById(R.id.editText2);
    btn = (Button) findViewById(R.id.button1);

    result = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();

    btn.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener() {
        public void onClick(View v) {
            result.addAll(getTMSChart(edt1.getText().toString(), edt2.getText().toString()));

            Intent in = new Intent(getApplicationContext(), ResultActivity.class);

            in.putExtra(""gotonextpageX"", result.get(0));
            in.putExtra(""gotonextpageY"", result.get(1));

            startActivity(in);
        }
    });
}

private ArrayList&lt;String&gt; getTMSChart(String FromDate, String ToDate) {
    // txt_1 = (TextView)findViewById(R.id.textView1);

    System.setProperty(""http.keepAlive"", ""false"");
    SoapSerializationEnvelope envelope = new SoapSerializationEnvelope(SoapEnvelope.VER11);

    envelope.dotNet = true;

    String NAMESPACE = ""http://tempuri.org/"";
    String URL = ""http://54.251.60.177/TMSOrdersService/TMSDetails.asmx"";
    String METHOD = ""GetTMSChart"";

    SoapObject request = new SoapObject(NAMESPACE, METHOD);
    request.addProperty(""FromDate"", FromDate);
    request.addProperty(""ToDate"", ToDate);

    envelope.setOutputSoapObject(request);
    HttpTransportSE androidHttpTransport = new HttpTransportSE(URL);

    String x = """", y = """";

    ArrayList&lt;String&gt; stringResult = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();

    try {
        androidHttpTransport.call(NAMESPACE + METHOD, envelope);
        SoapObject result = (SoapObject) envelope.bodyIn;
        SoapObject root = (SoapObject) ((SoapObject) (result).getProperty(0)).getProperty(""NewDataSet"");
        int tablesCount = root.getPropertyCount();

        for (int i = 0; i &lt; tablesCount; i++) {
            SoapObject table = (SoapObject) root.getProperty(i);
            int propertyCount = table.getPropertyCount();

            for (int j = 0; j &lt; propertyCount; j++) {

                stringResult.add(table.getPropertyAsString(""Order_No"").toString());
                stringResult.add(table.getPropertyAsString(""Freight_Rate"").toString());
            }
        }
    } catch (Exception e) {
    }

    return stringResult;

}
}
</code></pre>

<p>And dont change your second class, this must work.</p>

<p><em>Please find my sources for reference</em></p>

<p><strong>Main_WB.java</strong></p>

<pre><code>public class Main_WB extends Activity  
{
EditText edt1,edt2;
//TextView txt_1;
Button btn;

@Override
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) 
{
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.main);

    edt1 = (EditText)findViewById(R.id.editText1);
    edt2 = (EditText)findViewById(R.id.editText2);
    btn = (Button)findViewById(R.id.button1);

    btn.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener()
    {
    public void onClick(View v) 
    {
        getTMSChart(edt1.getText().toString(),edt2.getText().toString());
        Intent myint = new Intent(Main_WB.this,ResultActivity.class);
        startActivity(myint);
    }     
    });
 }

private void getTMSChart(String FromDate,String ToDate)
{
// txt_1 = (TextView)findViewById(R.id.textView1);

 System.setProperty(""http.keepAlive"", ""false"");        
 SoapSerializationEnvelope envelope = new SoapSerializationEnvelope(SoapEnvelope.VER11);        

 envelope.dotNet = true;

 String NAMESPACE = ""http://tempuri.org/"";
 String URL = ""http://54.251.60.177/TMSOrdersService/TMSDetails.asmx"";
 String METHOD = ""GetTMSChart"";

 SoapObject request = new SoapObject(NAMESPACE, METHOD);        
 request.addProperty(""FromDate"", FromDate);               
 request.addProperty(""ToDate"", ToDate);

 envelope.setOutputSoapObject(request);
 HttpTransportSE androidHttpTransport = new HttpTransportSE(URL);

 try 
 {
    androidHttpTransport.call(NAMESPACE + METHOD, envelope);
    SoapObject result = (SoapObject) envelope.bodyIn;
    SoapObject root =  (SoapObject) ((SoapObject)(result).getProperty(0)).getProperty(""NewDataSet"");
    int tablesCount = root.getPropertyCount();

    for (int i = 0; i &lt; tablesCount; i++)
    {
       SoapObject table = (SoapObject) root.getProperty(i);
       int propertyCount = table.getPropertyCount();

    //   String[] ord = new String[propertyCount];
    //   String[] fre = new String[propertyCount];

    // int[] fre = new int[propertyCount];
    // int[] margin = new int[propertyCount];

    for (int j = 0; j &lt; propertyCount; j++)
    {   

    String x,y;

    // int orderNo = Integer.parseInt(table.getPropertyAsString(""Order_No""));
    // int freightRate = Integer.parseInt(table.getPropertyAsString(""Freight_Rate""));
    // int marginPercent = Integer.parseInt(table.getPropertyAsString(""Margin_Percent""));

    String orderNo =  table.getPropertyAsString(""Order_No"");
    String freight = table.getAttributeAsString(""Freight_Rate"");


    x = orderNo.toString();
    y = freight.toString();
    Intent in = new Intent(getApplicationContext(),ResultActivity.class);

    in.putExtra(""gotonextpageX"",x);
    in.putExtra(""gotonextpageY"", y);

    startActivity(in);




    //ord[j] = orderNo;
    //  fre[j] = freightRate;
    // margin[j]= marginPercent;

    //   x = orderNo.toString();
    //   y = fre.toString();

    //   Intent myIntent = new Intent(Main_WB.this, ResultActivity.class);
    //   myIntent.putExtra(""gotonextpage"", x);
    //   startActivity(myIntent);


    // whatever you do with these values
          }                   
       }
    }   
    catch (Exception e) 
    {
    }   
 } }
</code></pre>

<p><strong>ResultActivity.java</strong></p>

<pre><code>public class ResultActivity extends Activity 
{
String x,y;
TextView txt1,txt2;

@Override
public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) 
{
super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
setContentView(R.layout.main1);

Bundle extras = getIntent().getExtras();

if(extras != null)
{   
    x = extras.getString(""gotonextpageX"");
    y = extras.getString(""gotonextpageY"");
}
else
{   
}
txt1 = (TextView)findViewById(R.id.txtVw);
txt2 = (TextView)findViewById(R.id.txtVw2);

txt1.setText(x);
txt2.setText(y);

}}
</code></pre>

    $score = 0;
    if ($total_votes &gt; 0)       { $score = $score+1;}
    if ($total_votes &gt; 10)      { $score = $score+1;}
    if ($total_votes &gt; 100)     { $score = $score+1;}
    if ($total_votes &gt; 1000 &amp;&amp; $total_votes &lt;= 10000 ){
        $score = $score+1;
    }

    echo $score.' ';
}
</code></pre>

12667843,"<p>You could try to implement a 'dictionary function': you call it with the geographic code you mention and it returns the localized content you want to embed in the html template. In background it consults a 'catalog', that typically is an array structure like this: </p>

<pre><code>$LCat = array (
  'India' =&gt; array (
    'Assam' =&gt; array (
      'Dispur' =&gt; ""some Dispur specific content"",
      'Guwahati' =&gt; ""some Guwahati specific content"",
      ... some other cities in that state ...
    ),
    'Orissa' =&gt; array (
      'Bhubaneswar' =&gt; ""some Bhubaneswar specific content"",
      ... some other cities in that state ...
    ),
    ... some other states in that country ...
  ),
  ... some other countries ...
);
</code></pre>

<p>The function looks for a matchin entry in the catalog (e.g. by using the is_set() function): </p>

<pre><code>if ( is_set($LCat[$_SESSION['smart_ip']['location']['country_code']]) ) {
  if ( is_set($LCat[$_SESSION['smart_ip']['location']['country_code']['state_code']]) )
    if ( is_set($LCat[$_SESSION['smart_ip']['location']['country_code']['state_code']['city_code']]) ) ) {
      $Location=$LCat[$_SESSION['smart_ip']['location']['country_code']['state_code']]['city_code']];
    } else {
      $Location=$LCat[$_SESSION['smart_ip']['location']['country_code']['state_code']]
  } else {
    $Location=$LCat[$_SESSION['smart_ip']['location']['country_code']]
} else {
  $Location=""location specific content for 'Nirwana'"";
}
</code></pre>

<p>So the structure is: state > country > city, or whatever structure you require. The idea is: try to use the most specific match in the catalog. If it is not present, then use the entry a little less specific and so on. This way you always have a safe fallback coded in the structure instead of having to code fallbacks for every location your script might stumble upon. </p>

<p>Obviously the content stored for a match can be anything, I only chose simple strings to make the point. Also the structure could be stored in a different way, for example in a file system hierarchy you examine at runtime, a folder for each country, in that a folder for each state, in there files for each city or the like. If you want to improve performance and offer an easy way to manage the catalog data then you sould store that catalog in a database which you query at runtime. The idea remains the same, though. </p>

<p>Note that I have not tested that code, but it should give you a suggestion of a possible approach. </p>

",1349068733,-1,php drupal,Display the content posted in users city automatically based on IP Address of user in a Page,1248114
12667846,"<p>That is an entirely valid and common way to do subtraction, but the 'carry' flag doesn't mean the same thing that it does for normal addition. Since instead of subtracting <code>n</code>, you're adding a large number, the carry flag needs to be handled differently. That extra <code>1</code> would usually signify a carry in bitwise addition, whereas here it signifies that everything worked out right. If there wasn't a carry there, it actually means that the result should have been negative - <code>a - b</code> was converted to <code>a + 2^n - b</code> which was less than <code>2^n</code>, meaning that <code>b &gt; a</code> and so <code>a - b &lt; 0</code>. Either way, it doesn't matter as your result will show up correctly within the 8 bits of your result.</p>
",1349069094,12667887,True,"<p>I want to substract 1 to the number in binary representation 1010 1101. I write the two s complement of 1: 1111 1111, and I sum with the first number:</p>

<p>bitwise addition, with carry, gives 1 1010 1100: because of carry, I end up with 1 bit more. how is this dealt with in binary addition? </p>

<p>also, I am right in the use of two's complement to do addition?</p>

<p>thanks.</p>
",1349068770,2,binary addition operation,Binary substraction : 2's complement & carry,999924
12667847,"<p>This is by design. The play() function only works if it originates from user interaction. This was first implemented by iOS, and is meant to prevent auto play on the limited , and sometimes expensive, bandwidth of a cellphone.</p>

<p>Imagine being in a foreign country with roaming, and what it would cost if your phone would automatically start downloading a video.</p>

12667853,"<p>Update, I didn't see it before, but you need to have the button be a part of the same validation group as your validators. Try this:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;asp:Button ValidationGroup=""Search""
    ID=""Search"" runat=""server"" BackColor=""Black"" Font-Names=""Arial Narrow"" 
    ForeColor=""White"" Text=""SEARCH"" Width=""73px"" onclick=""Search_Click"" /&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>Oh, and I'm pretty sure you need the other logic operator I mentioned before because the ControlToValidate is the primary value that gets evaluated against ControlToCompare so ControlToValidate is LessThan ControlToCompare = StartDate is LessThan EndDate:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;asp:CompareValidator ID=""CompareValidator1"" runat=""server""
    ControlToCompare=""EndDate"" ControlToValidate=""StartDate"" 
    ErrorMessage=""CompareValidator"" Operator=""LessThan"" Type=""Date"" 
    ValidationGroup=""Search"" Display=""Dynamic"" SetFocusOnError=""True""&gt;*First date must be less than or equal to Second date!&lt;/asp:CompareValidator&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>Since you are having problems, I have checked the code in its entirety and this works exactly as it shoul. Copy and paste this:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;asp:RequiredFieldValidator ID=""RequiredFieldValidator1"" runat=""server"" 
ControlToValidate=""StartDate"" ErrorMessage=""RequiredFieldValidator"" 
ValidationGroup=""Search"" SetFocusOnError=""True"" Display=""Dynamic"" 
ToolTip=""*Fill START Date!""&gt;*Fill START Date!&lt;/asp:RequiredFieldValidator&gt;
&lt;asp:RequiredFieldValidator ID=""RequiredFieldValidator2"" runat=""server"" 
ControlToValidate=""EndDate"" ErrorMessage=""*Fill END Date!"" 
ValidationGroup=""Search"" Display=""Dynamic"" ToolTip=""*Fill END Date!"" /&gt;

",1349068863,2,database scala lift,"how to use database in Scala, Lift?",151004
12667859,"<pre><code>void rec(int x) {
    if (x&gt;0)
        rec(x--);
    printf(""%d"",x);
}
</code></pre>

<p>This will recurse forever (or at least until you exhaust your stack space). <code>x--</code> means use the <em>current</em> value of <code>x</code>and <em>then</em> decrement it.</p>

<p>In other words, let's call <code>rec</code> with the parameter 20. That's greater than zero, so it will in turn call <code>rec</code> again with the current value of 20 <em>then</em> decrement <code>x</code> (but effectively <em>after</em> the call returns.</p>

<p>Hence you're forever calling <code>rec</code> with the value of 20, which is why you're blowing out your stack.</p>

<p>If you change <code>x--</code> to <code>--x</code>, it decrements <code>x</code> <em>before</em> passing it to the function, hence it will go <code>20, 19, 18, ... 1, 0</code>, at which point it will run back up the stack printing all those values.</p>

<p>If you had put a <code>printf (""before: %d\n"", x)</code> before the <code>if</code> statement, you would have seen a lot of <code>20</code> lines output to the screen.</p>
",1349069005,12667875,True,"<p>I am really new to programming (I'm an electronics and comm. engineer) and I am not able to figure out why one program works and the other one doesn't. </p>

<p>I'd like to get a good understanding of recursive functions before going any further with my learning. I would appreciate any help regarding this. </p>

<p>I know the difference between the x++ and --x. But in this context of this program, I thought both of these programs should run the same way. But they don't. </p>

<pre><code>void rec(int x)
{
    if(x&gt;0)
        rec(x--);
    printf(""%d"",x);
}

int main()
{
    rec(4);
    _getch();

} /*This doesn't work. And shows a stackoverflow */

void rec(int x)
{
    if(x&gt;0)
        rec(--x);
    printf(""%d"",x);
}

int main()
{
    rec(4);
    _getch();

} /*This gives a proper output as expected*/ 
/*The output is 00123*/
</code></pre>

<p>Thanks!</p>

<p><strong>P.S:</strong> Forgive me if this is a trivial or stupid question, but I am stuck on this and I thought this is the best place I can look for help.</p>

12667862,"<p>You have padding set in your footer's css. That adds up to the width and makes it bigger than 100%. That's why you are seeing a scrollbar.</p>

<p>Replace the padding with these following lines.</p>

<pre><code>padding-top:20px;
padding-bottom:20px;
</code></pre>

<p>Also by setting footer div's min width to 1000px, you will get the scrollbar in browser screens narrower than 1000px.</p>
