12668553,"<p>first class</p>

<pre><code>class XmlReaderPrompt {  
public List&lt;PromptBean&gt; load(String langMode)
{
    String fileName=""db_processor/English.xml"";     
    DocumentBuilderFactory dbf=DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
    InputStream prompt_configfile=Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(fileName);
    DocumentBuilder db = null;
    List&lt;PromptBean&gt; promptMap = new ArrayList&lt;PromptBean&gt;();
    try { 
        try {
            db = dbf.newDocumentBuilder();
        } catch (ParserConfigurationException e) {              
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        Document doc = null;
        try {
            doc = db.parse(prompt_configfile);
        }
        catch(FileNotFoundException fnfexp)
        {
            fnfexp.printStackTrace();               
        }
        catch (SAXException e) {                
            e.printStackTrace();
        }           
        NodeList nodeList=doc.getElementsByTagName(""prompt"");
        for(int i=0;i&lt;nodeList.getLength();i++)
        {
            Node node=nodeList.item(i);
            if(node.getNodeType()==Node.ELEMENT_NODE)
            {                                           
                Element element=(Element)node;
                String id = element.getAttribute(""id"");             
                String name = element.getAttribute(""name"");                 
                String prompt=getTextValue(element);
                promptMap.add(new PromptBean(id,name,prompt));
            }
        }
    }        
    catch(Exception io)
    {
        io.printStackTrace();           
    }
    finally
    {
        db=null;
        dbf=null;
    }       
    return promptMap;
}   

private String getTextValue(Element element) {      
    String textValue=element.getFirstChild().getTextContent().toString();
    return textValue;
}   

}
</code></pre>

<p>second class's method</p>

<pre><code>public String getPromptFunction(String promptTag,String langMode )
{           
    List&lt;PromptBean&gt; promptObject=xrpObject.load(langMode);
    for (Iterator iterator = promptObject.iterator(); iterator.hasNext();) {
        PromptBean promptBean = (PromptBean) iterator.next();
        if(promptBean.getId().equalsIgnoreCase(promptTag)){
            return StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml(promptBean.getPrompt());          
        }
    }
    return null;
} 
</code></pre>

<pre><code>public class XmlReaderPrompt {  
    public Map&lt;String, PromptBean&gt; load(String langMode)
    {
        String fileName=""db_processor/English.xml"";     
        DocumentBuilderFactory dbf=DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
        InputStream prompt_configfile=Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(fileName);
        DocumentBuilder db = null;
        Map&lt;String, PromptBean&gt; promptMap = new HashMap&lt;String, PromptBean&gt;();
        try {
            try {
                db = dbf.newDocumentBuilder();
            } catch (ParserConfigurationException e) {              
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
            Document doc = null;
            try {
                doc = db.parse(prompt_configfile);
            }
            catch(FileNotFoundException fnfexp)
            {
                fnfexp.printStackTrace();               
            }
            catch (SAXException e) {                
                e.printStackTrace();
            }           
            NodeList nodeList=doc.getElementsByTagName(""prompt"");
            for(int i=0;i&lt;nodeList.getLength();i++)
            {
                Node node=nodeList.item(i);
                if(node.getNodeType()==Node.ELEMENT_NODE)
                {                                           
                    Element element=(Element)node;
                    String id = element.getAttribute(""id"");             
                    String name = element.getAttribute(""name"");                 
                    String prompt=getTextValue(element);
                    promptMap.put(id, new PromptBean(id,name,prompt));
                }
            }
        }        
        catch(Exception io)
        {
            io.printStackTrace();           
        }
        finally
        {
            db=null;
            dbf=null;
        }       
        return promptMap;
    }   

    private String getTextValue(Element element) {      
        String textValue=element.getFirstChild().getTextContent().toString();
        return textValue;
    }   

}

12668564,"<p>Capturing results from a repeated sub-expression (in your case <code>(([A-Za-z]*)(\s|-)){1,3}</code>) gets tricky in any language.  I suggest the following as a simpler approach:</p>

<p>1) Match the whole portion you are interested in with a simple Regex:</p>

<pre><code>GetDelay.Pattern = ""is sadly currently in (.*?) undetermined""
</code></pre>

<p>2) Once you have matched the portion of interest, perform further analysis to get what you want.  You could use another RegEx for this step, though I think you could just <a href=""http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/6x627e5f%28v=vs.80%29.aspx"" rel=""nofollow""><code>Split()</code></a> with a space as the delimiter.</p>

12668577,"<p>To call a WebService from AJAX, you need to decorate the service with the <code>[ScriptService]</code> attribute</p>

<p>If you want to access you service using <code>GET</code>:</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Add the <code>[ScriptMethod(ResponseFormat = ResponseFormat.Json, UseHttpGet = true)]</code> attribute to the web method</p>

<pre><code>[WebMethod]
[ScriptMethod(ResponseFormat = ResponseFormat.Json, UseHttpGet = true)]
public string HelloWorld()
</code></pre></li>
<li><p>Add the following configuration to your web.config right under <code>&lt;system.web&gt;</code> (server config where the web service lives).</p>

<pre><code>&lt;webServices&gt;
  &lt;protocols&gt;
    &lt;add name=""HttpGet"" /&gt;
    &lt;add name=""HttpPost"" /&gt;
  &lt;/protocols&gt;
&lt;/webServices&gt;
</code></pre></li>
</ul>

<p>As a reminder, when using XML services you need to access the returned object as:</p>

<pre><code>success: function (m) {
    $res.append(""Message: "" + m.d);
}
</code></pre>

}

12668604,"<p>The correct way to configure a ModeShape engine is to use the JcrConfiguration object, as described <a href=""https://docs.jboss.org/author/display/MODE28/Configuring+ModeShape#ConfiguringModeShape-ProgrammaticConfiguration"" rel=""nofollow"">here</a>. This appears to be what you're doing, so that part is right.</p>

<p>Once you've created your configuration, you can check it for problems:</p>

<pre><code>if ( !configuration.getProblems().isEmpty() ) {
    for ( Problem problem : configuration.getProblems() ) {
         // Report these problems!
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>Assuming there are no problems, you can then use your configuration to create a new JcrEngine instance (see <a href=""https://docs.jboss.org/author/display/MODE28/Using+the+JCR+API+with+ModeShape#UsingtheJCRAPIwithModeShape-ModeShape%27s%7B%7BJcrEngine%7D%7D"" rel=""nofollow"">documentation</a>):</p>

<pre><code>JcrConfiguration config = ...
JcrEngine engine = config.build();
engine.start();
</code></pre>

<p>Then, look up your repository by its name and log in using the JCR API:</p>

<pre><code>javax.jcr.Repository repository = engine.getRepository(""Name of repository"");

Credentials credentials = ...; // JCR credentials
String workspaceName = ...;  // Name of repository workspace
Session session = repository.login(credentials,workspaceName);
</code></pre>

                connected = true;
            }
        }

12668613,"<p>To copy the the pair of rows to a summary sheet you could do this. Two points to note</p>

<ul>
<li>The value rather than the formula is copied using <code>.Value</code>. In this case I used <code>.Value2</code></li>
<li><p>You don't need to copy and paste (unless you want to copy formats), you can simply set one range equal to the values in another</p>

<pre><code>Sub test()
Dim ws1 As Worksheet
Dim ws2 As Worksheet
Dim lngCnt As Long

Set ws1 = ActiveSheet
Application.ScreenUpdating = False
For Each ws2 In ActiveWorkbook.Worksheets
    If Not ws1.Name = ws2.Name Then
        ws1.[a1].Offset(lngCnt, 0).Resize(1, 38).Value2 = ws2.Range(""A293:AL293"").Value2
        ws1.[a1].Offset(lngCnt + 1, 0).Resize(1, 38).Value2 = ws2.Range(""A296:AL296"").Value2
        lngCnt = lngnct + 2
    End If
Next ws2
Application.ScreenUpdating = True
End Sub
</code></pre></li>
</ul>

        ws.Range(""A293:AL293"").Copy Destination:=activeWorksheet.Range(CStr(curRow) &amp; "":"" &amp; CStr(curRow + 288))
     curRow = curRow + 289   
    End If
Next ws
End Sub
</code></pre>

<pre><code>Option Explicit
Sub CreateTempPSDReport()
Dim WS As Worksheet, Rept As Worksheet

Set Rept = Sheets(""Temporary PSD Report"")
Application.ScreenUpdating = False

'--&gt; Loop through each worksheet except the report and
'--&gt; Copy the set range to the report
For Each WS In ThisWorkbook.Worksheets
    If Not WS.Name = ""Temporary PSD Report"" Then
        WS.Range(""A42"", ""I42"").Rows.Copy
        Rept.Cells(Rows.Count, ""A"").End(xlUp).Offset(1, 0).PasteSpecial _
        Paste:=xlPasteValues, Operation:=xlNone, SkipBlanks:=False, Transpose:=False
    End If
Next
Application.ScreenUpdating = True
End Sub
</code></pre>

</code></pre>

<p>portion does.</p>

from (
  select i.catalogid,
    sum(case when (ocardtype in ('PayPal','Sofort') OR
                   ocardtype in ('mastercard','visa') and
                   odate is not null) AND NOT EXISTS (
                     select * from booked b
                     where b.ignoredoid = o.orderid
                   ) then numitems
                   else 0 end) numitems,
    sum(numitems) allitems
  from orders o
  join oitems i on i.orderid=o.orderid
  group by i.catalogid
) X
</code></pre>

12668644,"<p>I am a C# programmer, and hence wont be able to provide a working solutions (as in vb.net code). </p>

<p>I think that you can get this working by doing following things.</p>

<ol>
<li>Write up a method which <a href=""http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/6yyk8z93%28v=vs.80%29.aspx"" rel=""nofollow"">AddHandler</a>s for your respective controls, if and only if, they have specific value set to a property (details in step #2 below)</li>
<li>All controls, to which you want a common handler to be attached, set their <a href=""http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.forms.control.tag.aspx"" rel=""nofollow"">Tag</a> property to a unique value, for example : <code>""KeyDown""</code>. I would recommend use of <code>Enum</code> though in this case, instead of <code>string</code></li>
<li>Now, in your <code>Form</code> constructor, after <code>InitializeComponent</code> call, call the method you wrote in #1 above. This will attach handlers to all desired controls.</li>
<li>If you have multiple forms having this requirement, you can add this functionality to a main form, which acts like a parent for all others (inheritance)</li>
</ol>

<p>Hope I am clear enough and this helps.</p>

12668670,"<p>Use this perl script to convert your file:</p>

<pre><code>#!/usr/bin/perl
while (&lt;STDIN&gt;) {
  $_ =~ s/\\x([0-9A-F][0-9A-F])/chr(hex($1))/eg;
  print $_;
}
</code></pre>

<p>Let's assume you named a file with script as <code>bogusutf</code>, then do the conversion with this command:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>$ perl bogusutf <i>&lt;inputfile >outputfile</i></p>
</blockquote>

",1349075836,12668947,False,"<p>The code below is for viewing images that fly away. But you have to click 'next' or 'prev' buttons for this to happen. I would like it to happen automatically with a timer that stops on each image for about 5 seconds then changes to the next image then begins again without rewinding. (i can del with a rewind function for now but would ultimately like it to be continuous which basically means the each image would have to fly away the return to the rear of the stack.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;div id=""view""&gt;
        &lt;ul id=""stack""&gt;

            &lt;li&gt;&lt;img src=""labels/manzonipinotnoir.png"" /&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
            &lt;li&gt;&lt;img src=""labels/figgepinotnoir.png"" /&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
            &lt;li&gt;&lt;img src=""labels/marinusbernardusredwine.png"" /&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
            &lt;li&gt;&lt;img src=""labels/riverbench.png"" /&gt;&lt;/li&gt;


        &lt;/ul&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=""controls""&gt;
        &lt;button class=""prev""  disabled=""disabled""&gt;Prev&lt;/button&gt;     
        &lt;button class=""next"" &gt;Next&lt;/button&gt;
        &lt;a&gt; Featured Wineries&lt;/a&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;




    &lt;script&gt;
    (function($) {

        var y_space = 50,
            z_space = 50;

        var view = $('#view'),
            lis = $('#stack li'),
            prev = $('.controls .prev'),
            next = $('.controls .next'),
            left = $('#rotate_controls .left'),
            centre = $('#rotate_controls .centre'),
            right = $('#rotate_controls .right');

        var z_index = lis.length,
            current_index = 1,
            translate_y = y_space *-1,
            translate_z = z_space *-1;

        lis.each(function() {

            this.style['-webkit-transform'] = 'translate3d(0px, ' + translate_y + 'px, ' + translate_z + 'px)';
            this.style['-moz-transform'] = 'translate3d(0px, ' + translate_y + 'px, ' + translate_z + 'px)';
            this.style['z-index'] = z_index;

            $(this).data('translate_y', translate_y);
            $(this).data('translate_z', translate_z);

            z_index--;
            translate_y -= y_space;
            translate_z -= z_space;

        });

        next.bind('click', function() {
            if($(this).attr('disabled')) return false;
            lis.each(function() {
                animate_stack(this, y_space, z_space);  
            });
            lis.filter(':nth-child(' + current_index + ')').css('opacity', 0);
            current_index ++;
            check_buttons();
        });

        prev.bind('click', function() {
            if($(this).attr('disabled')) return false;
            lis.each(function() {
                animate_stack(this, -y_space, -z_space);    
            });
            lis.filter(':nth-child(' + (current_index - 1) + ')').css('opacity', 1);
            current_index --;
            check_buttons();    
        });

        $(document).bind('mousewheel', function(event, delta, deltaX, deltaY) {
            if(deltaY &gt;= 0) {
                next.trigger('click');
            }
            else {
                prev.trigger('click');
            }
        });

        function check_buttons() {
            if(current_index==1) {
                prev.attr('disabled', true);
            }
            else {
                prev.attr('disabled', false);
            }

            if(current_index == lis.length) {
                next.attr('disabled', true);                
            }
            else {
                next.attr('disabled', false);
            }
        }





        function animate_stack(obj, y, z) {

            var new_y = $(obj).data('translate_y') + y;
            var new_z = $(obj).data('translate_z') + z;

            obj.style['-webkit-transform'] = 'translate3d(0px, ' + new_y + 'px, ' + new_z + 'px)';
            obj.style['-moz-transform'] = 'translate3d(0px, ' + new_y + 'px, ' + new_z + 'px)';
            $(obj).data('translate_y', new_y)
            .data('translate_z', new_z);

        }


    })(jQuery);
    &lt;/script&gt;
</code></pre>
",1349074302,0,javascript button,automate next/prev buttons in javascript,891499
12668680,"<pre><code> How to detect if a player has not logged in simutaneously and opened two game sessions 
 but without having to refer to a Database or using Sql
</code></pre>

<p>Assuming you use multiple servers you create a processes somewhere that only registers logins and logouts. You have it called whenever one of the two happens. You can use that process to check whether a user is already logged in. You can loadbalance this process by, for instance, running it on all servers and use an algorithm to use serverx only for a subset of the users. Say you have 10 servers, do (userId % 10) to get the Id of the server a user registers login/logout with. </p>

<p>This way you do these checks only in memory with calls between servers. Possibly you will need a timeout/refreshcall so users that disconnect or servers that crash will not keep users logged in forever. </p>

<pre><code>How to control the surge of records into the GameProgress table. so that players get
response quicker. The Server starts to lag at peak hours or when 1000 players are
online
</code></pre>

<p>#1 Switch the postgress database to using SSD's for storage</p>

<p>#2 Elevate this entire process into memory and do not use the database for realtime work</p>

<p>#3 Update records in the database instead of creating new ones</p>

<p>#4 Use multiple databases and distribute users over them</p>

<p>#5 ....</p>

<pre><code>Our table has a primarykey as tournamentid a random 32 character code on basis of
playerids. 
</code></pre>

<p>A randomly generated primary key is very bad practice imho. Use a sequence, or anything  is guaranteed to be unique. If your randomcode is not random enough you will get very nasty bugs. You need to generate this only once per game so it is not a performance bottleneck.</p>
",1349075856,12668952,True,"<p>we are all aware of the popular trend of MMO games. where players face each other live.</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>My area of concern, is storage of player moves and game results. </p>
  
  <p>Using Csharp and PostgreSql v9.0 via NPGSQL adapter </p>
  
  <p>The game client is browser based ASP.NET and calls Csharp functions for all database related processing</p>
</blockquote>

<p>To understand my query, please consider the following scenario</p>

<p><em>we store game progress in a postgres table.</em></p>

<p><strong>For Example</strong> a tournament starts with four players and following activity</p>

<ol>
<li>Each player starts with 100hitpoints</li>
<li>player 1 makes a strike (we refer to a chart to convert blows to hitpoints with random-range %)</li>
<li>player 2 has 92HP, and returns a light blow, so player1 has 98hp</li>
</ol>

<p>The above two round will now be in Game Progress Table, as</p>

<pre><code>ROW Player1HP Player2HP Strikefrom StrikeTo ReturnStrikeHP Round TimeStamp StrikeMethod
1      100       100         0        0            0          0
2       98        92        P1        P2           2          1
</code></pre>

<p>To find if tournament has ended we check 3 players have zero hitpoints Or gametime has elapsed a stipulated timeout value from last progress</p>

<p>our table has a primarykey as tournamentid a random 32 character code on basis of playerids (8 for each player)</p>

<p>There are other columns such as armor , mana, spells , which all get carried forward for each player , in total there are 48 columns - 12 for each player and their attributes</p>

<p>Finally there is a gameResult table that has result of a tournament , with tournamentid, tournament_timestamp, gameresult (complete, PlayerSurrender, InvalidSession , SecurityHack, TimeOut), winnerPlayer , playerMetrics , rowIDfrom, rowIDto</p>

<p><strong>QUERY</strong></p>

<blockquote>
  <p>My questions are focussed on reducing load on Game database or Sql
  queries</p>
</blockquote>

<p><strong>a) How to detect if a player has not logged in simutaneously and opened two game sessions but without having to refer to a Database or using Sql</strong></p>

<p><strong>b) How to control the surge of records into the GameProgress table. so that players get response quicker. The Server starts to lag at peak hours or when 1000 players are online</strong></p>

<pre><code>There is a tremendous flow of sql queries, for ex. even in the current game version
There are average/minimum 100 tournaments online per 12 minutes or 500 players / hour
In Game Progress table, We are storing each player move 
    a 12 round tourament of 4 player there can be 48 records
    plus around same number for spells or special items
    a total of 96 per tourament or 48000 record inserts per hour (500 players/hour)
</code></pre>

<p>I am also considering using a background process in Csharp, that keeps moving expired tournament records from GameProgresstable to another Database where we have a server free of gameplay load. </p>

<p><strong>c) How often should we run vaccum full of postgres .</strong> </p>

<p>I am open to new applications opensource or toPay, that can improve performance. For ex. we used FastCsvReader <a href=""http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/9258/A-Fast-CSV-Reader"" rel=""nofollow"">http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/9258/A-Fast-CSV-Reader</a> to improve enumeration of server log files.</p>

<p>regards
Arvind</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>returns the number of runes in p</p>
</blockquote>

<p>that, as illustrated in <a href=""http://play.golang.org/p/zzB1VrwdER"">this script</a>: the length of ""World"" might be 6 (when written in Chinese: ""世界""), but its rune count is 2:</p>

<pre><code>package main

import ""fmt""
import ""unicode/utf8""

func main() {
    fmt.Println(""Hello, 世界"", len(""世界""), utf8.RuneCountInString(""世界""))
}
</code></pre>

12668685,"<p>On a Mac, there are two ways to make file ""hidden"" or ""invisible"".</p>

<p>Like Linux or Unix, <a href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hidden_file_and_hidden_directory#Unix_and_Unix-like_environments"" rel=""nofollow"">you can start the filename with a dot</a> (.).</p>

<p>You can also use the <a href=""http://hints.macworld.com/article.php?story=20011018172352562"" rel=""nofollow"">setfile</a> tool that ships with Xcode to set attributes to make it invisible (<code>[setfile a -V filename][3]</code>).</p>

<p>Depending on the way, you will have to replace the Win32 specific <code>SetFileAttr</code> call with a Mac specific rename, or find out which API <code>setfile</code> uses to set the attributes.</p>

        alert(""has error class"");       
 }
}
</code></pre>

<pre><code>$(function() {
    $('#trainingFee').on('blur', function() {
        if ($(this).hasClass('error')) {
            alert(""has error class"");
        }
    });

    jQuery(""#form-id"").validate();
});
Joomla.submitbutton = function(task)

12668705,"<p>The code you show only contains personal information fields like birth date and such. I suppose the simplest solution would be to place them inside the <code>User</code> class, and change them using built-in devise actions such as <code>devise/registrations#edit</code>, which applies the changes to <code>current_user</code> as default.</p>

<p>Alternatively, if you want to keep Employee as a separate class, you could try embedding <code>Employee</code> in <code>User</code> class, like this:</p>

<pre><code>class User 
  include Mongoid::Document

  embeds_one :employee
  (...)

class Employee
  include Mongoid::Document

  embedded_in :user
</code></pre>

<p>In this case, you would set up the relation at controller level, e.g.:</p>

<pre><code>class EmployeesController &lt; ApplicationController

  def create
    current_user.create_employee(params[:employee])
  end
</code></pre>

<p>After creation, you could access the user's ID from Employee class as <code>user.id</code>.</p>

",1349074416,1,ruby-on-rails mongodb devise mongoid,Nested attributes in mongodb confusion,898571
12668710,"<p>In the example above, sample.pdf is presumably a File created in Plone. In this case, the URL without /view will render the file for download, and the URL with /view will render a Plone page with a link to download it. This is standard behaviour.</p>

<p>It isn't really possible to stop people from downloading the PDF. You can modify the File FTI in portal_types (go to portal_types/File in the ZMI and change the method aliases tab). If you change the ""(Default)"" alias to be the same as the ""view"" one, it will behave the same. Note that this will affect all files.</p>

<p>Martin</p>

12668711,"<p>Submodule is well-suited to your case, especially since you don't mind included those subrepos in their own subdirectory.</p>

<p>The main serious issue you could have using submodules is when updating them while having updates in progress, as described in ""<a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12078365/how-exactly-does-git-submodule-work/12078816#12078816"">how exactly does git submodule work</a>"":</p>

<p>If you forget to set a branch when making commits in a submodules, said commits will be made on a detached HEAD, and those changes in progress will be loast at the next <code>git submodule update</code> (you can get them back through the <code>reflog</code>, if activated for your submodule repo).</p>

<p>Then, as <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/users/627411/michael"">Michael</a> <a href=""http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12668711/git-using-subtree-or-submodule-to-manage-external-resources/12669096#comment17263309_12669096"">comments</a>, and as I detail in the link above, you need to push the submodule to its own upstream before commit and pushing the parent repo (to avoid pushing unpublish submodule commits) </p>

<pre><code>[OperationContract]
GetSalesDeliveryNotesResponse GetSalesDeliveryNotes(GetSalesDeliveryNotesRequest request);
</code></pre>

<p>The GetSalesDeliveryNotesResponse-class has a property Serials which looks like this:</p>

<pre><code>[DataMember]
public SerialList Serials { get; set; }
</code></pre>

<p>The SerialList class is an inner class of the GetSalesDeliveryNotesResponse and looks like this:</p>

<pre><code>[CollectionDataContract(ItemName = ""Serial"")]
public class SerialList : List&lt;string&gt; {
    public SerialList() : base() { }

    public SerialList(List&lt;string&gt; l) : base() {
        AddRange(l);
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>The code I use to set this property looks like this:</p>

<pre><code>Serials = new GetSalesDeliveryNotesResponse.DeliveryNote.Order.Orderline.SerialList(
    (from s in r.Descendants(""Serial"") 
    select s.Value).ToList()
)
</code></pre>

<p>where r is a collection of XElements (the service connects to an Oracle database, executes a stored procedure which returns an XML which my service has to serialize to the client).</p>

<p>Note that the DeliveryNote, Order and Orderline are also inner classes of the Response-object, but are omitted for brevity (as are a couple of other properties).</p>

<p>The issue I'm having is that the Serials-object in my response (client-side) looks like this:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;Serials&gt;
    &lt;string&gt;123789456&lt;/string&gt;
&lt;/Serials&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>when I would expect it to look like this:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;Serials&gt;
    &lt;Serial&gt;123789456&lt;/Serial&gt;
&lt;/Serials&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>What am I missing here?</p>

<p>//edit:
Some more info:
The client-side implementation of the service has this for the SerialList class:</p>

<pre><code>[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThroughAttribute()]
[System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCodeAttribute(""System.Runtime.Serialization"", ""4.0.0.0"")]
[System.Runtime.Serialization.CollectionDataContractAttribute(Name=""GetSalesDeliveryNotesResponse.DeliveryNote.Order.Orderline.SerialList"", Namespace=""http://schemas.datacontract.org/2004/07/&lt;my_namespace&gt;/DeliveryNoteService.Contract.Response"", ItemName=""Serial"")]
[System.SerializableAttribute()]
public class SerialList : System.Collections.Generic.List&lt;string&gt; { }
</code></pre>

if (count == 1)
{
    value = ABMultiValueCopyValueAtIndex(multi, 0);
    emailid = (NSString*) value;
    NSLog(@""self.emailID   %@"",emailid);
    CFRelease(value);
}
else
{
    for (CFIndex i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)
    {
        label = ABMultiValueCopyLabelAtIndex(multi, i);
        value = ABMultiValueCopyValueAtIndex(multi, i);

        // check for Work e-mail label
        if (CFStringCompare(label, kABWorkLabel, 0) == 0)
        {
            emailid = (NSString*) value;
            NSLog(@""self.emailID   %@"",emailid);
        }
        else if(CFStringCompare(label, kABHomeLabel, 0) == 0)
        {
            emailid = (NSString*) value;
            NSLog(@""self.emailID   %@"",emailid);
        }

        CFRelease(label);
        CFRelease(value);
    }
}

12668766,"<p>You dont need to tell it that iterators have to be members of some types <code>T1</code> and <code>T2</code>, just template it on iterator type itself:</p>

<pre><code>template &lt;typename Iter&gt;
const double Sum(Iter iterator_begin, Iter iterator_end)
{
    double my_sum = 0;
    for (; iterator_begin != iterator_end; ++iterator_end)
        my_sum += *iterator_begin;
    return my_sum;      
}

int main()
{
    std::list&lt;double&gt; test_list;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; Sum(test_list.begin(), test_list.end());
    return 0;
}
</code></pre>

<p>also there is a standard <a href=""http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/algorithm/accumulate"" rel=""nofollow"">std::accumulate</a> that does this:</p>

<pre><code>int main()
{
    std::list&lt;double&gt; test_list;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::accumulate(test_list.begin(), test_list.end(), 0.0);
    return 0;
}
</code></pre>
",1349075553,12668908,True,"<p>I'm trying to overload a Sum function which accepts a [list or vector] start and end iterator as arguments. This compiler error is really confusing me. Relevant code is as follows:</p>

<pre><code>template &lt;typename T1, typename T2&gt;
const double Sum(const typename T1::const_iterator&amp; start_iter, const typename T2::const_iterator&amp; end_iter)
{// overloaded function that calculates sum between two iterators
    typename T1::const_iterator iterator_begin = start_iter;
    typename T2::const_iterator iterator_end = end_iter;

    double my_sum = 0;

    for (iterator_begin; iterator_begin != iterator_end; iterator_begin++)
        my_sum += *iterator_begin;

    return my_sum;      
}

int main()
{

list&lt;double&gt; test_list(10,5.1);
cout &lt;&lt; Sum(test_list.begin(), test_list.end()); // compiler errors here

}
</code></pre>

<p>I get the following compiler errors:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>iterators.cpp(72): error C2783: 'const double Sum(const
  T1::const_iterator &amp;,const T2::const_iterator &amp;)' : could not deduce
  template argument for 'T1'</p>
  
  <p>iterators.cpp(72): error C2783: 'const double Sum(const
  T1::const_iterator &amp;,const T2::const_iterator &amp;)' : could not deduce
  template argument for 'T2'</p>
  
  <p>iterators.cpp(72): error C2780: 'const double Sum(const
  std::map &amp;)' : expects 1 arguments - 2 provided</p>
  
  <p>iterators.cpp(72): error C2780: 'const double Sum(const T &amp;)' :
  expects 1 arguments - 2 provided</p>
</blockquote>

<p>How is the compiler not recognizing I'm trying to call the Sum function with two inputs? I'm calling the function incorrectly?</p>

<p>Thanks!</p>

12668769,"<p>You can't (safely) clone jQuery widgets - they have state that may not get copied.</p>

<p>You should call <code>.datepicker('destroy')</code> on the old element before you clone it, and then call <code>.datepicker()</code> again on the cloned input element to reinitialise it.</p>

12668772,"<p>I would start by hard coding your base url instead of using the site url template variable. This way you can control the format and the trailing slash; so if you include the trailing forward slash in the base url make sure you exclude it in your links.</p>

<p>So if your base url would is <code>&lt;base href=""http://www.yoursite.com/"" /&gt;</code> all your links should be <code>src=""images/example.jpg</code> </p>

<p>At this point modx should use that base path for all urls unless you prefix it with a protocol like HTTP. That's really all there is to it. Also make sure you clear cache often for accurate results.</p>

                            &lt;link type=""text/css"" media=""screen"" rel=""stylesheet"" href=""http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/colorbox.css"" /&gt;

                            &lt;style type=""text/css""&gt;
                            .cboxIE #cboxTopLeft{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderTopLeft.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxTopCenter{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderTopCenter.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxTopRight{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderTopRight.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxBottomLeft{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderBottomLeft.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxBottomCenter{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderBottomCenter.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxBottomRight{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderBottomRight.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxMiddleLeft{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderMiddleLeft.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            .cboxIE #cboxMiddleRight{background:transparent; filter: progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader(src=http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/images/internet_explorer/borderMiddleRight.png, sizingMethod='scale');}
                            &lt;/style&gt;

                            &lt;script type=""text/javascript"" src=""http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/js/jquery.colorbox-min.js""&gt;&lt;/script&gt;

                        &lt;script type=""text/javascript""&gt;

                            var $j = jQuery.noConflict();
                            $j(document).ready(function($)

                            {                      
                                $j(""a.colorbox"").colorbox({width:""80%"", height:""90%"", iframe:true, overlayClose:false, opacity:0.5, transition:""fade"", speed:150});

                                // Bindings
                                $j(document).bind(""cbox_open"", function(){
                                    $j(""body"").css({""overflow"":""hidden""});
                                    $j(""html"").css({""overflow"":""hidden""});
                                    $j(""#qmEditor"").css({""display"":""none""});
                                });  

                                $j(document).bind(""cbox_closed"", function(){      
                                    $j(""body"").css({""overflow"":""auto""});
                                    $j(""html"").css({""overflow"":""auto""});
                                    $j(""#qmEditor"").css({""display"":""block""});
                                    // Remove manager lock by going to home page
                                    $j.ajax({ type: ""GET"", url: ""http://localhost/ModexProject/manager/index.php?a=2"" });
                                });                  

                                // Hide QM+ if cookie found
                                if (getCookie(""hideQM"") == 1)
                                {
                                    $j(""#qmEditor"").css({""display"":""none""});
                                    $j(""#qmEditorClosed"").css({""display"":""block""});    
                                }

                                // Hide QM+
                                $j("".qmClose"").click(function () {
                                    $j(""#qmEditor"").hide(""normal"");
                                    $j(""#qmEditorClosed"").show(""normal"");
                                    document.cookie = ""hideQM=1; path=/;"";
                                });

                                // Show QM+
                                $j(""#qmEditorClosed"").click(function () {
                                    {
                                        $j(""#qmEditorClosed"").hide(""normal"");
                                        $j(""#qmEditor"").show(""normal"");
                                        document.cookie = ""hideQM=0; path=/;"";
                                    }
                                });

                            });

                            function getCookie(cookieName)
                            {
                                var results = document.cookie.match ( ""(^|;) ?"" + cookieName + ""=([^;]*)(;|$)"" );

                                if (results) return (unescape(results[2]));
                                else return null;
                            }

                        &lt;/script&gt;

                        &lt;link rel=""stylesheet"" type=""text/css"" href=""http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/style.css"" /&gt;
                        &lt;!--[if IE]&gt;&lt;link rel=""stylesheet"" type=""text/css"" href=""http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/ie.css"" /&gt;&lt;![endif]--&gt;
                        &lt;!--[if lte IE 7]&gt;&lt;link rel=""stylesheet"" type=""text/css"" href=""http://localhost/ModexProject/assets/plugins/qm/css/ie7.css"" /&gt;&lt;![endif]--&gt;
                        &lt;/head&gt;
&lt;body id=""top""&gt;
                        &lt;div id=""qmEditorClosed""&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

                        &lt;div id=""qmEditor""&gt;

12668776,"<p>You need to fetch all the rows:</p>

<pre><code>$rows = array();
$query = mysql_query(
   ""SELECT DISTINCT document, doc_name FROM table ORDER BY id ASC"");

while($row = mysql_fetch_array($query) {
  $rows[] = $row
}

var_dump($rows);
</code></pre>
",1349075103,12668822,False,"<p>When I type in PHPmyadmin SQL query:</p>

<pre><code>SELECT DISTINCT document, doc_name 
FROM table 
ORDER BY id ASC
</code></pre>

<p>I get a <code>2x2</code> table, which is good result.</p>

<p>But when I do it from php code:</p>

<pre><code>$d = mysql_fetch_array(mysql_query(""SELECT DISTINCT document, doc_name FROM table ORDER BY id ASC"")) or die(mysql_error());

print_r ($d);
</code></pre>

<p>I don't get the same result as from PHPmyadmin.</p>

<pre><code>Array ( [0] =&gt; xxx-xxx [document] =&gt; xxx-xxx [1] =&gt; name1 [doc_name] =&gt; name1 ) 
</code></pre>

<p>How can I fix it?</p>
",1349074843,0,php sql phpmyadmin,mysql_fetch_array gives wrong records,1617954
12668785,"<p>I'd generally avoid trying to do so, but the following matches what you've asked for:</p>

<pre><code>declare @T table (ColumnA int,ColumnB char(1))
insert into @T(ColumnA,ColumnB) values
(2    ,       'a'),
(3   ,        'b'),
(4  ,         'c'),
(5 ,          'd'),
(1,           'a')

;With Bs as (
    select distinct ColumnB from @T
)
select
    SUM(t.ColumnA),b.ColumnB
from
    Bs b
        inner join
    @T t
        on
            b.ColumnB &gt;= t.ColumnB
group by
    b.ColumnB
</code></pre>

<p>Result:</p>

<pre><code>            ColumnB
----------- -------
3           a
6           b
10          c
15          d
</code></pre>

<p>For small data sets, this will be fine. But for larger data sets, note that the last row of the table relies on obtaining the <code>SUM</code> over the entire contents of the original table.</p>
",1349075540,12668905,False,"<p>How would you do to tranform a Column in a table from this: </p>

<pre><code>ColumnA   ColumnB
2           a
3           b
4           c
5           d
1           a
</code></pre>

<p>to this:</p>

<pre><code>ColumnA          ColumnB
3                 a
6(=3+3)           b   
10(=4+3+3)        c   
15(=5+4+3+3)      d 
</code></pre>

<p>I'm interested to see esp. what method you would pick.</p>

<p>Thanks!</p>
",1349074862,4,sql sql-server sql-server-2008 cumulative-sum,Cumulating value of current row + sum of previous rows,15498
12668797,"<p>Have you looked at QAbstractItemView's DragDropMode ? <a href=""http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/qabstractitemview.html#dragDropMode-prop"" rel=""nofollow"">http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/qabstractitemview.html#dragDropMode-prop</a></p>

<p>It sounds as though this ius what you are trying to achieve.</p>
",1351515589,13122176,False,"<p>I have implemented the following methods for drag and drop</p>

<pre><code>void mousePressEvent(QMouseEvent *event);
void dragEnterEvent(QDragEnterEvent *event);
void dragMoveEvent(QDragMoveEvent *event);
void dropEvent(QDropEvent *event);
void startDrag(Qt::DropActions supportedActions);
</code></pre>

<p>I have a QListView and have used setIndexWidget() to show a custom widget at each modelindex. I am trying to arrange the items in the listview using drag and drop, However the items in the listview are not arranged properly, I have written the following code:-</p>

<pre><code>MyListView::MyListView(QWidget *parent) :
    QListView(parent)
{
    setSelectionMode(QAbstractItemView::SingleSelection);
    setDragEnabled(true);
    setAcceptDrops(true);
    setDragDropMode(QAbstractItemView::InternalMove);
    setDefaultDropAction(Qt::MoveAction);
    setDropIndicatorShown(true);
    setDragDropOverwriteMode(true);
    setMovement(QListView::Snap);
    setFlow(QListView::TopToBottom);
//    setStyleSheet(""QListView::item {""
//                  ""height: 50px;""
//                  ""border: 1px solid black;}"");
}

void MyListView::setModel(QAbstractItemModel *model)
{
    QListView::setModel(model);

    for (int i=0; i&lt;model-&gt;rowCount(); i++)
    {
        QModelIndex index = model-&gt;index(i,0);
        ListWidgetItem *widget = new ListWidgetItem;
        widget-&gt;setIndex(i);;
        setIndexWidget(index,widget);
    }
}

void MyListView::mousePressEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
{
    QModelIndex i = indexAt(event-&gt;pos());
    if (event-&gt;button() ==  Qt::LeftButton)
    {
        ListWidgetItem *item = dynamic_cast&lt;ListWidgetItem *&gt;(childAt(event-&gt;pos()));

        if (!item)
            return;

        y = event-&gt;pos().y()-item-&gt;pos().y();

        QModelIndex indx = indexAt(event-&gt;pos());
        currentPixmap = QPixmap::grabWidget(item);
        dragPoint = event-&gt;pos();
        if (event-&gt;pos().x() &lt; 25 &amp;&amp; indx.row() &gt;= 0)
            startDrag(Qt::MoveAction);
    }
}

void MyListView::dragEnterEvent(QDragEnterEvent *event)
{
   if (event-&gt;mimeData()-&gt;hasFormat(""application/x-QListView-DragAndDrop""))
   {
       event-&gt;accept();
   }
    else
        event-&gt;ignore();
}

void MyListView::dragMoveEvent(QDragMoveEvent *event)
{
    ListWidgetItem *item = dynamic_cast&lt;ListWidgetItem *&gt;(childAt(event-&gt;pos()));
    if(!item)
        return;

    itemList.append(item);

    foreach (ListWidgetItem *widget,itemList)
    {
        if (widget == item)
            widget-&gt;setStyleSheet(""#ListWidget { border-top: 2px solid red; }"");
        else
            widget-&gt;setStyleSheet(""#ListWidget { border-top: 0px solid black; }"");
    }
    if (event-&gt;mimeData()-&gt;hasFormat(""application/x-QListView-DragAndDrop""))
    {
        event-&gt;setDropAction(Qt::MoveAction);
        event-&gt;accept();
    } else
        event-&gt;ignore();
}

void MyListView::dropEvent(QDropEvent *event)
{
    if (event-&gt;mimeData()-&gt;hasFormat(""application/x-QListView-DragAndDrop"")) {
        QByteArray itemData = event-&gt;mimeData()-&gt;data(""application/x-QListView-DragAndDrop"");
        QDataStream dataStream(&amp;itemData,QIODevice::ReadOnly);

        QPoint itemPoint;
        dataStream &gt;&gt; itemPoint;

        ListWidgetItem *item = dynamic_cast&lt;ListWidgetItem *&gt; (childAt(itemPoint));
        if(!item)
            return;

        QModelIndex index = indexAt(event-&gt;pos());
        int row = index.row();
        model()-&gt;insertRows(row,1);

        QModelIndex idx =model()-&gt;index(row,0);
        setIndexWidget(idx,item);

        if (event-&gt;source() == this) {
            event-&gt;setDropAction(Qt::MoveAction);
            foreach (ListWidgetItem *widget,itemList)
            {
                widget-&gt;setStyleSheet(""#ListWidget { border-top: 0px solid black; }"");
            }
            itemList.clear();
//            model()-&gt;removeRow(n+1);

            event-&gt;accept();
        }
    } else{
        event-&gt;ignore();
    }
}

void MyListView::startDrag(Qt::DropActions supportedActions)
{
    QByteArray itemData;
    QDataStream dataStream(&amp;itemData, QIODevice::WriteOnly);

    ListWidgetItem *item = dynamic_cast&lt;ListWidgetItem *&gt;(childAt(dragPoint));

    dataStream &lt;&lt; dragPoint;

    QMimeData *mimeData = new QMimeData;
    mimeData-&gt;setData(""application/x-QListView-DragAndDrop"", itemData);

    drag = new QDrag(this);
    drag-&gt;setMimeData(mimeData);
    drag-&gt;setHotSpot(mapToParent(QPoint(item-&gt;x(),y)));
    drag-&gt;setPixmap(currentPixmap);

    QModelIndex indx = indexAt(dragPoint);
    if (drag-&gt;exec(Qt::MoveAction | Qt::CopyAction) == Qt::MoveAction)
     {
        model()-&gt;removeRow(indx.row());
     }

}
</code></pre>

<p>I have searched but didnt get any proper solution.
Thanks</p>

12668805,"<p>This post <a href=""http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/32313/How-to-invoke-Java-web-service-in-ASP-net-using-C"" rel=""nofollow"">How to invoke Java web service in ASP.net using C#</a> will give you some direction. Essentially, you need to:</p>

<ol>
<li>Create a Java Web Service
<ul>
<li>Create a web application project</li>
<li>Add web service to the project</li>
<li>Add operations to the web service</li>
<li>Implement the web methods</li>
<li>Deploy and test the web service</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Create ASP.net Web Site Using C#
<ul>
<li>Create ASP.net web site</li>
<li>Add a web reference</li>
<li>Write code to invoke web service</li>
<li>Test web service client application</li>
</ul></li>
</ol>

<p>The tutorial above by Bikash Shaw aims develop simple mathematical functions like addition, subtraction etc. using Java web services called <code>JSimpCalcWebService</code>:</p>

<pre><code>package calc.ws;

import javax.jws.WebMethod;
import javax.jws.WebParam;
import javax.jws.WebService;
import calc.util.NumberFormater;

/**
* @author Bikash Shaw
*/
@WebService()
public class JSimpCalcWebService {

/**
  * Web service operation
  */
  @WebMethod(operationName = ""addition"")
  public String addition(@WebParam(name = ""parameter1"")
  double parameter1, @WebParam(name = ""parameter2"")
  double parameter2) {
 //TODO write your implementation code here:
      return NumberFormater.format((parameter1 + parameter2),0,6);
 }
</code></pre>

<p>}</p>

<p>Example C# code to invoke the web service:</p>

<pre><code>using System;
using System.Configuration;
using System.Data;
using System.Linq;
using System.Web;
using System.Web.Security;
using System.Web.UI;
using System.Web.UI.HtmlControls;
using System.Web.UI.WebControls;
using System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts;
using System.Xml.Linq;
using JSimpCalcWebServiceService;

public partial class _Default : System.Web.UI.Page 
{
    JSimpCalcWebServiceService.JSimpCalcWebServiceService proxy;

    protected void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        proxy = new JSimpCalcWebServiceService.JSimpCalcWebServiceService();
    }

   protected void btnAddition_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
   {
       try
       {
           lblResultAddition.Text = ""Result: "" +    proxy.addition(double.Parse(txtbtnAdditionParameter1.Text), 
                                double.Parse(txtbtnAdditionParameter2.Text));
       }
       catch (FormatException)
       {
           lblResultAddition.Text = ""Result: Invalide Input"";
       }
       UpdatePanelAddition.Update();
   }
 // Add more methods here...
 }
</code></pre>

12668815,"<p>Maybe this will help.  Here's an example of how to dump simple local variables when a breakpoint is hit.  I'm not displaying char* arrays correctly, I'm not sure how I should get the data for these to display it like ""frame variable"" would display it but I'll figure that out later when I have a free minute.</p>

<pre><code>struct datastore {
  int val1;
  int val2;
  struct {
     int val3;
  } subdata;
  char *name;
};

int main (int argc, char **argv)
{
  struct datastore data = {1, 5, {3}, ""a string""};
  return data.val2;
}

Current executable set to 'a.out' (x86_64).
(lldb) br se -l 13
Breakpoint created: 1: file ='a.c', line = 13, locations = 1
(lldb) br comm add -s python
Enter your Python command(s). Type 'DONE' to end.
&gt; def printvar_or_children(var):
&gt;   if var.GetNumChildren() == 0 and var.IsInScope():
&gt;     path = lldb.SBStream()
&gt;     var.GetExpressionPath(path)
&gt;     print '%s: %s' % (path.GetData(), var.GetValue())
&gt;   else: 
&gt;     for subvar in var:
&gt;       printvar_or_children(subvar)
&gt; 
&gt; print 'variables visible at breakpoint %s' % bp_loc
&gt; for var in frame.arguments:
&gt;   printvar_or_children(var)
&gt; for var in frame.locals:
&gt;   printvar_or_children(var)
&gt; 
&gt; DONE
(lldb) r
variables visible at breakpoint 1.1: where = a.out`main + 51 at a.c:13, address = 0x0000000100000f33, resolved, hit count = 1 
argc: 1
*(*(argv)): '/'
data.val1: 1
data.val2: 5

*(data.name): 'a'
Process 84865 stopped
* thread #1: tid = 0x1f03, 0x0000000100000f33 a.out`main + 51 at a.c:13, stop reason = breakpoint 1.1
    frame #0: 0x0000000100000f33 a.out`main + 51 at a.c:13
   10   int main (int argc, char **argv)
   11   {
   12     struct datastore data = {1, 5, {3}, ""a string""};
-&gt; 13     return data.val2;
(lldb)
</code></pre>

<p>Tip - for sanity's sake I worked on the python over in a side text editor and pasted it into lldb as I experimented.</p>

<p>If you use the frame variable command in lldb to explore your variables at a given stop location, that's the same basic way that you can access them via the SBFrame that is provided to your breakpoint python command in the 'frame' object.</p>

<p>Hope that helps to get you started.</p>
",1349082680,12670389,True,"<p>As part of debugging a problem that might be related to my UIVIews, I want to write a python script to run from LLDB. I had thought to extract all settings for a view in a breakpoint and all view children, to allow me to compare states. I checked out the WWDC video on the topic and then spent time reading things at lldb.llvm.org/scripting.html, and didn't find them very helpful. A web search for examples led to nothing substantially different from those.</p>

<p>My problem is that I'm trying to figure out how to access iOS variables at my breakpoint. The examples I've seen do things like convert numbers and mimic shell commands. Interesting stuff but not useful for my purposes. I've been reading my way through the help info with ""script help(lldb.SBValue)"" and the like, but it is slow going as the results are huge and it is not clear what the use patterns are. I feel like one decent example of how to traverse a few iOS objects would help me understand the system. Does anyone know of one or can share a snippet of code?</p>

<p><strong>UPDATE:</strong></p>

<p>I wrote this to help me track down a bug in my UIView use. I want to do a bit more work to refine this to see if I could show the whole view tree, but this was sufficient to solve my problem, so I'll put it here to save others some time.</p>

<pre><code>import lldb
max_depth = 6
filters = {'_view':'UIView *', '_layer':'CALayer *', '_viewFlags':'struct'}

def print_value(var, depth, prefix):
    """""" print values and recurse """"""
    global max_depth
    local_depth = max_depth - depth
    pad = ' ' * local_depth
    name = var.GetName()
    typ = str(var.GetType()).split('\n')[0].split('{')[0].split(':')[0].strip()

    found = name in filters.keys() # only visit filter items children
    if found:
        found = (filters.get(name) == typ)

    value = var.GetValue()
    if value is None or str(value) == '0x00000000':
        value = ''
    else:
        value = ' Val: %s' % value

    if var.GetNumChildren() == 0 and var.IsInScope():
        path = lldb.SBStream()
        var.GetExpressionPath(path)
        path = ' pathData: %s' % path.GetData()
    else:
        path = ''

    print '^' * local_depth, prefix, ' Adr:', var.GetAddress(), ' Name:', name, ' Type:', typ, value, path

    if var.GetNumChildren() &gt; 0:
        if local_depth &lt; 2 or found:
            print pad, var.GetNumChildren(), 'children, to depth', local_depth + 1
            counter = 0
            for subvar in var:
                subprefix = '%d/%d' % (counter, var.GetNumChildren())
                print_value(subvar, depth - 1, subprefix)
                counter += 1

def printvh (debugger, command_line, result, dict):
    """""" print view hierarchy """"""
    global max_depth
    args = command_line.split()
    if len(args) &gt; 0:
        var = lldb.frame.FindVariable(args[0])
        depth = max_depth
        if len(args) &gt; 1:
            depth = int(args[1])
            max_depth = depth
        print_value(var, depth, 'ROOT')
    else:
        print 'pass a variable name and optional depth'
</code></pre>

<p>And I added the following to my .lldbinit :</p>

<pre><code>script import os, sys
# So that files in my dir takes precedence.
script sys.path[:0] = [os.path.expanduser(""~/lldbpy"")]
script import views
command script add -f views.printvh printvh
</code></pre>

<p>so that I can just type ""printvh self 3"" at the LLDB prompt.</p>

",1349176495,12689258,True,"<p>How to show annotation present in an entity in popup window by using html web resource. <pre><code>function retann() {
//debugger;

var serverUrl = Xrm.Page.context.getServerUrl();

var GUIDvalue = Xrm.Page.data.entity.getId();

// Creating the Odata Endpoint
var oDataPath = ""http://url/organization/XRMServices/2011/OrganizationData.svc/"";
var retrieveReq = new XMLHttpRequest();
var Odata = oDataPath + ""/AnnotationSet?$select=DocumentBody,FileName,MimeType,ObjectId&amp;$filter=ObjectId/Id eq guid'"" + GUIDvalue + ""'"";
retrieveReq.open(""GET"", Odata, false);
retrieveReq.setRequestHeader(""Accept"", ""application/json"");
retrieveReq.setRequestHeader(""Content-Type"", ""application/json; charset=utf-8"");
retrieveReq.onreadystatechange = function () { retrieveReqCallBack(this); };
retrieveReq.send(); 
}


function retrieveReqCallBack(retrieveReq) {
if (retrieveReq.readyState == 4 /* complete */) {

//debugger;

    var retrieved = this.parent.JSON.parse(retrieveReq.responseText).d;

     ""window.top.opener.Xrm.Page.data.entity.save();"" +
    ""this.window.close();"" +
    ""}"" +
    ""&lt;/script&gt;"";

    var n = retrieved.results.length;
    for (var i = 0; i &lt; retrieved.results.length; i++) {
        message += "" &lt;input type='radio' name='test' value=' "" + i + ""' /&gt;"" + retrieved.results[i].FileName + ""&lt;br /&gt;"";
    }
    myWindow = window.open('', '', 'width=500,height=150,left=250,top=250,scrollbars=yes,resizable=yes,directories=yes');

    myWindow.focus();

}
}

12668838,"<p>What are you trying to do exactly?</p>

<p>Do you want to use RSA to encrypt the mobileNo and pin before sending it to the server?</p>

<p>If this the case, you might want to generate a key pair at your server and <em>only</em> make the public key accessible to your android.</p>

<p>The code above generates both private and public key in Android which I do not think what you want to do here.</p>

<p>Check this article to learn how to generate the keys in your server and use them in Android
<a href=""http://www.helloandroid.com/tutorials/rsa-string-encryption-security"" rel=""nofollow"">http://www.helloandroid.com/tutorials/rsa-string-encryption-security</a></p>

public void postLoginData() 

   {
             Intent i = new   
   Intent(this.getApplicationContext(),new.class);
             Bundle bundle = new Bundle();
             bundle.putString(""mno"", mobile.getText().toString());
             bundle.putString(""pinno"", pin.getText().toString());

            ///this is RSA code which i found





   import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
   import java.io.FileOutputStream;
   import java.io.IOException;
   import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
   import java.math.BigInteger;
   import java.security.Key;
   import java.security.KeyFactory;
   import java.security.KeyPair;
   import java.security.KeyPairGenerator;
   import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
   import java.security.spec.RSAPrivateKeySpec;
   import java.security.spec.RSAPublicKeySpec;

        /**
        * This class generates key pair and saves in file in current directory
       * 
       * @author amit
       * 
       */
        public class RSAKeyGenerator {

public void generateKeyPair(String publicKeyFileName,
        String privateKeyFileName) {
    KeyPairGenerator kpg = null;
    try {
        kpg = KeyPairGenerator.getInstance(""RSA"");
    } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) {
        // TODO Auto-generated catch block
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    kpg.initialize(2048);
    KeyPair kp = kpg.genKeyPair();
    Key publicKey = kp.getPublic();
    Key privateKey = kp.getPrivate();
    try {
        KeyFactory fact = KeyFactory.getInstance(""RSA"");
        RSAPublicKeySpec pub = fact.getKeySpec(publicKey,
                RSAPublicKeySpec.class);
        RSAPrivateKeySpec priv = fact.getKeySpec(privateKey,
                RSAPrivateKeySpec.class);

        saveToFile(publicKeyFileName, pub.getModulus(),
                pub.getPublicExponent());
        System.out.println(""public key saved"");
        saveToFile(privateKeyFileName, priv.getModulus(),
                priv.getPrivateExponent());
        System.out.println(""private key saved"");
    } catch (Exception e) {
        System.out.println(""error "");
    }
}

private void saveToFile(String fileName, BigInteger mod, BigInteger exp)
        throws IOException {
    ObjectOutputStream oout = new ObjectOutputStream(
            new BufferedOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(fileName)));
    try {
        oout.writeObject(mod);
        oout.writeObject(exp);
    } catch (Exception e) {
        throw new IOException(""Unexpected error"", e);
    } finally {
        oout.close();
    }
}

/**
 * @param args
 */
public static void main(String[] args) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
    RSAKeyGenerator t = new RSAKeyGenerator();
    t.generateKeyPair(""public.key"", ""private.key"");

}

        }








        import javax.crypto.Cipher;

         public class RSAEncDec {

private PublicKey readPublicKeyFromFile(String fileloc) throws IOException {
    InputStream in = new FileInputStream(new File(fileloc));

    ObjectInputStream oin = new ObjectInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(
            in));
    try {
        BigInteger m = (BigInteger) oin.readObject();
        BigInteger e = (BigInteger) oin.readObject();
        RSAPublicKeySpec keySpec = new RSAPublicKeySpec(m, e);
        KeyFactory fact = KeyFactory.getInstance(""RSA"");
        PublicKey pubKey = fact.generatePublic(keySpec);
        return pubKey;
    } catch (Exception e) {
        throw new RuntimeException(""Spurious serialisation error"", e);
    } finally {
        oin.close();
    }
}

private PrivateKey readPrivateKeyFromFile(String fileLoc)
        throws IOException {
    InputStream in = new FileInputStream(new File(fileLoc));

    ObjectInputStream oin = new ObjectInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(
            in));
    try {
        BigInteger m = (BigInteger) oin.readObject();
        BigInteger e = (BigInteger) oin.readObject();
        RSAPrivateKeySpec keySpec = new RSAPrivateKeySpec(m, e);
        KeyFactory fact = KeyFactory.getInstance(""RSA"");
        PrivateKey prvKey = fact.generatePrivate(keySpec);
        return prvKey;
    } catch (Exception e) {
        throw new RuntimeException(""Spurious serialisation error"", e);
    } finally {
        oin.close();
    }
}

public byte[] rsaEncrypt(byte[] data, String fileLoc) {
    try {
        PublicKey pubKey = readPublicKeyFromFile(fileLoc);
        Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance(""RSA"");
        cipher.init(Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, pubKey);
        byte[] cipherData = cipher.doFinal(data);
        return cipherData;
    } catch (Exception e) {
        System.out.println(""some thing went wrong"");
    }
    return null;
}

public byte[] rsaDecrypt(byte[] data, String fileLoc) {
    try {
        PrivateKey pubKey = readPrivateKeyFromFile(fileLoc);
        Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance(""RSA"");
        cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, pubKey);
        byte[] cipherData = cipher.doFinal(data);
        return cipherData;
    } catch (Exception e) {
        System.out.println(""some thing went wrong"");
    }
    return null;
}

/*
 * string
 * 
 * @param data (normal string)
 * 
 * @return
 */
public String encrypt(String data, String fileLoc) {
    byte[] enc = rsaEncrypt(data.getBytes(), fileLoc);
    return Base64.encode(enc);
}

/**
 * return the normal string
 * 
 * @param data
 *            (base64 encoded string)
 * @return
 * @throws Base64DecodingException
 */
public String decrypt(String data, String fileLoc)
        throws Base64DecodingException {
    byte[] enc = Base64.decode(data);
    byte[] decryptedData = rsaDecrypt(enc, fileLoc);
    return new String(decryptedData);
}

/**
 * 
 * @param args
 */
public static void main(String[] args) {
    // TODO Auto-generated method stub
    RSAEncDec obj = new RSAEncDec();
    String enc = obj.encrypt(""hello world"", ""./public.key"");
    System.out.println(enc);
    String dat = null;
    try {
        dat = obj.decrypt(enc, ""./private.key"");
    } catch (Base64DecodingException e) {
        // TODO Auto-generated catch block
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    System.out.println(dat);

        }

       }
</code></pre>

12668841,"<p>I daresay that  dots on the end are just placeholder for display of values too long for display / printout as byte array.  There is nothing wrong with your base64 encoding code,    but why are you recording JPEG?  Just read your file in byte array ( not in one gulp but chunked,  I would choose buffer size to be  multiple of 4 ),  convert it on the fly and write it into output stream. </p>

<p>PS:  reading while files in android is bad practice as memory is very constrained - you will 
bad performance.  </p>

<p>Here is the sample code but I'm lazy to compile or debug it:</p>

    outputStream.write(outBuf);
}

",1349075205,1,android image base64,How to convert image into base64 string android?,683735
12668854,"<p>According to the docs <a href=""http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/Runtime.html#exec%28java.lang.String%29"" rel=""nofollow""><code>exec()</code>:</a></p>

<blockquote>
  <p>Executes the specified string command in a separate process.</p>
</blockquote>

<p>So any call to <code>exec()</code> should not block unless you used <code>waitFor()</code> on the returned process of the <code>Runtime</code> .</p>

<p>Here is a small example(Exception handling omitted):</p>

<pre><code>Process p=Runtime.getRuntime().exec(""cmd.exe /c ping 127.0.0.1 -n 10"");

System.out.println(""Here 1"");//this will execute immediately

try {

    p.waitFor();

    System.out.println(""Here 2"");//this will only be seen after +- 10 seconds and process has finished

} catch (InterruptedException ex) {
   ex.printStackTrace(); 
}
</code></pre>

   PlayThisSlideShow(""PresentationInProjector.jpg"");
</code></pre>

12668858,"<p>The biggest issue I'm seeing is that you're specifying a width for those li's as ""0.2%"", which just displays as a solid black line for me, even with content inside them.
Second, you may also be referring to the fact that there's more purple between the li's than there is to the left.  That is because you have a left and right margin set at 20px.  This means that the left-most li is 20 px from the left, and 20px from the right of the next li which has a 20px margin to its left.
Essentially you have 20 px to the left of the left-most li, 20px margin to the right of the right-most, and 40px (20 + 20) between them all.</p>

12668861,"<p>You don't need a Python wrapper for a Java lib, nltk's got Snowball! :) </p>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; from nltk.stem import SnowballStemmer as SS
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer = SS('english')
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dance')
u'danc'
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('danced')
u'danc'
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dancing')
u'danc'
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dancer')
u'dancer'
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('accordance')
u'accord'
</code></pre>

<p>Stemming isn't always going to give you exact roots, but it's a great start.</p>

<p>Following is an example of using stems. I'm building a dictionary of <code>stem: (word, count)</code> while choosing the shortest word possible for each stem. <code>So ['dancing', 'danced', 'dances', 'dance', 'dancer'] converts to {'danc': ('dance', 4), 'dancer': ('dancer', 1)}</code></p>

<p><strong>Example Code</strong>: <em>(text taken from <a href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dance"" rel=""nofollow"">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dance</a>)</em></p>

<pre><code>import re
from nltk.stem import SnowballStemmer as SS

text = """"""Dancing has evolved many styles. African dance is interpretative.
Ballet, ballroom (such as the waltz), and tango are classical styles of dance
while square dancing and the electric slide are forms of step dances.
More recently evolved are breakdancing and other forms of street dance,
often associated with hip hop culture.
Every dance, no matter what style, has something in common.
It not only involves flexibility and body movement, but also physics.
If the proper physics are not taken into consideration, injuries may occur.""""""
#extract words
words = [word.lower() for word in re.findall(r'\w+',text)]

stemmer = SS('english')
counts = dict()

#count stems and extract shortest words possible
for word in words:
    stem = stemmer.stem(word)
    if stem in counts:
        shortest,count = counts[stem]
        if len(word) &lt; len(shortest):
            shortest = word
        counts[stem] = (shortest,count+1)
    else:
        counts[stem]=(word,1)

#convert {key: (word, count)} to [(word, count, key)] for convenient sort and print
output = [wordcount + (root,) for root,wordcount in counts.items()]
#trick to sort output by count (descending) &amp; word (alphabetically)
output.sort(key=lambda x: (-x[1],x[0]))
for item in output:
    print '%s:%d (Root: %s)' % item
</code></pre>

<p><strong>Output</strong>:</p>

<pre><code>dance:7 (Root: danc)
and:4 (Root: and)
are:4 (Root: are)
of:3 (Root: of)
style:3 (Root: style)
the:3 (Root: the)
evolved:2 (Root: evolv)
forms:2 (Root: form)
has:2 (Root: has)
not:2 (Root: not)
physics:2 (Root: physic)
african:1 (Root: african)
also:1 (Root: also)
as:1 (Root: as)
associated:1 (Root: associ)
ballet:1 (Root: ballet)
ballroom:1 (Root: ballroom)
body:1 (Root: bodi)
breakdancing:1 (Root: breakdanc)
---truncated---
</code></pre>

<p>I wouldn't recommend lemmatization for your specific needs:</p>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; from nltk.stem.wordnet import WordNetLemmatizer
&gt;&gt;&gt; lmtzr = WordNetLemmatizer()
&gt;&gt;&gt; lmtzr.lemmatize('dance')
'dance'
&gt;&gt;&gt; lmtzr.lemmatize('dancer')
'dancer'
&gt;&gt;&gt; lmtzr.lemmatize('dancing')
'dancing'
&gt;&gt;&gt; lmtzr.lemmatize('dances')
'dance'
&gt;&gt;&gt; lmtzr.lemmatize('danced')
'danced'
</code></pre>

<p>Substrings are not a good idea because it will always fail at a certain point, and many times fail miserably.</p>

<ul>
<li>fixed-length: pseudo-words 'dancitization' and 'dancendence' will match 'dance' at 4 and 5 characters respectively.</li>
<li>ratio: a low ratio will return fakes (like above)</li>
<li>ratio: a high ratio will not match enough (e.g. 'running')</li>
</ul>

<p>But with stemming you get:</p>

<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dancitization')
u'dancit'
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dancendence')
u'dancend'
&gt;&gt;&gt; #since dancitization gives us dancit, let's try dancization to get danc
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dancization')
u'dancize'
&gt;&gt;&gt; stemmer.stem('dancation')
u'dancat'
</code></pre>

<p>Which is an impressive no-match result for the stem ""danc"". Even considering 'dancer' does not stem to 'danc', the accuracy is pretty high overall.</p>

<p>I hope this helps you get started.</p>
",1349082130,12670269,True,"<p>I'm looking for a way to produce a numerical probability value for single words which share a common root word/meaning.</p>
