",1349075314,3,python string comparison counter frequency,Probability count/frequency of related words?,1678159
12668864,"<p>Cisco doesn't use IPFIX, but NetFlow v9.  Although IPFIX is derived from Cisco's NetFlow v9 specification, there are some differences.  One of them is that IPFIX allows for per-vendor namespaces in the field type numbers using the PrivateEnterpriseNumber.   NetFlow v9 does not have such a facility, therefore vendors have to arbitrarily choose a range of numbers to report their custom fields on and hope no one else picks the same range.   In this case, I'm guessing your getting your NetFlow tickets from Cisco ASA, which indeed uses a number of fields in the range of 40000-40005.</p>

<p>There is a document called '<a href=""http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/asa/asa83/netflow/netflow.html"" rel=""nofollow"">Cisco ASA 5500 Series Implementation Note for NetFlow Collectors, 8.3</a>' which describes those fields.</p>
",1359105307,14518662,False,"<p>While analyzing Netflow V9, I am able to get most of the fields ids correctly along with their values as that is defined in </p>

<p><a href=""http://www.iana.org/assignments/ipfix/ipfix.xml"" rel=""nofollow"">http://www.iana.org/assignments/ipfix/ipfix.xml</a></p>

<p>but I am getting 40000 ,40001, 40002, ...   instead of 224, 225, 226, ... for NAT fileds,
however the values for each fields I retrieved are correct.</p>

<p>I am certain that all fields' id and value are correctly obtained.
I don't know what is the real problem. I tried with conversion of host to network byte and vice versa using </p>

<pre><code>field_type = socket.ntohs(struct.unpack('H', template_data[a:b])[0])
</code></pre>

<p>P.S. I used cisco router for netflow v9.</p>
",1349075329,2,python cisco netflow,Incorrect field id in netflow v9,2010375
12668869,"<p>That's because you have to accept the new incoming connection using <a href=""http://sg2.php.net/socket_accept"" rel=""nofollow""><code>socket_accept()</code></a>, passing in the socket you've used for <code>socket_listen()</code>.</p>

<p>The resulting socket can be used to check for incoming data as expected.</p>

<p><strong>Edit</strong></p>

<p>It seems that you forgot to add <code>$write = $this-&gt;sockets;</code> before your call to <code>socket_select()</code>.</p>
",1349075771,12668940,False,"<p>I am writing a WebSocket server. While handshaking is successful and server can send encoded data using RFC standard, socket_select() can only detect changes when a new client is connected, not when the client send data to the server. What is happening?</p>

<pre><code>class Server{
private $address;
private $port;
private $master;
private $sockets;
private $stream_sockets;
private $clients;
private $verbose_mode;


    function __construct($address = '127.0.0.1', $port = 5001, $verbose_mode = true){
        $this-&gt;address = $address;
        $this-&gt;port = $port;
        $this-&gt;verbose_mode = $verbose_mode;
        $this-&gt;console(""Socket server is starting..."");

        //socket creation
        $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
        if(!socket_set_option($socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, 1))
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""Failed to set socket option: "".socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }

        if(!socket_set_nonblock($socket))
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""Failed to set socket nonblock: "".socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }

        if(!is_resource($socket))
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""Failed to create socket: "".socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        if(!socket_bind($socket, $this-&gt;address, $this-&gt;port))
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""Failed to bind socket: "".socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        if(!socket_listen($socket, 20))
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""Failed to listen: "".socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        $this-&gt;master = $socket; //add current socket resource as master socket
        $this-&gt;sockets = array($socket);//add current resource to all sockets
        $this-&gt;console(""Socket server started on {$this-&gt;address}:{$this-&gt;port}"");
    }

    public function run(){
        $this-&gt;console(""Start running..."");
        $write = array();
        $except = array();
        while(isset($this-&gt;sockets[0])){
            $changed_sockets = $this-&gt;sockets;
            $result = socket_select($changed_sockets, $write, $except, 1 ,0);
            //@stream_select($changed_sockets, $write = null, $except = null, 0, 5000);
            if($result &gt; 0)
            {
                $this-&gt;console(""number of sockets: "".count($this-&gt;sockets));
                $this-&gt;console(""number of changed sockets: "".$result);
                foreach($changed_sockets as $socket)
                {
                    if($socket == $this-&gt;master)//self changed
                    {
                        if(($accepted_socket = socket_accept($this-&gt;master))!== false)//incoming connection
                        {
                            $this-&gt;connect($accepted_socket);//add as a client to the pool with info to be tracked without handshaking at first
                        }
                        else
                        {
                            $this-&gt;console(""Socket error: "".socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
                        }
                    }
                    else //must be others in sockets pool
                    {   
                        $this-&gt;console(""Finding socket associated with the client..."");
                        $client = $this-&gt;get_client_by_socket($socket); //get client object to track them using socket that they are associated with
                        if($client){
                            $this-&gt;console(""receiving data from the client."");
                            $bytes = @socket_recv($socket, $data, 2048, MSG_DONTWAIT);
                            $this-&gt;console(""byte size received: $bytes"");
                            if(!$client-&gt;get_handshake())//check if handshaking has done
                            {
                                $this-&gt;console(""handshaking..."");
                                $this-&gt;handshake($client, $data);//handshaking if it is not done previously
                            }
                            else if($bytes === 0)
                            {
                                $this-&gt;disconnect($client);
                            }
                            else
                            {
                                $this-&gt;console(""incoming data from client {client-&gt;get_id()}"");
                                $this-&gt;read($client, $data);//read from client if there are changes in sockets
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }

    private function slingshot($client, $read){
        $send=""00:00:00:00""."",DM,SAY,0,"".$read;
        fwrite($client-&gt;get_stream_socket(), $send);//output to apollo
        //workaround for apollo
        if($client-&gt;get_initial())
        {
            $initial = 7;
            $continue = 0;
        }
        else
        {
            $initial = 8;
            $continue = 1;
        }
        while(TRUE)
        {   
            //input from iris
            $num = fgets($client-&gt;get_stream_socket(), $initial);//$number of words
            if(ltrim($num) &gt; 0)
            {
                $res = fgets($client-&gt;get_stream_socket(), ltrim($num)+1);
                if($res!="""")
                {
                    fgets($fp,1);
                    $client-&gt;set_initial(false);
                    $res = $num.$res;
                    $res = substr($res,6+$continue);
                    //output to client
                    $message = rtrim($res);
                    send($client, $message);
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
    }

    private function read($client, $received){
        $read = $this-&gt;unmask($received);
        $this-&gt;console(""received from client: "".$read);
        if($read == ""##client exit##"") {
            $this-&gt;console(""Killing a child process"");
            posix_kill($client-&gt;get_pid(), SIGTERM);
            $this-&gt;console(""Process {$client-&gt;get_pid()} is terminated."");
        }
        else
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""start a child process"");
            $pid = pcntl_fork();
            if($pid == -1)
            {
                die('could not fork.');
            }
            else if($pid)
            {
                $client-&gt;set_pid($pid);
            }
            else
            {
                //we are the child
                $this-&gt;slingshot($client, $read);
            }
        }
    }

    private function disconnect($client){
        $this-&gt;console(""Disconnecting client #{$client-&gt;get_id()}"");
        $i = array_search($client, $this-&gt;clients);//search client in clients pool
        $j = array_search($client-&gt;get_socket(), $this-&gt;sockets);//search client's socket in socket pool
        if($j &gt;= 0)
        {
            array_splice($this-&gt;sockets, $j, 1);
            socket_close($client-&gt;get_socket());
            $this-&gt;console(""Socket closed."");
        }
        if($i &gt;= 0)
        {
            array_splice($this-&gt;clients, $i, 1);
        }
        $this-&gt;console(""Client #{$client-&gt;get_id()} disconnected."");
    }

    private function unmask($payload) {
        $length = ord($payload[1]) &amp; 127;
        if($length == 126)
        {
            $masks = substr($payload, 4, 4);
            $data = substr($payload, 8);
        }
        elseif($length == 127)
        {
            $masks = substr($payload, 10, 4);
            $data = substr($payload, 14);
        }
        else
        {
            $masks = substr($payload, 2, 4);
            $data = substr($payload, 6);
        }

        $text = '';
        for ($i = 0; $i &lt; strlen($data); ++$i){
            $text .= $data[$i] ^ $masks[$i%4];
        }

        return $text;
    }

    private function encode($text){
        // 0x1 text frame (FIN + opcode)
        $b1 = 0x80 | (0x1 &amp; 0x0f);
        $length = strlen($text);

        if($length &lt;= 125)
        {
            $header = pack('CC', $b1, $length);
        }
        elseif($length &gt; 125 &amp;&amp; $length &lt; 65536)
        {
            $header = pack('CCS', $b1, 126, $length);
        }
        elseif($length &gt;= 65536)
        {
            $header = pack('CCN', $b1, 127, $length);
        }
        return $header.$text;
    }

    private function send($client, $text){
        $this-&gt;console(""Client {$client-&gt;get_id()}&lt;&lt;"".$text);
        $text = $this-&gt;encode($text);
        if(socket_write($client-&gt;get_socket(), $text, strlen($text)) === false) {
            $this-&gt;console(""Unable to write to client #{$client-&gt;get_id()}'s socket"");
            $this-&gt;disconnect($client);
        }
    }

    private function start_process(){
        $this-&gt;console(""start a child process"");
        $pid = pcntl_fork();
        if($pid == -1)
        {
            die('could not fork.');
        }
        else if($pid)
        {
            $client-&gt;set_pid($pid);
        }
        else
        {
            //we are the child
            $this-&gt;send($client, ""something to be sent."");
        }
    }

    private function handshake($client, $headers){//data as headers
        $this-&gt;console(""Getting client WebSocket version..."");
        if(preg_match(""/Sec-WebSocket-Version: (.*)\r\n/"", $headers, $match))
        {
            $version = $match[1];
        }
        else
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""The client doesn't support WebSocket."");
        }
        $this-&gt;console(""Client WebSocket version is {$version}, (required: 13)"");
        if($version == 13)
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""Getting headers..."");
            if(preg_match(""/GET (.*) HTTP/"", $headers, $match))
            {
                $root = $match[1];
            }
            if(preg_match(""/Host: (.*)\r\n/"", $headers, $match))
            {
                $host = $match[1];
            }
            if(preg_match(""/Origin: (.*)\r\n/"", $headers, $match))
            {
                $origin = $match[1];
            }
            if(preg_match(""/Sec-WebSocket-Key: (.*)\r\n/"", $headers, $match))
            {
                $key = $match[1];
            }

            $this-&gt;console(""client Headers are:"");
            $this-&gt;console(""\t- Root: "".$root);
            $this-&gt;console(""\t- Host: "".$host);
            $this-&gt;console(""\t- Origin: "".$origin);
            $this-&gt;console(""\t- Sec-WebSocket-Key: "".$key);

            $this-&gt;console(""Generating Sec-WebSocket-Accept key..."");
            $acceptKey = $key.'258EAFA5-E914-47DA-95CA-C5AB0DC85B11';
            $acceptKey = base64_encode(sha1($acceptKey, true));

            $upgrade = ""HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols\r\n"".
                       ""Upgrade: websocket\r\n"".
                       ""Connection: Upgrade\r\n"".
                       ""Sec-WebSocket-Accept: $acceptKey"".
                       ""\r\n\r\n"";

            $this-&gt;console(""sending this response to the client #{$client-&gt;get_id()}:\r\n"".$upgrade);
            socket_write($client-&gt;get_socket(), $upgrade);
            $client-&gt;set_handshake(true);
            $this-&gt;console(""Handshake is successfully done!"");
            return true;
        }
        else
        {
            $this-&gt;console(""WebSocket version 13 is required (the client supports version {$version})"");
            return false;
        }
    }

    private function get_client_by_socket($socket){
        foreach($this-&gt;clients as $client)//get all client objects from the pool and check one by one
        {
            if($client-&gt;get_socket() == $socket)//if socket returned from the client matches with parameter
            {
                $this-&gt;console(""client found"");
                return $client;
            }
        }
        return false;//no such client
    }

    private function connect($socket){
        $this-&gt;console(""creating client..."");
        $client_id = uniqid();
        while(true){
            $stream_socket = @stream_socket_client(""tcp://127.0.0.1:10000"", $errno, $errstr);
            if($stream_socket)
            {
                $this-&gt;console(""Apollo client created for client #$client_id."");
                break;
            }
            else
            {
                $this-&gt;console(""creation failed. Attempting to recreate Apollo client."");
            }
        }
        $client = new Client($client_id, $socket, $stream_socket);
        $this-&gt;clients[] = $client; //add the socket as client to be tracked
        $this-&gt;sockets[] = $socket;//add socket as resource to sockets pool
        $this-&gt;stream_sockets[] = $stream_socket;//add socket as resource to stream sockets pool
        $this-&gt;console(""Client #{$client-&gt;get_id()} is successfully created!"");
    }

    private function console($text, $continue = true){
        if(!$continue)
        {
            die($text);
        }
        if($this-&gt;verbose_mode)
        {
            echo date('[Y-m-d H:i:s] ').$text.""\r\n"";
        }
    }

}
</code></pre>
",1349075353,0,php webbrowser websocket,Why PHP socket_select() cannot detect changes when client send data,1338292

12668879,"<p>If you just started to use PHP and MySQL why not starting to learn PDO as <code>mysql_*</code> functions are deprecated.</p>

<p>Make sure you have data in the <code>example</code> table, check with PHPMyAdmin and follow <a href=""http://wiki.hashphp.org/PDO_Tutorial_for_MySQL_Developers"" rel=""nofollow"">this nice guide</a>.</p>

<p>Your code should be:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
    $db = new PDO('mysql:host=localhost;dbname=test;charset=UTF-8', 'username', 'password', array(PDO::ATTR_EMULATE_PREPARES =&gt; false, PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE =&gt; PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION));

    echo ""&lt;table border='1'&gt;"";
    echo ""&lt;tr&gt; &lt;th&gt;Name&lt;/th&gt; &lt;th&gt;Age&lt;/th&gt; &lt;/tr&gt;"";

    $stmt = $db-&gt;query(""SELECT * FROM example"");
    while($row = $stmt-&gt;fetch(PDO::FETCH_ASSOC)) {
        echo ""&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td&gt;""; 
        echo $row['name'];
        echo ""&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;""; 
        echo $row['age'];
        echo ""&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;""; 
    }

    echo ""&lt;/table&gt;"";
?&gt;
</code></pre>

12668880,"<p>The comparison is not entirely correct. The difference between node.js and express.js in the level of abstraction:</p>

<ol>
<li>Node.js is a <em>platform</em> for building server-side <em>event-driven i/o application</em> using javascript.</li>
<li>Express.js is a <em>framework based on node.js</em> for building <em>web-application</em> using principles and approaches of node.js</li>
</ol>

<p>So, if you write web-application, you can try to use Express.js. In all other cases, it does not suit for you.</p>

12668885,"<blockquote>
  <p>Is there any method to connect to local machine database from server</p>
</blockquote>

<p>Yes there is. You just configure the local database to accept connections from the remote host your script is running on and give your script the WAN hostname and port of your database server.</p>

<p>This is nothing that special, sort of standard database configuration. The database vendor will offer you more dedicated support in your individual issue for your specific configuration, you might want to try as well the Mysql support forums and mailinglist.</p>

<ol>
<li>Set price_type when creating an bundle item will create an index so the item is displayed correctly on front end</li>
<li>Change it second time <code>price_type =&gt; 1 // fixed or 0 // dynamic</code> when you update the product ( using the api )</li>
</ol>

12668900,"<p>You should save it in a file, i recommend using <code>SharedPreferences</code> and then read it from there each time they start the application, and see if the matches are correct or not.</p>

<p>To save it:</p>

<pre><code>SharedPreferences sp = context.getSharedPreferences(""loginSaved"", Context.MODE_PRIVATE);
SharedPreferences.Editor editor = sp.edit();
editor.putString(""username"", ""some user value"");
editor.putString(""password"", ""some password value"");
editor.commit();
</code></pre>

<p>To get it:</p>

<pre><code>SharedPreferences sp = context.getSharedPreferences(""loginSaved"", Context.MODE_PRIVATE);
String username = sp.getString(""username"", null);
String password = sp.getString(""password"", null);
if(username != null &amp;&amp; password != null){
    // login automatically with username and password    
}
else{
    // login for the first time
}
</code></pre>

12668913,"<p>Just put what you want to remove in a set:</p>

<pre><code>[^0-9a-zA-Z.,@&amp;(){}\[\]:;]+
</code></pre>

<p>Use the <code>test</code> method, and you can use the same regular expression for the check and the replace, instead of having one positive and one negative:</p>

<pre><code>function deleteSpecialChar(txtName, event) {
  var re = /[^0-9,a-z,A-Z\.,@&amp;\(\)\{\}\[\]:;]+/g;
  if (txtName.value != '' &amp;&amp; txtName.value.test(re)) {
    txtName.value = txtName.value.replace(re, '');
  };
}
</code></pre>

        txtName.value = txtName.value.replace(/[\W]/g, '');
    };
}
$('input[type=text]').live('keypress keyup keydown cut copy paste', function (event) {

    deleteSpecialChar(this, event);
});
</code></pre>

12668922,"<p>You have multiple options to realize that:</p>

<p>One way is to create a symbolic link, so you would use the underlaying operating system to fool red5 that there is a file existing.
You will then have to add Listeners in your ApplicationAdapter to listen to the needed events.
For example:
<a href=""http://dl.fancycode.com/red5/api/org/red5/server/adapter/ApplicationAdapter.html"" rel=""nofollow"">http://dl.fancycode.com/red5/api/org/red5/server/adapter/ApplicationAdapter.html</a>
=> streamStart/stop et cetera. You have to lookup the ApplicationAdapter of your Red5 version to see all possible events that you can listen in the Red5 version that you are using!</p>

<p>The second solution would be to write a custom stream Handler. However this would need further investigation. I don't think that there is a standard mechanism to modify the file request to apply some kind of wildcard to it.
It would work similar to the first solution, but you would need to rewrite/overwrite some of the mechanisms of the ApplicationAdapter to that process file requests.</p>

<p>So basically the best thing would be to study your ApplicationAdapter and find the event listeners you are looking for.</p>

12668924,"<p>You could create a class representing an array on disk (based on its index in the file of arrays), let's call it <code>FileBackedIntArray</code>, and put instances of that as the values of a <code>HashMultimap&lt;Integer, FileBackedIntArray&gt;</code>:</p>

<pre><code>public class FileBackedIntArray {
    // Index of the array in the file of arrays
    private final int index;
    private final int lastElement;

    public FileBackedIntArray(int index, int lastElement) {
        this.index = index;
        this.lastElement = lastElement;
    }

    public int getIndex() {
        return index;
    }

    public int[] readArray() {
        // Read the file and deserialize the array at the associated index
        return smth;
    }

    public int getLastElement() {
        return lastElement;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return index;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean equals(Object o) {
        if (this == o) {
            return true;
        } else if (o == null || o.getClass() != getClass()) {
            return false;
        }

        return index == ((FileBackedIntArray) o).index;
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p><em>Do you actually need an <code>Integer[]</code> and not an <code>int[]</code>, by the way (i.e. you can have <code>null</code> values)?</em> As you've said in the comments, you don't really need an <code>Integer[]</code>, so using <code>ints</code>s everywhere will avoid boxing/unboxing and will save a lot of space since you appear to have lots of them. Hopefully you don't have a huge number of possible values for the last element (x).</p>

<p>You then create an instance for each array and read the last element to put it the <code>Multimap</code> without keeping the array around. Populating the <code>Multimap</code> needs to be either sequential or protected with a lock if concurrent, but reading can be concurrent without any protection. You could even create an <code>ImmutableMultimap</code> once the <code>HashMultimap</code> has been populated, to guard against any modification, a safe practice in a concurrent environment.</p>

In this scenario, the keys are not unique, but key-value pairs are unique.  Reading of this multimap (assuming that it's possible) will be concurrent.  I'm also open to suggestions of other ways to approach this.<br>

12668932,"<p>Data-* attributes are supported on Spring 3.0 form tags (along with any validly-named custom attribute you specify, I believe). You can also use the value of a bean's property as the attribute value, e.g.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;form:input data-test=""${myBean.propertyName}"" path=""propertyName"" /&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>To answer the second part of your question, where you ask if there's a way to get the Spring form tag library to populate the data-* attributes with the contents of the bean's property that you specify, this does not happen automatically: you would need to write a custom tag that does this.</p>

12668962,"<p>Instead of storing your threads in a ""simple"" associative array maybe you should instantiate a threadpool beforehand (you can find an example of implementation here h**p://code.activestate.com/recipes/577187-python-thread-pool/ or directly use the following lib <a href=""http://pypi.python.org/pypi/threadpool"" rel=""nofollow"">http://pypi.python.org/pypi/threadpool</a>). </p>

<p>Also instantiate a ""watchdog"", each of your thread will hold a reference to this watchdog, so when your threads need to do their callback they'll send back the info to this watchdog. (beware of the deadlock, look at <a href=""http://dabeaz.blogspot.fr/2009/11/python-thread-deadlock-avoidance_20.html"" rel=""nofollow"">http://dabeaz.blogspot.fr/2009/11/python-thread-deadlock-avoidance_20.html</a>).</p>

<p>Note : sorry for the lame ""h**p"" but SO won't let me post more than 2 links....</p>

12675062,"<p>Session variables in PHP need to be stored in the <code>$_SESSION</code> magic variable to persist them across multiple pages. To ensure that a page has access to the session, you also need to call <code>session_start()</code> on each page.</p>

<p>In this case, changing <code>$chk</code> to <code>$_SESSION['chk']</code> and adding <code>session_start()</code> at the top of each page will probably do the trick.</p>

12668970,"<p>You should create a source structure like the following:</p>

<pre>
.
├── pom.xml
└── src
    └── main
        ├── java
        ├── resources
        └── webapp
            ├── WEB-INF
            └── resources
                └── css
                    └── style.css.gz
</pre>

<p>The <code>src/main/java</code> will contain all your java code.</p>

<p>The <code>src/main/resources/</code> should contain resources used by your application and that should not be publicly available. For example Resource Bundles, property files etc.</p>

<p>The <code>src/main/webapp/</code> will contain your web application specific files.</p>

<p>Also make sure that the <code>&lt;packaging&gt;war&lt;/packaging&gt;</code> tag is added to your pom.</p>

",1349075961,1,css jsp tomcat maven compression,Make maven serve files like css.gz and js.gz,1350762
12668977,"<p>I achieved the same result with a before insert trigger. This way i don't need to write any insert statement in the trigger.    </p>

<pre><code>ALTER TRIGGER ""InsertIntoCardDetail"" before insert on
DBA.CardDetail
referencing new as new_name
for each row
begin
  if(new_name.hourfinish is null)
    and exists(select 1
      from CardDetail
      where hourfinish is null) then
    raiserror 99999 'Cannot have Multiple Nulls'
  end if;
end
</code></pre>
",1349189415,12692681,True,"<p>I have to create a trigger that does not allow more than one null in a certain column (hourfinish). Here is the trigger I wrote (I am using Sybase):</p>

<pre><code>ALTER TRIGGER ""InsertIntoCardDetail"" instead of insert on
DBA.CardDetail
referencing new as new_name
for each row
begin
  declare @nullCount integer;
  if(new_name.hourfinish is null) then
    select COUNT(*) into @nullCount
      from CardDetail
      where hourfinish is null;
    if(@nullCount &gt; 0) then
      raiserror 99999 'Cannot have Multiple Nulls'
    else
      insert into CardDetail( card,hourstart,hourfinish,""work"",project,N) 
        values( new_name.card,new_name.hourstart,new_name.hourfinish,new_name.""work"",new_name.project,new_name.N) 
    end if
  else
    insert into CardDetail( card,hourstart,hourfinish,""work"",project,N) 
      values( new_name.card,new_name.hourstart,new_name.hourfinish,new_name.""work"",new_name.project,new_name.N) 
  end if
end
</code></pre>

<p>The trigger works fine. What I am asking is if there is a command executing the insert - a command that can replace those long insert statements.</p>

    if (photoFile == null)
    {
        return RedirectToAction(""ErrorPage"");

    var viewModel = ...;   // but your've lost the Edit part
    return View(viewModel);
 }

",1349075999,1,c# asp.net-mvc-3 file-upload,Uploading file through an action of a controller - two forms in one view,60761
12668992,"<p>First, consider your data file.  Each line contains 10 numbers and 3 strings.  It would be easy to think that it contains 10 numbers and 1 string, but since a space is used as a delimiter and the characters <code>Iron - Alpha</code> are not enclosed in quotation marks they make 3 strings, not 1.  </p>

<p>Next, <code>textscan</code> will only behave itself as you wish if you provide a complete description of the input line in the format specification.  For example, the following</p>

<pre><code> M = textscan(fid, '%f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %f %s %s %s')
</code></pre>

<p>works just fine for me.  Since you only want the first 5 columns of data, and this reads all the data, you can easily delete the unwanted columns.  </p>

<p>If you want or need to avoid reading the unwanted data you'll have to get a little smarter.  You can instruct <code>textscan</code> to ignore specific fields like this:</p>

<pre><code> M = textscan(fid, '%f %f %f %f %f %*f %*f %*f %*f %*f %*s %*s %*s')
</code></pre>

<p>which reads only the first 5 fields in each line.  The documentation will point you towards ways of refining your reading routine even further.</p>

<p>(Freehand typed untested code, so might have typos. Please report back if it doesn't work)</p>

<pre><code>Sub ClickIEButton()
    Dim ie As Object
    Dim form As Variant, button As Variant

    Set ie = CreateObject(""InternetExplorer.Application"")
    ie.Visible = True
    ie.Naviagate (""http://whateverwebsite.com"")
    While ie.ReadyState &lt;&gt; 4
        DoEvents
    Wend

    Set form = ie.Document.Body.GetElementsByTagName(""form"")(0) '&lt;-- You may need to change this 0 to 1 or 2 or 3 etc....
    Set button = form.GetElementsByTagName(""button"")(0)  '&lt;-- You may need to change this 0 to 1 or 2 or 3 etc....
    button.Click
End Sub

",1349077346,12669215,False,"<p>I am using some static images in my application and the images is being kept in the drawable folder.The size of the images are near about 2 MB but I have scaled them properly but still it is showing out of memory error due to the bitmap size during run time.And this is specially for samsung galaxy s3.
Can anybody plz tell me how to stop this and to reduce the bitmap size. </p>

<p>I have tried using this code for recycling images:</p>

<pre><code> public static Bitmap decodeSampledBitmapFromResource(Resources res, int resId,
        int reqWidth, int reqHeight) {

    // First decode with inJustDecodeBounds=true to check dimensions
    final BitmapFactory.Options options = new BitmapFactory.Options();
    options.inJustDecodeBounds = true;
    BitmapFactory.decodeResource(res, resId, options);

    // Calculate inSampleSize
    options.inSampleSize = calculateInSampleSize(options, reqWidth, reqHeight);

    // Decode bitmap with inSampleSize set
    options.inJustDecodeBounds = false;
    return BitmapFactory.decodeResource(res, resId, options);
}






public static int calculateInSampleSize(
            BitmapFactory.Options options, int reqWidth, int reqHeight) {
    // Raw height and width of image
    final int height = options.outHeight;
    final int width = options.outWidth;
    int inSampleSize = 8;

    if (height &gt; reqHeight || width &gt; reqWidth) {
        if (width &gt; height) {
            inSampleSize = Math.round((float)height / (float)reqHeight);
        } else {
            inSampleSize = Math.round((float)width / (float)reqWidth);
        }
    }
    return inSampleSize;
}
</code></pre>
",1349076299,0,android,Out of memory error due to large bitmap size,796414
12669031,"<p>I strongly recommend you maintain a separate repo for your private framework (as I understand it's gonna be used in different projects). For example, if you use git, just add it as submodule to your project and then reference it from there. (use relative paths only!). </p>

<p>This way you can keep enhancing your framework as you work with it so you can commit hotfixes, work on new features and test it while working on your projects, in a very natural way.</p>

12669034,"<p>Simply reset the value of <code>CONNECT_PROC</code>:</p>

<pre><code>db2 ""update db cfg for &lt;db&gt; using connect_proc ''""
</code></pre>

<p>You do not need to have a database connection to execute this statement.  This will set CONNECT_PROC back to the default (NULL), and you'll be able to connect to the database again.</p>

BEGIN
 CALL BLOCK_DB.A ();

12669036,"<p>1) A DLL does not have a web.config or any other .config. </p>

<p>2) Deploying a Service as a DLL does not prevent anyone from seeing the (disassembled) code. </p>

<p>3) You may be able to configure your service in code, but only when it's self-hosting. Which would usually be as an EXE, a DLL needs something else to host it. </p>

urlpatterns = patterns('',
    (r'^$', 'mysite.views.language_router')


## mysite.views:

def language_router(request):
    if request.META['HTTP_HOST'].find('myspanishdomain.com') != -1 \
            and request.META['PATH_INFO'] == '/' :
        return HttpResponseRedirect('http://www.myspanishdomain.com/es/')
    return cms.views.details(request, '')
</code></pre>

12669044,"<p>Not explicitly (that I know of). To find information about users you have to look at the system view <a href=""http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/server.112/e25513/statviews_5081.htm#REFRN23302"" rel=""nofollow"">DBA_USERS</a>.</p>

<p>You could do it on tablespace finding all users where the default tablespace is one you created; or you could simply list the default users in an IN statement:</p>

<pre><code>select *
  from dba_users
 where username not in ('SYS','SYSTEM',...)
</code></pre>

<p>My preferred method would be to use the date the user was created. By definition a default user is created with the database so every user created after a certain date is not a default user. </p>

<p>On the database I'm currently connected to the following would work; you'd obviously have to alter the date portions of this to fit your own environment</p>

<pre><code>select *
  from dba_users
 where trunc(created) &gt; to_date('2009/08/15','yyyy/mm/dd')
</code></pre>

</code></pre>

FROM [;database=test.accdb].table1;
</code></pre>

",1349076499,0,php mysql,Dynamically remove part of sql query upon execution,1627086
12669073,"<blockquote>
  <p>when I try to compile the program I get an error saying ""cannot convert from 'const A' to 'const A **' ""</p>
</blockquote>

<p>Then, the first thing you must do is understand the compiler error. What is trying to say the compiler?</p>

<p>In the <code>B</code> constructor you're initializing a member of the type <code>const A **</code> with a given parameter of the type <code>const A &amp;</code>; they aren't of the same type and this is why the compiler is complaining.</p>

<p>So, what to do to fix it?</p>

<p>You must make the <code>B</code> constructor to take the same type of the member variable as argument.</p>

<pre><code>class B
{
private:
    const A** theArray;
public:
    B(const A**);
};

B::B(const A** newA)
    : theArray(newA) //&lt;-- They're of the same type: no problem.
{
}
</code></pre>

<p>But you must ensure that the calls outside the class matches the constructor definition.</p>

<p>But instead of it, I advise to revise the design, you're sure that naked pointers is the only solution to your problem? You must answer this questions in order to improve the <code>class B</code>:</p>

<ul>
<li>Where the dynamic memory is created an where is destroyed?</li>
<li>The <code>class B</code> takes the ownership of the given <code>A**</code>?</li>
</ul>

<p>If the <code>class B</code> will be the owner of the dynamic memory, you must think about creating and destroying the <code>theArray</code> inside the <code>class B</code> itself not outside.</p>

<p>If the <code>class B</code> will not be the owner of the dynamic memory, you must be very careful about the memory: The memory pointed by <code>theArray</code> will be destroyed after of before the <code>class B</code>? in other words, could be a <code>class B</code> instance with memory pointed by <code>theArray</code> already deleted? In this case, smart pointers could be a good help.</p>
",1349079191,12669602,True,"<ul>
<li>I have two classes, A and B</li>
<li>Class B has a private member variable which is a constant dynamically
sized array of object A</li>
<li>One of the constructors for class B will take a constant reference to
a Class A object which will be used to set the array in class B</li>
</ul>

<p>class B:</p>

<pre><code>class B
{
  private:
    const A** theArray;
  public:
    B(const A&amp;);
};

B::B(const A&amp; newA)
  : theArray(newA) //&lt;-- ??
{
}
</code></pre>

<p>when I try to compile the program I get an error saying ""cannot convert from 'const A' to 'const A **' ""</p>

<p>How would I pass an object into the member intializer list so I could make a an array out of them?</p>

<p>thanks in advance</p>

<p>edit 1:
this is for a comsci class assignment. We're learning about classes right now and the assignment has us creating three separate constructors for this particular class (a copy constructor; one to add a new A object into 'theArray' in class B; and a constructor that add the first A object into 'theArray'(this is the constructor in question).) </p>

<p>The idea is that you call the third constructor in the list to create an object. Then if you want to add another A object to the array you would call the second constructor. Then if you wanted a copy of the object you would use the copy constructor</p>
",1349076543,1,c++ class constructor const,assigning value to a constant dynamiclly-sized array in the constructor of a class,499359

<p>So what you should do is create another name. It's the same when using a controller and model named <code>layout</code>, because the Layout folder in <code>View</code> is already used for the layouts. So you should either come up with a clever solution with routing, or simply give it a different name.</p>

12669075,"<p>Using <code>cURL</code> will avoid some checks:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
    header(""Content-Type: audio/mpeg"");

    $text = urlencode('my text');
    $url = ""http://translate.google.com/translate_tts?ie=utf-8&amp;tl=en&amp;q="".$text;
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, ""Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1)"");
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 60);
    $return = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);

    echo $return;
?&gt;
</code></pre>

",1349076570,0,php google text-to-speech,Google tts api giving me blank mp3,204701
12669076,"<p>There are a few difference between the two:</p>

<ul>
<li><p><a href=""http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/net/InetAddress.html#getCanonicalHostName%28%29"" rel=""nofollow""><code>getCanonicalHostName()</code></a> will attempt to resolve the <a href=""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fully_qualified_domain_name"" rel=""nofollow"">FQDN</a>. Therefore, you would get <em>foo.mycompany.com</em> whereas <a href=""http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/net/InetAddress.html#getHostAddress%28%29"" rel=""nofollow""><code>getHostName()</code></a> might just return <em>foo</em>.</p></li>
<li><p><code>getCanonicalHostName()</code> will always do a reverse DNS lookup, whereas <code>getHostName()</code> would return the stored hostname if you supplied one in the <code>InetAddress</code> constructor.</p></li>
</ul>

<p>I suspect you will be wanting to use <code>getCanonicalHostName()</code> if you are intending to map IP addresses to host names.</p>
",1349081741,12670170,True,"<p>Can anyone please explain me the difference between Host Name and Canonical Host Name?</p>

<p>I am currently using InetAddress class to fetch host name using the IP Address. I came across these 2 APIs.
So I am just wondering, which one I should opt for? </p>
",1349076573,3,java ip-address hostname inetaddress canonical-name,Host Name Vs Canonical Host Name,474189
12669077,"<p>Using mod_rewrite:</p>

<pre><code>RewriteRule ^/?.+$ / [L,R]
</code></pre>

<p>Using mod_alias:</p>

<pre><code>RedirectMatch ^/.+ /
</code></pre>

<p>This will,m of course, render the <code>RewriteRule admin/$ index.php?view=admin [QSA]</code> rule useless, or at the very least, cause some conflicts. So you should either comment that rule out, or create a special exception where all traffic except <code>admin/</code> gets redirected.</p>

<hr>

<p>EDIT:</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>How Im gonna do that to make an rule except admin/ ?</p>
</blockquote>

<p>Here's one way to do it, I'm only guessing that this is the behavior you want. This stuff does not change, it's fine the way it is:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;Files .htaccess&gt;
order allow,deny
deny from all
&lt;/Files&gt;
Options +FollowSymLinks -Indexes
</code></pre>

<p>Add a:</p>

<pre><code>RewriteEngine On
</code></pre>

<p>Then:</p>

<pre><code>RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^/(index\.php|admin)
RewriteRule ^/?.+$ / [L,R]

RewriteRule admin/$ index.php?view=admin [QSA,L]
</code></pre>

<p>So putting all that together, you have the <strong>deny</strong> for accessing <em>.htaccess</em> files. Then you have your <code>Options</code>, then your rewrite rules. You need to turn the RewriteEngine on, then <strong>redirect</strong> any request that isn't <code>/index.php</code> or <code>/admin</code>, then <em>internally rewrite</em> <code>/admin</code> to <code>/index.php</code>.</p>
",1349080282,12669847,True,"<p>I have tinycms application and how could I forward all traffic to document root?</p>

<p>Example:</p>

<pre><code>http://&lt;IP-address&gt;/ADFADSF/adsfadsf --&gt; /
http://domain.com/adsf --&gt; /
</code></pre>

<p>Currently, I have this in my .htaccess</p>

<pre><code>&lt;Files .htaccess&gt;
order allow,deny
deny from all
&lt;/Files&gt;
Options +FollowSymLinks
RewriteRule admin/$ index.php?view=admin [QSA]
Options -Indexes
</code></pre>

<p>Thanks.
James</p>

12669091,"<p>I think that your index exceeds matrix dimensions.</p>

<p>Specificaly in the following line: </p>

<pre><code>y(c)-y(c+1)
</code></pre>

<p>on the last iteration, when c=m, the second term y(c+1) tries to access an element that doesn't exist.</p>

<p>Suggestion: change your stop condition to:</p>

<pre><code>c&lt;m
</code></pre>
